loans.name: Jhoana Veronica

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoana C. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive por el sector de Tototacocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus iglesias, su gastronomía y muchos encantos más que hacen de esta una ciudad especial.

Nuestra socia tiene 23 años es casada y tiene 1 hija de 3 años de edad, su esposo es policía, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Jhoana por el momento no trabaja, es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidando de su hija. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo realizando los créditos en la fundación, fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que siempre luchan por sus sueños y objetivos, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.

Su meta es seguir estudiando para graduarse de profesora.
texts.en:
Ms. Jhoana C. is a memeber of the Banco Comunal Buscando el Éxito (Looking for Success Communal Bank). She lives in the Tototacocha sector of the town of Cuenca. This town is renowned for its architectural beauty, its churches, its gastronomy and many other charms that make this town special. She is 23 years old, she is married and she has a 1 year-old daughter. Her husband is a policeman; they do not have a house of their own and so they rent the one they live in. Ms. Jhoana is temporarily unemployed: she is a housewife and dedicates herself to the caring of her daughter. This is her second cycle of loans with this institution. She was invited by her mother to form part of this group of women always fighting to reach their goals and make their dreams come true; the loan she is requesting will be used to buy provisions for her family. Her goal is to keep on studying to become a professor.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Bertha Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora Bertha C. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive en la parroquia de Narancay su gente se dedica a la agricultura y mucha de su población ha migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de un mejor futuro y  mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
 
La Señora. Bertha es socia del banco comunal hace 5 ciclos siendo invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este bankito de mujeres luchadoras, se dedica a la venta de café hace 10 años en el mercado 12 de Abril donde tiene un puesto propio, labora desde las 1 p.m. hasta las 6 p.m. de lunes a sábado.  El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para la remodelación de su local.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo se encuentra cursando el colegio, su esposo se dedica a la realización de carrocerías metálicas, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La meta de nuestra socia es  llegar a tener un restaurante muy grande.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha C. is a memeber of the Banco Comunal Buscando el Éxito (Looking for Success Communal Bank). She lives in the Narancay parish, whose inhabitants are mainly farmers and from where many have migrated to various places of the world looking for a better future and better job opportunities. Ms. Bertha has been a member of the communal bank for 5 cycles: she has been invited by her mother to form part of this small bank of tenacious women. She has been selling coffee for 10 years: she has her own stand in the 12 de Abril market, and she works Mondays to Saturdays from 1 pm to 6 pm. The money she is requesting will be used to remodel her shop. This borrower is 33 years old, she is married and she has 2 children aged 13 and 5; her eldest son goes to school, and her husband dedicates himself to the production of car bodyworks. They do not have a house of their own, so they rent the own they live in. This borrower’s goal is to succeed in opening a very big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel her shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, tiene 42 años, está casada con Mario de 50 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en su vivienda propia, en plena carretera central en San Ramón - Tarma. Sus hijos, son quienes la motivan siempre a salir adelante, por eso cada día, desde las 5 de la mañana abre las puertas de su bodega para atender a sus clientes. Lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que le gusta atender de manera cordial a la gente que ingresa a su local, además procura tener su tienda surtida de productos, de esa manera su trabajo le ha resultado rentable, ya que le ha ayudado a cubrir los gastos domésticos. Por otro lado su esposo se dedica en el cultivo de frutas cítricas, pero en los días que descansa, ayuda a Margarita en la atención de los clientes, al igual que sus hijos que también la apoyan, además él es el encargado de cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Por ahora juntos ahorran para incrementar su negocio con la venta útiles de escritorio, productos de belleza y para el hogar. Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de laborar en su grupo comunal, puesto esta conformado por personas muy responsables y honestas.Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad, para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Margarita is 42 years old. She is married to Mario, who is 50 years old, and they have 3 children together. They live in their own home on the San Ramón-Tarma Central Highway. Her children are what motivate her to get ahead. For this reason she opens her shop doors every day at 5 am to tend to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years and she likes to wait on the people that come into her store in a cordial manner. She also tries to keep her store well-stocked and this has made her business profitable, which in turn, helps cover the household expenses. Her husband grows citrus fruits, but on the days that he has a break, he helps Margarita wait on her customers. Their children help as well. He is also in charge of covering their children's educational expenses. Right now they are saving in order to increase their business by selling stationary and beauty and household products. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is happy to be working with the honest and very responsible people in her communal group. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of food and basic necessity items in order to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of products with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Rutilio

texts.es:
El sr. Rutilio S. V. tiene 58 años de edad, es padre soltero y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad. Reside en la Colonia El Recreo ubicada en Juticalpa. Es miembro del Grupo Solidario Nazareth. Desde 1974 se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.  Comenzo comprando a Sor. Maria y decidio vender porque no tenia otro ingreso.  Ahorra compra los fardos en Coincal y el y su Mama atienden el negocio.  Su Mama maneja los precios y el sale los Sabados y Domingos para vender. 

Con el prestamo de 20,000 Lempiras se construira una pila de abastecimiento de agua y hara una fundacion de concreto en el lugar donde esta ubicado el parqueo de su casa.  Con las mejoras cambiara el ambiente y valor de la propiedad.  

Actualmente su Mama ha estado enferma y ha tenido que pagar gastos medicos y manejar el negocio solo.  Su sueno es superarse y duplicar las ventas y que su casa se vea mejor.
texts.en:
Rutilio S. V. is 58 years old. He is a single father with two children, aged 11 and 7. He lives in the residential development El Recreo in Juticalpa. He is a member of the Nazareth Solidarity Group. Since 1974, Rutilio has sold second-hand clothing. He began buying clothes for Sister Maria and decided to begin selling them because he had no other means of income. Now he buys bundles of clothes en Coincal to sell. He and his mother manage the business. His mother is in charge of the pricing, and he leaves Saturdays and Sundays to sell clothing. With a loan of 20,000 lempiras, he will build a basin for water supply and lay a concrete driveway outside his home. The improvements will change the feeling of the house and increase the property value. Rutilio's mother has been sick lately, and Rutilio has had to pay her medical costs and manage the business by himself. His goals are to better himself, double his house, and improve the look of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for water basin

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María C. es socia del banco comunal Buscando el Éxito, vive por el sector del mercado 12 de Abril en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus iglesias, su gastronomía y muchos encantos más que hacen de esta una ciudad especial.

Nuestra socia tiene de 53 años de edad es madre soltera y con su trabajo ha logrado criar a sus 5 hijos quienes  ya son todos mayores de edad, 2 casados y 3 solteros todos trabajan y viven de manera independiente,  sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, no tiene  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y confitería en las escuelas de lunes a viernes, entrega su producto en los bares de las escuelas y también vende en las entradas y salidas de los mismos, los fines de semana vende su producto en distintas parroquias, esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años, una amiga que es socia del bankito le ha invitado a la misma y agradece mucho ya que los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando mas frutas y confitería.

Su meta es tener su casa propia y también llegar a tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Señora María C. is a member of the Buscando el Éxito (Seeking Success) Community Bank. She lives in the 12 de Abril Market area of Cuenca, a city famous for its beautiful architecture, churches, excellent food, and other attractions. María is 53 years old and a single mother. Through hard work, she has managed to raise five children, all of whom are now adults. Two are married, and three are single. They all have jobs and live away from home but help their mother financially. María does not own a home so she rents accommodation. María earns her living by selling fruit and candy in schools during the week. She delivers her products to the school shops and also sells the goods at the gates of the schools. At weekends she travels to different parishes to make her sales. She’s been doing this work for thirty years. Three years ago a friend, who is a member of the Bank, invited her to join. She is very grateful as the loans have helped her with the business. This new loan will be used to buy more fruit and candy. María’s goal is to own a house and to have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Maria Belarmina

texts.es:
María Belarmina, tiene 40 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, es viuda tiene tres hijos que dependen económicamente de ella y sus edades son  de 12, 15,18 años, su negocio es la venta de tortilla y Pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso, Carne).
Ella comenzó vendiendo enchiladas y pasteles de papas, con sus ahorros comenzó sus negocio de pupusa y tortillas, trabaja de lunes a domingo y por el transcurso de 8:00 a 4: 00 vende tortillas y por la tarde vende pupusas, este negocio es el apoyo económico con que cuenta la familia.
María necesita un préstamo para comprar por mayor Maíz, que lo obtendra a un precio menor, y otros productos como son queso, carne de cerdo, aceite, este dinero le servirá para compra de materiales y continuar con el negocio, solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar con su negocio, para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
40-year old María Belarmina lives in the municipality of Nueva Guadalupe in the department of San Miguel. She is a widow and has three children aged 12, 15, and 18 who are dependent upon her. She earns her living by selling tortillas and pupusas (corn tortillas served with cheese or meat). María started out selling enchiladas and potato cakes. Using her savings, she began her pupusa and tortilla business. She works every day of the week; from 8am to 4pm she sells tortillas, and then in the late afternoon sells pupusas. The money she earns supports the family. María needs a loan to buy corn in quantity so that she is charged a lower price, as well as other products such as cheese, pork, and oil. The money will help pay for goods for her business and basic necessities for her family. Her hopes for the future include continuing with her business so that she can help her children get an education and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork, and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy: corn, propane gas, wood, lime, pork, cheese

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es casada, tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando, Sonia vende gorros, sombreros de manera ambulatoria en el mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días durante la mañana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gorras.
Los sueños de Sonia son tener un puesto donde venda sus productos, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y construir su casa de material noble porque el que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Sonia is married, she has four children that are in school. Sonia sells a variety of hats on foot in the central market of Ayacucho, an activity that she does every day during the morning. She acquires her products in Lima. Sonia belongs to the communal bank of Santa Rita and is soliciting a loan of 800 Soles that will be invested in the purchase of hats. Sonia's dreams are to have a place to sell her products, for her children to complete their studies and to build a house of good materials because her house is rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hats

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Karina es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 4 meses, vive en casa alquilada, Karina tiene 2 puestos en el mercado 12 de abril, uno de ellos es de su propiedad, en donde vende ropa variada productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, Karina inicio su negocio hace 3 años como ambulante y ahora tiene puestos estables.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos para la construcción de su casa.
Los sueños de Karina son terminar de construir su casa y tener un taller de confección de ropas.
texts.en:
Karina is a partner in the communal bank Santa Rita Karina lives with her partner and she has one son who is four months old. They live in a rented house. Karina has two stalls in the market "12th of April," at one of the stalls she sells a variety of clothing and products that she acquires in the city of Lima, an activity that she does with her husband. Karina began her business three years ago, selling her products on foot and now she has these stalls. Karina needs a loan of 1800 Soles that she will invest in the purchase of bricks for the construction of a house. Karina's dreams are to finish building her house and to have a dress making shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks for the construcion of her house.

loans.name: Fuelina

texts.es:
Fuelina es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Fuelina tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara en donD. venD. mercería como jabones, cuchillos y algunos artículos D. ferretería, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos, además Fuelina venD. sus productos en la feria D. San Juan los días domingos.
Fuelina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. jabones, cables D. luz.
Fuelina sueña con tener una tienda D. venta al por mayor, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Fuelina is a widow, and she has four children who go to school. Fuelina has a stand selling merchandise like soaps, knives, and some hardware items in the Santa Clara market. She does this activity everyday with her children’s help. Fuelina also sells her products at the San Juan fair every Sunday. Fuelina is a member of the Santa Rita Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles, which she will use to buy soaps and light cables. Fuelina dreams of having a wholesale store, giving her children a good education, and continuing to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps and light cables

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Bertha es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Bertha confecciona ropa típica como fustanes, enaguas, que elabora en su casa, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región y de las ferias compra quesos, ajo y animales menores que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Bertha tiene 2 mototaxis, uno de ellos es alquilado y con el otro trabaja su esposo.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos y animales menores.
El sueño de Bertha son comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Santa Rita Communal Bank. She is married and has 4 school age children. She makes traditional clothing such as skirts and traditional petticoats.

She makes these in her house and carries out her sales in the region’s different markets. At the markets, she purchases cheeses, garlic, and young animals that she sells in markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Bertha has 2 mototaxis, one of which is rented out. Her husband works with the other.

Bertha needs a loan of 2000 soles. The money will be invested in the purchase of cheese and young animals. Bertha dreams of buying a car for the work of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cheeses and young animals.

loans.name: Cleide

texts.es:
Cleide es casada y tiene 2 hijas que estudian, Cleide junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería llamada Carlitos, fabrican los muebles según pedido de sus clientes, tienen 2 ayudantes y Cleide ayuda en el lijado y laqueado de los productos. Cleide tiene proyectado comprar un carro para facilitar el traslado de los muebles. Además Cleide trabaja en una empresa privada.
Cleide es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita y solicita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
texts.en:
Cleide is married and has two children who are both in school. Cleide, along with her husband, have a carpentry shop named "Carlitos". They make furniture according to the requests of their clients. They have two assistance and Cleide helps in the sanding and laquering of the products. Cleide plans to buy a car to faciliate the transportation of the furniture. Cliede also works in a private business. Cleide is a partner in the communal bank Santa Rita and is seeking a loan of 1800 Soles that she will invest in the purchase of wood.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.
Berta es casada y tiene 2 hijas que ya son independientes, Berta tiene un taller de confección en su casa en donde confecciona ropa típica, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, sus productos los vende en el mercado, además Berta vende comida típica los días domingos en su casa.
Berta solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Berta son comprar un carro para que realice transporte publico y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the communal bank Santa Rita. Berta is married and has two children who are already independent. Berta has a sewing studio in her house where she makes traditional clothing, an activity that she does with her husband. They sell their products in the market, also Berta sells typical foods on Sundays in her house. Berta is seeking a loan of 1000 Soles that she will invest in the purchase of fabrics. Berta's dreams are to buy a car to provide transportation and to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa V. is from the village of Gubaan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Elsa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as sugar, noodles, biscuits, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel R. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 45 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Hazel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Hazel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely J. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Emely owns and operates a business providing motorcycle services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Emely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan M., 30, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Joseph M., an operator, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store while overseeing operations of their own tricycle transport business.

Joan has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store and tricycle businesses.

To ensure the success of her variety store business, Joan would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages to be incorporated into her current product inventory to replenish her stocks.

Joan dreams that her businesses will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages for her store

loans.name: Sam Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. was selected group leader by a group of five people who live in In Svay Ta Ok-I village in Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that will improve their businesses.

Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. is widow with one child. She is a second-hand clothes seller at her local market where she earns a little money to support her family. Now that her business is going well, she wants to expand. To improve her business Mrs. Sam Oeurn N. is asking for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza D. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 26 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Edeliza owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products like chairs, lantays (bamboo beds) and dividers to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Edeliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Edeliza plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. S. is from the village of Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is serving the many costumers in this market. Amarjargal has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. Every day she takes care to clean her restrooms. This group loan consists of four people who live in Reang Chuor village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ang P. is the group leader, Each member will use their portion of their loan for different purposes to improve their living.

Mrs. Ang P. was born in 1960 and she is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to earn some money to support her family. But now she has some problems because her field is infertile soil and it is far away from any irrigation system.

To improve production, Mrs. Ang P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a widow with a child who is a farming laborer and helps her with her farming too.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy D. R. aims to graduate her four children from college and to improve the standard of living for her family. When she joined ASHI in 2007, the vision of her hopes becomes clearer and reachable instead of an uncertain feeling towards achieving her dreams. Because of the loan she has receive through ASHI, she and her husband are able to have their own small upholstery shop in their own house. While Lucy is in charge of managing the cash flow of the business as well as the budget of the family, her husband is the one in charge to operating the business. With their small cash flow in the business, Lucy cannot afford yet to employ other people to work with her husband. Sometimes she feels unhappy seeing her husband work so hard from early in the morning to the end of the day however, with her husband’s determination to help her improve their life and to provide the needs of her children, she regains strength. 

With the loan Lucy is requesting from KIVA, an ASHI partner, she hopes to grow her business until such time as she can afford to employ other workers and rent a space for her shop in the market to be able to acquire more costumers. She must also support the education and other needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipments for upholstery.

texts.en:
Myagmardorj is operating an internet and PC game cafe in the busy center of the city. He is 32 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in a small rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He began his business in 2007 when he saw a great market opportunity, as many local young people were really getting into internet surfing and computer games. He is planning on expanding his business by adding more computers so that he can accommodate more customers. 

Myagmardorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase replacement computer parts and upgrade his internet speed. In the future he wants to open more internet cafes.

loans.use: to purchase replacement computer parts and upgrade his internet speed

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
At the age of 55 years old, Concepcion F. wants to start a savings fund for her old age. She can’t depend on her children for all her needs as well as her husband’s needs in their older years, because she is aware of the economic conditions of having their own family. 

Her two older children are employed as a hired farmer and as a hired laborer whose incomes are small and sporadic. Concepcion wants to support them and their children financially. She really hopes that someday her grandchildren will be able to have a life that is much better than what they are having now. Concepcion’s two younger children have no family yet, and they depend on all of their needs to be supported by their parents. They are unemployed because of the fact that either they did not finish college or that they never reached college level. 

With all the challenges Concepcion and her family are facing everyday of their lives, she never loses hope that one day all of them will be out from under the umbrella of poverty. Starting to reach her goals, she raises pigs for selling after four months, either alive or slaughtered. This is financed by the loans she receives from ASHI where she has been a member since 2008. 

Proceeds from her business have changed the kind of life experienced by her family. Concepcion is very happy for this; thus, she wants to continuously request larger loans to grow her business and sustain its operation.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for fattening and selling
