Por la necesidad de ingresos  ella decidió iniciar el negocio el cual lleva cuatro años de manejarlo ya que en la única tienda por la zona, el negocio a prosperado, atiende en un horario de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm sus clientes son vecinos y personas que residen por la zona.
Actualmente Sonia solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos como son Azúcar, bebidas carbonatadas, boquitas  como churros  y otros, este dinero le ayudara a solventar la demanda de sus clientes, obtener más ingresos y solventar las necesidades familiares. 
Las aspiraciones de  Sonia son, ver crecer su negocio y con las ganancias que obtenga arreglar la casa de habitación y apoyar a sus hijos dándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
To earn an income, Sonia decided to start a business, which she has been managing for four years. Since hers is the only store in the area, it has done well. She works from 6 am to 8 pm. Her customers are her neighbors and people that live in the area. Sonia is requesting the loan in order to acquire products such as sugar, carbonated drinks, and snacks such as churros, among others. The loan will help her respond to the demand of her clients, earn a higher income, as well as help in meeting her family's needs. Sonia hopes to see her business grow and with the money she earns she hopes fix up her house and support her children by offering them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, carbonated drinks, snacks such as churros, among others

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María del Transito tiene 47 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es soltera y vive con la madre, tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella heredo el negocio de la madre  y tiene 10 años de administrarlo, atiende a sus clientes  en un horario de 7:00 am - 8:00 pm, sus clientes son vecinos y personas que circulan por la zona, actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos, tales como son detergente y productos que le demandan sus clientes, esto contribuirá a tener más articulos, atraer clientes y generar  ingresos que son el principal sostenimiento de esta familia.
Las aspiraciones de María son continuar con su negocio, aprovechar la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María del Tránsito, 47, lives in San Miguel. She’s single and lives with her mother. She has a grocery store. She inherited the store from her mother and has been running it for 10 years. She is open for business from 7am-8pm. Her customers are neighbors and people who wander though the area. She is asking for funds to buy stock items, like detergent, that her customers ask for. This will allow her to have more items available, attract more customers and generate income which is her family’s main source of support. María’s aspirations are to continue with her store, to take advantage of the opportunity to invest in it and to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent.

loans.name: God’S Time Is The Best Group

texts.en:
Augustine M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Time Is The Best.

He is 42 years old, married and has three children who range from 10 to 15 years old. He holds an Associate of Arts degree.
  
For 10 years, he has been operating a tea shop, selling bread and tea, in V.I Community, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 35,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more sugar, packs of tea, milk, bread, eggs etc.

He describes himself as earnest.

His goal is to improve his business, build a store and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, packs of tea, milk, bread, eggs etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia trabaja como empleada domestica en la zona sur, su esposo trabaja en el interior como albañil, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la  manutención de sus tres hijos, tiene su casa propia ubicado en  la zona 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción, para continuar trabajando en su vivienda.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Alicia works as a maid in the southern region and her husband works as a builder. With their income they support their three children. She owns her house, which is in the 16 de febrero zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to continue working on her home. It is her third loan with IMPRO. Making her payments responsibly has made it possible to be approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the cost of construction materials to continue work on her home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene su tienda de abarrotes de barrio, en la zona de Rio Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su dos hijos que depende de ella, vive en su casa propia  ubicado en la zona Las Viviendas de la misma ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo solicitado por Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa has her neighborhood grocery store in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. It is her main source of income that allows her to support her two children who depend on her. She lives in her own home located in the Las Viviendas area of the same city. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for the store in order to generate higher income. This is her 4th loan with IMPRO. Her good repayment history qualifies Rosa for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items like bread, beverages and candy for her grocery store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro trabaja de transportista; tiene una movilidad de servicio publico Taxi en la ciudad de La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su hijo y esposa; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona de 1ro de Mayo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su motor para su movilidad y así continuar trabajando.
 
Es el tercer crédito vía KIVA, el buen comportamiento de pago y la buena inversión de coedito anterior le faculta la aprobación de otro  préstamo solicitado por Pedro.
texts.en:
Pedro works providing public transportation services; he drives a taxi in La Paz. It is his main source of income with which he supports his wife and son. He has his own house located in the 1 de Mayo neighborhood of the city of El Alto. He will use the loan to pay for his vehicle’s engine maintenance so that he can continue to work. This is his 3rd loan through KIVA. His good repayment history and good investment of the previous loans make Pedro eligible for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Kagabi Multi-Purpose-Mpigi Group

texts.en: K. Twaha, 43 years old, has for the last 8 years diligently operated his lucrative timber sales business in Kasubi-Mpigi. With 200,000 UGX as weekly profits, he has come a long way in establishing himself. He has improved both his business and his family's welfare. Being a family oriented man, he has gone out of his way to ensure that he gives his children a worthwhile education. He began as a lumberjack and bakery worker before he ventured into timber sales. He also ekes out profits from a small farming business. He is married with 6 children. With this loan, he wants to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more timber

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca tiene y atiende dos canchas deportivas de Waly en el domicilio de un familiar donde tiene su puesto de venta de refresco, helados y golosinas, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo que depende de ella; vive con su madre en la zona villa tejada Triangular de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería para el puesto de venta y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Blanca.
texts.en:
Blanca has two Wally sports courts at a relative’s address where she sells snacks like soft-drinks, frozen treats and sweets. This is her source of income with which she supports her young son who depends on her. She lives with her mother in the Villa Tejada Triangular area of the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy stock items for her stand so that she can generate higher income. This is her 1st loan with IMPRO. The evaluation she underwent indicates that Blanca qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, frozen treats and candy for her stand that she has at the Wally raquetball courts.

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir trabaja como ayudante en una carpintería en aluminio; también es estudiante de la Universidad UPEA (Universidad Pública de El Alto); no tiene familia, vive solo en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de una computadora para realizar sus trabajos en la universidad.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago y la buena inversión de coedito anterior le faculta la aprobación de otro  préstamo solicitado por Bladimir.
texts.en:
Bladimir is employed as an assistant in an aluminum carpentry shop. He is also enrolled at the UPEA University (El Alto Public University). He has no family. He lives alone in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. He will use the funds to buy a computer for his university work. This is his 3rd loan with IMPRO. His good repayment history and investment of previous loan qualifies Bladimir for the new requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.name: Take Time Group

texts.en:
Nathan J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Take Time.  He is 33 years old, married, and has three children who range from 1 to 3 years old. He was able to attend school only through 9th grade due to lack of support.
  
For four years, he has been running a transportation service with a motorbike in Belefana, Bong County, central Liberia.

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to buy more petroleum products and spare parts. He describes himself as jovial.

His goal is to expand his business and own more motorbikes

loans.use: To buy more petroleum products and spare parts

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía trabaja como comerciante de comida (vivandera), tiene 4 hijos todos están a su cargo, su esposo es cerrajero quien ayuda en la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona villa Ingenio  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de  víveres por cantidad  para su actividad el comercio de comida.
 
Es cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Epifanía works selling prepared meals. She has four children under her care. Her husband is a locksmith and he helps support the family. Her home is in the Villa Ingenio area of the city of El Alto. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals at wholesale. This is her 4th loan with Impro. Her good repayment history allows her to request a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase textile fabric to make more clothes to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es empleado. Trabaja en la Iglesia del cementerio general de la ciudad de La Paz, su esposa vende víveres a crédito. Es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la  zona urbanización Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material de construcción con lo que podrá refaccionar su vivienda.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Oscar works for the Church of the General Cemetery in La Paz. His wife works selling food on accounts. This is his main source of income with which he supports his family. His home is located in the urban area of Mercurio in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for remodeling his home. This is his first loan with Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for remodeling his home

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira tiene 52 años de edad, está casada hace mas de 25 años, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  algunos viven con ella y otros ya formaron su propia familia.
 La señora Edelmira emigró de la ciudad de Caraguataity a un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Itá hace 21 años en busca de mejorar su nivel de vida.
Una vez instalada en dicha ciudad abrió una pequeña despensa donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales de carne, leche, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general, panificados y otros insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar hace mas de 15 años.
El préstamo que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de los citados insumos a modo a aumentar su stock de mercaderías y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Edelmira, 52, has been married for over 25 years. She has 7 children some of whom still live with her and some who have formed their own families. Edelmira moved from the city of Caraguataity to a crowded neighborhood in the city of Itá 21 years ago seeking to improve her living conditions. Once established in this city, she opened a small grocery store over 15 years ago where she provides her neighbors and drop-in customers with meat, milk, sugar, herbs, beverages, baked goods and other basic items for the home. The loan she is requesting on this occasion will be used to buy the items listed above in order to increase her stock inventory thereby improving family income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, assorted beverages and other merchandise.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es Artesano Carpintero los muebles que fabrica los vende en la feria de la 16 de julio de la ciudad del alto,  es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia. El vive con su papá y su hijo Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra madera y mantenimiento de herramientas.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Julio is a woodworker. He sells the furniture that he makes at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto. It is his principal source of income, with which he provides for his family. He lives with his father and his son. His home is located in the Cooperativa neighborhood of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used for buying wood and maintaining his tools. This is his second loan with Impro; his good payment record allows him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and maintenance of his tools for his woodworking business

loans.name: We Will Do It Group

texts.en:
Nathaniel G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called We Will DO It. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 4 and 8. He was able to attend school only through 10th grade due to lack of support.
  
For two years, he has been involved with making and selling soap in Pelele Town, Bong County, central Liberia.

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to buy more red oil and caustic used in the soap production.

He describes himself as hardworking. His dream is to expand his business and become a wholesaler.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is inset at lower right because she was absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more red oil and caustic used in the soap production.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Miguel de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Mayli de 5 años y Franz de apenas 2 meses de nacido, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, Rosmery sale a trabajar en sus campos agrícolas, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa y la alverja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectar la producción. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery, 24, is a young mother. She is very unassuming and hard working. She lives in a rented house with her husband, Miguel, 34, and their two beloved young children: Mayli, 5, and Franz, 2 months. They are the motivating force behind all her efforts. Rosmery rises very early every day to go out to work her fields. For her, there is no such thing as a day off because she must tend to her fields continuously in order to have a good crop yield. Her main crops are potato and broad bean which she sells at wholesale in the city of Tarma. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has working the fields because she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from pests that can affect production. For the future, she’d like to purchase additional fields in order to increase production. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with repayments and expects to be so again. She is held in high esteem in her communal group. She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy more manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more manure to improve her crops.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció trabaja como empleada y su esposo es artesano zapatero, tiene 6 hijos tres están a su cargo y los demás son independientes. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona Rió Seco  de la ciudad del Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de  material de construcción para refaccionar su vivienda.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis de ingresos y egresos muestra su capacidad de pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rocio works as a maid and husband is a shoemaker. She has six children. Three live at home and the other three are now independent. Her home is located in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials for remodeling her home. This is his her first loan with Impro. The analysis of her income and expenses shows her ability to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials which are to be used in renovating her home.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la  zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de la Paz; Marcos trabaja en  una cooperativa y el crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora para su hijo mayor, y de esta manera pueda culminar sus estudios.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de  Impro y por el carácter social y el flujo de fondos analizado puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Marcos lives in his own home with his wife and children in La Paz’s Alto San Pedro neighborhood. He works for a cooperative and will use the requested funds to buy his oldest son a computer so that he can complete his studies. This is the first time he’s asked Impro for a loan. His social characteristics and cash flow analysis qualifies him for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his oldest son a computer.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es casada con hijos y viven en casa propia en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Julia vende comida; esta actividad produce ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para comprar sus insumos por cantidad y así poder bajar sus costos y a la vez tener mas ingresos para su familia.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Julia is married and has children. They live in their own house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. Julia sells food. This activity produces income for her home. The requested loan is to buy her supplies in quantities to be able to reduce the costs. At the same time, she will have more income for her family. This is the third time she has requested a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies in bulk for her food preparation business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Born in 1987, Martha M. is married and has three children. She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE. She explained how good it is for a woman to work for herself and care for the children, even if her work is just the buying and selling of cocoa yams (a root vegetable also known as taro). 

Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their apprenticeships so that they may learn a trade. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital that could give her a higher income to meet her children’s needs and those of the family. 

With this loan of 200,000 XAF, she plans to buy cocoa yams, groundnuts and other products to sell. This investment will help people in her community buy their food right at their doorsteps. She will also greatly help the poor who will not have to travel as far to purchase their daily needs. She is planning to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. 

She plans to pay the loan within 12 months. The first installment repayment shall start on the same day of disbursal.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of groundnuts, cocoa yams, cassava and palm oil

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es:
La señora Marisabel vive con su madre y su hijo en casa propia en la  zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Marisabel  trabaja en una empresa de limpieza. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un horno y poder hacer pan y otros para vender y así poder mejorar sus ingreso familiares.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Marisabel lives with her mother and her son in her own house. They live in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. Marisabel works for a cleaning company. The requested loan is to buy an oven to be able to make bread and other things to sell. That way she will be able to improve the family income. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an oven to be able to make bread and other products to improve her income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more petroleum products and spare parts.

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es:
La señora Brigith es casada  vive con su hijo en anticretico en la zona 3 de Mayo de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Brigith es comerciante sin puesto fijo, así es como obtiene sus ingresos para mantener su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumento de capital para comprar productos como contenedores de plástico, escobas, etc., y así poder tener más ingresos.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Brigith is married, and she lives with her son in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). They live in the 3 de Mayo area of the city of La Paz. Brigith is a merchant without a fixed stand. That is how she gets income to support her household. The requested loan is to increase capital in order to buy products like plastic containers and brooms, etc. That way she will be able to have more income. This is the third time she has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products like plastic containers and brooms, etc. to sell to the public

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria del Socorro tiene 65 años, tiene 5 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura, por lo que tiene muy buenos clientes y con una gran variedad, pues esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su actividad. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de hilos, tijeras, agujas, telas alfileres entre otros actualmente tiene bastante encargos que tiene que cumplirlos es por eso que solicita este financiamiento. Por lo que sueña con seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Socorro, 65, has five children who work independently. She is a seamstress and has a good variety of regular customers. This isn’t her first loan with the Fundación; they have been of great help to her in her work activity. This capital will be used to buy thread, scissors, needles, fabric, pins, etc. She currently has quite a few orders pending that she needs to fill thus the need for the loan. She dreams with continued growth in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread, scissors, fabric, pins, etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Erick de 32 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. La actividad a la que Soledad se dedica es la venta de leña, siendo este material muy solicitado por sus clientes. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad, le ha sido rentable por lo que desea incrementarse de este material y aumentar sus ganancias, ya que su anhelo y prioridad es pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos, a quienes cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no les falte nada. Disfruta conversar con sus clientes, ya que su principal estrategia de venta es la alegría y la amabilidad que tiene con ellos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo puntualmente.Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más madera para tener una buena reserva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad, 32, is a cheerful, hard-working mother. She lives in her own home with her husband, Erick, 32, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. Soledad sells firewood, a highly sought-after material by her customers. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. It has been profitable so she’d like to increase her supplies of this material and thereby increase her profits because her greatest wish is to be able to afford to pay for her children’s higher education. She cares for her children very lovingly and she’s always careful to see that they lack nothing. She enjoys chatting with her customers since her main sales strategy is the good cheer and the kindness with which she treats them. This is her 6th loan with MFP. She is happy to have gotten it and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more wood so that she’ll have a good reserve stock available.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more wood in order to have a reserve stock available.

loans.name: Annet Nalongo

texts.en: N. Nalongo Annet has been running her own grocery store and supermarket in London College, Maya-Mpigi for 9 years. Her current business is a far cry from her first small business designing school compounds. Her success story is a testimony to the fact that with hard work, good planning and support from friends, one can always have their stars and stripes. She still does compound designing though it’s now second fiddle to her main business. She is happily married with 13 children. In a week, she makes profits that add up to 700,000 UGX. With this loan, she is planning on buying a fridge and other groceries for her supermarket.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and additional groceries for her store

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Janeth es soltera vive en anticretico en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Janeth  tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes y otros insumos de donde tiene ingresos para mantener  su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el aumento de capital para comprar más productos  para mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Janeth is single and lives in a rented home in the Sopocachi neighborhood of the city of La Paz. Janeth has a store where she sells groceries and other supplies, and from which she earns income to support her household. The loan requested is to increase her capital so that she can buy more products to increase her income. This is the first time that she has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis carried out by this institution qualified her favorably to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia  es viuda vive con su hijo en casa propia en la zona tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Eulalia tiene ingresos de renta y además se dedica a la venta de comida mejorando así la calidad de vida de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de insumos por cantidad para su negocio de venta de comida y no comprar al por menor y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Eulalia is widowed and lives with her son her home, which she owns, in the earthquake prone area of La Paz. Eulalia has rental income and also sells food, thus improving her quality of life in her home. The loan will be used to purchase supplies for her food business. By not buying retail goods she will be able to increase her earnings. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The financial analysis carried out shows that she is qualified to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Junior F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. He is 31 years old, married, and has four children who range from 3 to 13 years old. He was able to attend school only through 9th grade due to poverty.
  
For two years, he has been selling batteries, soft drinks, candles, soap, cremes and so on in Pelele Town, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 4,000 LRD portion of this 20,000 LRD group loan to buy more batteries, soft drinks, candles, soaps, cremes, etc.

He describes himself as friendly. His dream is to expand his business and open a store.

loans.use: To buy more batteries, soft drinks, candles, soaps, cremes etc.

loans.name: Russel

texts.es:
La señora Russel es casada vive con su esposo e hijos en anticretico, en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Russel es empleada y a la vez comercializa con material de ferretería de los cuales tiene ingresos con los que mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando mas material y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Russel is married and lives with her husband and children in anticretico (a rental arrangement in which the property owner is paid the rent in a lump sum, which is returned at the end of the rental period), in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. Mrs. Russel is employed and also sells hardware supplies, which provides her income to maintain her home. The requested loan is to increase her working capital by purchasing more supplies, thus making it possible for her to increase her income. This is her second loan request, and the completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale hardware supplies for retail sales.

loans.name: Martha Angelina

texts.es:
Martha Angelina B. tiene 29 anos de edad, es trabajadora, casada y tiene una hija de 4 anos.  Vive en Barrio La Soledad en Juticalpa, Olancho y es miembro del Grupo Solidario Luz y Unidad.  Tiene una pequena pulperia donde trabaja cada dia desde 6 de la manana hasta las 9 de la noche.  Hace 4 anos comenzo alquilando y sus ventas han ido creciendo y ahora tiene su propia casa.  Su esposo trabaja y le apoya a veces cuando bajan las ventas.    

Con el prestamo de 7,000 Lempiras comprara canaleta y aluzinc para unos cuartos que esta terminando y va a alquilar. Con el prestamo de mejoras de vivienda ella y su familia se sienten mas seguros en su casa y los clientes estan mas comodos.

Su sueno es surtir mas su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y apoyar a su hija en la educacion.  Martha ha tenido otros prestamos con FAMA y siempre a pagado sus cuotas puntualmente.  Los prestamos le han ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar su casa y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Angelina B. is 29 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is married and has a 4 year-old daughter. She lives in the La Soleded neighborhood of Juticalpa, Olancho and she is a member of the communal bank "Luz y Unidad." She has a small grocery store where she works every day from 6am until 9 at night. She started renting 4 years ago and her sales have been growing and now she has her own house. Her husband works and helps her out when at times her sales are low. With the loan of 7,000 Lemipiras, she will buy gutters and corrugated metal sheeting for roofing in order to finish the construction of some rooms that she is adding and is going to rent out. With the loan and the improvements to her home she and her family will feel more secure in their home and their customers will be more comfortable. Her dream is to better stock her business so that she can provide better service to her customers and support her daughter in her education. Martha has taken other loans with FAMA, and has always made her payments on time. The loans have helped her to grow her business and improve her home and her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gutters and corrugated metal sheets for roofing to finish building some rooms

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El señor Victor vive con sus padres en anticretico, vive en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Victor  trabaja como procurador en un buffet de abogados del cual tiene ingresos que mantienen su  hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de complementos de computadora.
Esta es la quinta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his parents in the Tembladerani area of La Paz under the anticrético modality (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) Víctor works as an attorney in a law firm and earns income to support his home. He will use the requested funds to buy computer accessories. This is his 5th loan request and the socio-economic evaluation conducted indicates that he qualifies favorably and may access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 25 años, es una madre muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Héctor de 26 años y su única hija Sharmely de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy pequeña Zulema aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo sobre esta actividad, hoy sola posee tierras en donde cultiva y produce alverja, papa y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que recibe la recompensa de tanto meses de arduo trabajo. Es así que tiene 4 años trabajando en el campo y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que afectan su desarrollo. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zulema, age 25, is a very unassuming and hard-working mother. She lives in a rented house with her 26 year old husband, Héctor, and their only child, three year old Sharmely. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. Since she was very small Zulema learned to work on the farm with her parents. They taught her everything about this activity. Now, she only has land where she plants and produces peas, potatoes, and carrots. She takes them the wholesale market in Tarma to sell. What she likes the most about her work is harvesting because she receives the recompense for so many months of hard work. She has been working like this in the fields for four years. She considers the most difficult part to be taking care of her crops so that the pests do not affect their development. In time she plans to buy more land to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually, and she is prepared to do so. In her communal bank she is a very happy member who is always adding humor to the group. She will use the requested 500 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to take care of her crops

loans.name: God Is There For Us. Group

texts.en:
Moses N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is There For Us. He is 60 years old, married, and has five children who range from 12 to 35 years old. He also cares for five siblings. He was able to attend school only through first grade due to poverty.
  
For three years, he has been selling red palm oil in Kollie-Wolla Town, Bong County, central Liberia. 

He plans to use his 7,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to buy more red palm oil.

He describes himself as an earnest man. His dream is to expand his business and become an exporter of red palm oil.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is inset at lower right because she absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more red palm oil.

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Comité Niño Jesús es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 12 de Junio del 2010, integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras. En este momento se encuentra trabajando muy contentas dentro del 2° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades dependiendo de las herramientas y facilidades con que cuentan. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Alcira quien se dedica a elaboración y venta de comestibles.
Con esta actividad ella obtiene ingreso diario y de esta forma le ayuda a su marido para los gasto de la familia.
Los comestibles que ella prepara los vende frente a su casa en una casilla que ella tiene.
Ella además de los comestibles también expone el trabajo de ao poi (artesanía en telas) de las demás integrantes del comité para ayudar con las ventas.
Ella solicita por su parte el crédito para la compra de ingredientes de los comestibles que ella prepara así como:
Carne de vacuna, porcino, y de pollo, también aceites, saborizantes, verduras, y otros.
texts.en:
The “Niño Jesús” (Child Jesus) committee is an excellent committee that was established on 12 June 2010. It is made up of 15 hard-working women. They are currently working in the second cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women) committee’s program. The members of this group are involved in a variety of commercial activities depending on the tools and abilities they have. One of the members is Alcira who prepares meals for sale. This activity produces daily income with which she helps her husband support the family. The meals she prepares she sells in front of her house in a small booth. Besides the meals she also displays works in ao poi (fine fabric crafts) that the other group members make in order to help with sales. She is asking for funds to buy ingredients like pork, beef, chicken, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc., for the meals she prepares.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients like: chicken, beef, pork, spices, etc.

loans.name: Only God Group

texts.en:
Kolo B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Only God.

He is 51 years old, separated, and has one child who is 35 years old. He was able to attend school only through 12th grade due to poverty. He cares for four siblings. 

For thirteen years, he has been buying and selling rubber in Plum Valley Community, Bong County, central Liberia.

He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 50,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rubber. He describes himself as peaceful.

His dream is to improve his business and become a wholesaler.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Famata is inset at lower right because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rubber

loans.name: Nuria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nuria tiene 37 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, está casada tiene dos hijos, Henry y Oscar de 18 y 16 años respectiva, su esposo es albañil y ella es empleada en el área de cocina del parque acuático Monte Grande. 
Ella trabaja como cocinera del parque acuático desde que se inicio, es la empleada más antigua, y trabaja de lunes a jueves de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm. Nuria necesita el préstamo para terminar de construir un cuarto, comprar las puertas y ventanas, que servirá de dormitorio para su hijo mayor.
Las aspiraciones de Nuria es algún día tener su propio restaurante, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nuria, 37, lives in San Miguel. She is married and has two sons: Henry and Oscar, 18 and 16 years old respectively. Her husband is a bricklayer and she works in the kitchen of the Monte Grande aquatic park. She began working as a cook in the aquatic park since it opened. She is the longest standing employee. She works Monday through Thursday from 8am to 4pm. Nuria needs the loan to finish building a room that will serve as her oldest son’s bedroom. She needs to buy windows and doors. Nuria hopes to have her own restaurant some day and improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Libia, tiene 43 años y es natural del Cusco.

Libia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Todos mis compañeros del banco comunal son personas, amigables, responsables y sobre todo son puntuales al momento de pagar sus cuotas. Yo me dedico a la venta productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales de las ciudades de Anta, Huasao y Cusco. Los días particulares distribuyo mis productos a las tiendas de las comunidades de la provincia de Anta. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar los estudios de mis hijos e hice mantenimiento de mi casa. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” (Virgen Asunta Merchants) communal bank is in its 4th cycle. It’s composed of hard-working, enterprising persons who are always looking for ways to get ahead and through their daily effort provide a better future for their children. The bank meets every thirty days in Asociación Arariwa’s central office. Libia is 43 years old and a native of Cusco. Libia relates: “We are ten members in our communal bank. They chose me to tell my personal story about my economic activity. All of the members of my communal bank are friendly, responsible and, above all, punctual persons when it comes time to pay their installments. I sell personal hygiene items and home accessories in an itinerant manner at various Saturday and Sunday markets in the cities of Anta, Huasao and Cusco. On certain days I sell my items to stores in various communities in Anta province. I have been collaborating with Asociación Arariwa for several years now and have done well. With the loans they granted and the profits earned from them I was able to pay for my children’s schooling and make some home improvements. Currently, I need funding to buy more merchandise.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Oscar, tiene 45 años y es natural del Cusco.

Oscar nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica.  Yo y mi esposa Libia nos dedicamos a la venta productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales de las ciudad de Sicuani, Huaso, Cala y Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar los estudios de mis hijos e hice mantenimiento de mi casa. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank "LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA" is presently working its 5th cycle and is set up by hard-working and entrepreneurial individuals who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort give a better future to their children. The meetings of the community bank are every thirty days in the main office of Asociación Arariwa.

Oscar is 45 years old and from Cusco.

Oscar tells us: "We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I and my wife Libia sell products for personal hygiene as well as house accessories at the Saturday and Sunday markets in the towns of Sicuani, Huaso, Cala, and Cusco. For several years I have been working with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well, with the loan and the profits I have been able to pay my children's schooling and maintain my house. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
El banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Jacinto, tiene 45 años y es natural del Cusco.

Jacinto nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a la distribución de productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa a las tiendas de la ciudad de Izcuchaca y a las comunidades de Anta y los días sábados me dedico a la venta de zapatos en el mercado Altiplano de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank "LOS COMERCIANTES DE VIRGEN ASUNTA" is presently working its 5th cycle and is set up by hard-working and entrepreneurial individuals who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with their daily effort give a better future to their children. The meetings of the community bank are every thirty days in the main office of Asociación Arariwa.

Jacinto is 45 years old and from Cusco.

Jacinto tells us: " We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I distribute products for personal hygiene and home accessories in the stores of the town of Izcuchaca and the communities of Anta and on Saturdays I sell footwear at the Altiplano market of the town of Cusco. For several years I have worked with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de Dios, tiene 39 años y es natural del Cusco.

Juan de Dios nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a la distribución de productos de aseo personal y accesorios de la casa a las tiendas de la ciudad de Izcuchaca y a las comunidades de Anta y también trabajo para el socio Jacinto, le ayudo a vender zapatos los sábados en el mercado Altiplano de la ciudad del Cusco y me paga un sueldo. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Juan de Dios is 39 years old and from Cusco.

Juan de Dios tells us: " We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I distribute products for personal hygiene and home accessories in the stores of the town of Izcuchaca and the communities of Anta and I also work for the member, Jacinto. I help him sell footwear on Saturdayes at the Altiplano market of the town of Cusco, and he pays me a salary. For several years I have worked with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well. At the moment I need the loan to buy more merchandise."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, tiene 39 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Mauro nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a la venta de zapatos de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales de la ciudad de Urubamba y Anta. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar la alimentación y educación de mis hijos. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Mauro is is 39 years old and a member of the community bank "Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta" of the Asociación Arariwa of the town of Cusco, Peru.

Mauro tells us: " We are 10 members in my community bank and I was chosen to give testimony about my economical activity. I sell footwear at the Saturday and Sunday markets in the town of Urubamba and Anta. For several years I have worked with Asociación Arariwa and I have done well. The loans and profits have enabled me to pay the food and education of my children. At the moment I require a loan to buy more merchandise."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es: Honoria tiene 30 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica en la venta de galletas, chocolates y demás golosinas.  Su negocio se ubica en la casa de su madre, quien le cedió una parte, debido a la crisis económica en que atravesaba. Hoy en día, su madre la apoya en el negocio, reemplazándola en la atención hacia los clientes, mientra ella viaja a la ciudad de Lima a conseguir más productos. La gran mayoría de sus compradores son adolescentes y niños, debido a que los precios que ofrece de sus productos son módicos. Se siente muy complacida por su negocio; ya que desde niña lo anhelaba. En adelante, espera tener un bazar; debido que nadie cerca de su zona se dedica a ese rubro. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, asimismo con sus compañeras es atenta, por lo que le invitaron a ser parte de este crédito. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará gaseosas, golosinas, además piensa comprar prendas de vestir como polo, con el fin de incursionar en la venta de nuevos productos e instalar su bazar.
texts.en:
Honoria is 30 years old, a very hard-working and responsible mother. She lives in her mother's house with her husband and 2 children. For more than 2 years she has been selling cookies, chocolates, and other candies. Her business is located at her mother's house, who gave her a part of her house due to the economic crisis she was facing. Today her mother supports her with the business, substituting when she travels to the town of Lima to get more products. The majority of the buyers are teenagers and children as the prices of the products are low. She fells pleased with her business as she wanted to do this since she was a girl. For the future she wishes to have a hardware store as there is none in the area. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually. She is kind to her partners and therefore they invited her to be part of this loan. With the loan she will buy sodas, candies, and she is also thinking of buying garments such as poloshirts to start offering new products and set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, candies as well as poloshirts and other garments.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Mauro, tiene 39 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Mauro nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  brindar servicio de taxi en la ciudad del Cusco y Anta. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude pagar la alimentación y educación de mis hijos. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de mi carro.
texts.en:
Mauro, 39, belongs to the Los Comerciates de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Mauro tells us, "There are 10 members at my community bank and they chose me to talk about my business. I operate a taxi service in the cities of Cusco and Anta. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and so far, so good. With the loans and help that they have given me, I have been able to feed and educate my children. I will use this loan to make some much needed repairs to my cab".

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance for taxi business.

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. MARIA EUFROCINA, TIENE 47 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO DE 15 AÑOS Y OTRO DE 11 AÑOS, HACE CINCO MESES FORMA PARTE D. GRUPO "TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA", QUE ESTA FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES TODOS ELLOS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
HACE TRES AÑOSINICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE SALCHIPAPAS Y SE UBICÓ FUERA DE DOMICILIO COLOCANDO UNA MESITA EN SU PUERTA, CADA VEZ QUE HABÍAN EVENTOS EN SU ZONA APROVECHABA QUE AUMENTABA LA VENTA, LUEGO DE UN TIEMPO UNO DE SUS HIJOS EMPEZÓ A ESTUDIAR REPOSTERÍA POR LO QUE IMPLEMENTARON UNA VITRINA DONDE EXHIBÍA LOS POSTRES PREPARADOS POR SU HIJO.
ELLA CONSIDERA QUE ÉSTE NEGOCIO LE BRINDA MUCHA AYUDA ECONÓMICA, POR LO QUE HA PODIDO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS DE SUS HIJOS YA SEA EL COLEGIO COMO EL INSTITUTO DE REPOSTERÍA, ADEMÁS DE APOYAR A UNA SOBRINA QUE ESTÁ A SU CARGO.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR SERÁ IMPLEMENTAR UN RESTAURANTE EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO PARA ASÍ APROVECHAR EL ESPACIO DE SU CASA Y NO TENER QUE PAGAR ALQUILER.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS AL POR MAYOR PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE SALCHIPAPAAS COMO SACO DE PAPAS, HOT DOG AL POR MAYOR, LAS CREMAS, LOS DESCARTABLES Y EL ACEITE.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Eufrocina, 47, has two children who are 15 and 11 years old, respectively. Five months ago, she joined the Trabajando en Armonia ("Working in Harmony") community bank, a group of 10 members, all residents of the La Flor neighborhood of Carabayllo. Sra. Maria started her business three years ago, making and selling salchipapas (a local hotdog-like dish), by setting up a table outside the door of her house. Whenever there was an event going on in the neighborood, she made the most of it to increase her sales. After a time, one of her sons began studying pastry-making so she set up a stand to display her son's pastries. Sra. Maria believes this business will be much more profitable and provide her a way to pay for her children to go to school. She is also supporting a niece who is in her care. Her next goal is to start a restaurant. She wants to set the restaurant up in a space at her house so that she can avoid paying rent. Sra. Maria will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of the products she needs to make salchipapas: sacks of potatoes, supplies of hotdogs, condiments, paper plates and cooking oil.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for food business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, tiene 39 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Martin nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  la venta de zapatos de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude comprar más mercadería. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Martin, 39, belongs to the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Martin tells us, "My community bank has 10 members and they chose me to talk about my business. I work as a street vendor selling shoes. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and it has been a successful partnership. The loans and help that they have given me have allowed me to buy more merchandise. I want a loan now so that I can buy more merchandise that I will resell."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, tiene 36 años y pertenece al banco comunal “Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco de Perú.  

Eugenia nos cuenta.- En mi banco comunal somos 10 integrantes y me eligieron a mí para dar mi testimonio de mi actividad económica. Yo me dedico a  la venta de pasamanería de forma ambulatoria en las ferias sabatinas y dominicales y también en la calle. Ya son varios años que trabajo con la asociación Arariwa y me ha ido muy bien, con los préstamos que me dieron y las utilidades que conseguí pude comprar más mercadería. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 36, belongs to the Los Comerciantes de Virgen Asunta community bank, an Asociacion Arariwa group in the Peruvian city of Cusco. Eugenia tells us, "My community bank has 10 members and they chose me to talk about my business. I work as a street vendor selling passementerie. I have worked with Asociacion Arariwa for some years and it has been a successful partnership. The loans and help that they have given me have allowed me to buy more product. I want a loan now so that I can buy more product that I will resell."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy product for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn crop

loans.name: Dorys Jacqueling

texts.es: Dorys Jacqueling de 43 años, Ella tiene una pulpería, Para poder solventar los gastos familiares ella tuvo que invertir sus ahorros porque su esposo no ganaba lo suficiente por esta razón ella tuvo que buscar la forma de ganar algo para sus hijos. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido surtir mas su negocio, Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite golosinas, refrescos naturales para su local. En el futuro quiere surtir más su negocio con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Dorys Jacqueling, 43, operates a corner store. She started the business to pay household expenses because her husband's earnings didn't stretch far enough to cover everything the family needed. She wanted to earn money for her children so she started the business with her savings. Little by liitle, with great effort, she was able to stock her business. She works every day from 8 in the morning to 10 at night. She wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, cookies and natural drinks for her business. In the future, she wants to stock the store with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for labor and agricultural materials like fertilizers

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es: Maximina tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy desprendida y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles y verduras en general. En un inicio vendía estos productos, hoy prepara y vende especias, condimentos y salsas, de esa manera sus ganancias aumentan. Su bodega se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño espacio dentro de su domicilio, donde atiende calidamente a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz, por el negocio que realiza, ya que le permite cuidar a sus hijos. Sin embargo el tener que adquirir la mercadería necesaria, tiene que subir la pesada carga cuesta arriba donde queda su casa. Su mayor anhelo es construir su casa con material noble y ampliar su bodega y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas, además se siente a gusto trabajar con sus compañeras de grupo.Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería comestible, de ese modo podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximina is 38 years old and is a very generous and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. More than five years ago, she began selling grocery products and vegetables. She began by selling these products; now she prepares and sells spices, condiments, and salsas, and thus her earnings have increased. Her store is located in a small space within her home, where she warmly serves her customers. She is very happy with her business, given that it allows her to take care of her children. However, acquiring the goods she needs requires her to carry the heavy load uphill to her house. Her greatest desire is to construct her house with durable materials and extend her store, thus improving her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP, and she knows that this contribution will be very beneficial for increasing her working capital. She is committed to making all payments on her loan, and she also enjoys working with her colleagues in the group. She will invest the requested loan in purchasing groceries and will thus be able to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more product to supply her business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocío vive en alquiler con su señora madre en la zona de Munaypata de la ciudad de La paz. Ella trabaja como mesera en un café de la zona central; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que como su sueldo es muy poco ella vende prendas de vestir (Chompas, Poleras, Etc.) a sus mismas compañeras de trabajo y algunas veces a los clientes.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rocio rents a home with her mother in the Munaypata area La Paz. She works as a waitress in a coffee shop in the central part of the city. She is requesting a loan to increase her capital since she sells dress clothing (sweaters, shirts etc) to her friends and customers as a way of supplementing her low wages. She is an Impro customer and pays back on time so she has access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for dress clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help fund his eggplant and tomato crops

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es separada y vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Copacabana ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Flora es rentista y produce tortas y masitas en una tienda en su zona, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para la ampliación de una habitación de su vivienda.
Esta es la cuarta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Flora is separated and lives in her own home in the neighborhood of Villa Copacabana on the west side of the city of La Paz. Flora is a pensioner and she makes tortas (sandwiches) and pastries in a shop in her neighborhood. She lives off of this income. She's requesting a loan for the expansion of a room in her house. This is the fourth occasion on which she's asked for a loan, and a socioeconomic analysis has deemed her qualified to access the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her land surface and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 26 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Nidia de 27 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Edwin, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron que trabajando en la chacra nada le faltaría, es por eso que decidió continuar con esta labor familiar y ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, de papa y alverja, que una vez cosechados son comercializados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 5 años que empezó con esta actividad, y disfruta mucho de la siembra, ya que depende de este trabajo para dar tranquilidad económica a su familia, sin embargo los cambios climáticos afecta la producción, por tanto procura cuidar su siembra para perderlo. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 26, is a very hardworking and modest young man. He rents a house with his wife Nidia, 27, and their 2 young children, to whom he wishes to provide a better quality of life. Farming has been a crucial part of Edwin's life. Since he was very young, Edwin's parents taught him that farming would provide him with everything he needed, which is why he decided to continue the work. He now has his own farm of potatoes and peas, which he sells in Tarma's wholesale market after harvest. Edwin started his farm 5 years ago and really enjoys the planting season. His family depends on his work for economic security. Climate changes affect his yield, so he tries to take good care of his crops. Edwin hopes to keep working and improving his crops. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he knows how important it is to the development of his work. In his community group Edwin is very responsible, which has earned him a lot of respect. With the 3,000 PEN loan he is requesting, Edwin will buy fertilizer to improve his harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For labor costs and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El señor Richard es casado vive con su esposa e hija en casa de sus suegros en la zona Alto Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Richard es policía, trabaja en la policía boliviana; su esposa es ama de casa y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una computadora portátil y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Richard is married and lives with his wife and daughter in their in-laws' house in the Alto Obispo Bosque zone of La Paz city. Richard is a police officer in the Bolivian police force and his wife is a homemaker. With his salary, Richard is able to maintain his home and family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a laptop for work. This is the 2nd loan he has requested and a socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her cultivatable land area and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eduardo de 48 años y sus 5 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza, es el cultivo de alverja y papa, esta labor lo hace junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Además ha conveniente llevar sus productos al mercado mayorista de Tarma, según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que amenazar la productividad de su siembra. Lleva 40 años trabajando en el campo y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar la producción y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causar problemas a sus compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy estimada. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Felicia, 54, is a sincere and hardworking mother. She and her husband Eduardo, 48, own their house and have 5 young children, to whom they hope to provide a better quality of life. Felicia grows peas and potatoes with her husband, who also works hard to earn income for his family. Felicia sells her products in Tarma's wholesale market, where she gets the best profit margin. What Felicia likes most about her work is preventing the crop pests that threaten her yield. She has been working in the countryside for 40 years and considers transportation of her products the most difficult part of her work, because the road is long and exhausting. Over time, she hopes to buy more land to increase her production and improve income. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she feels obligated to make her repayments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of her community group, where she is well-respected. With the 9,000 PEN loan she is requesting, Felicia will buy fertilizer for her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Honestidad, Progreso Y Lealtad Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. LUCY CONSUELO, HACE CINCO AÑOS ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO "HONESTIDAD, PROGRESO Y LEALTAD" FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES TODOS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE COLLIQUE EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS.
LA SRA. LUCY CONSUELO TIENE 49 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS, ES UNA FAMILIA EN LA CUAL TODOS SE APOYAN, SU ESPOSO LE BRINDA SU APOYO TANTO ECONÓMICO COMO MORAL EN TODOS LOS PROYECTOS QUE ELLA EMPRENDE.
HACE DOCE AÑOS ELLA APERTURÓ SU SALÓN DE BELLEZA DE NOMBRE "ESTÉTICA UNISEX LUCY`S", EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN SU DOMICILIO Y QUE LE FUÉ DE MUCHA AYUDA YA QUE TRABAJANDO EN SU CASA PUDO HACERSE CARGO PERSONALMENTE DE SUS HIJOS.
AHORA ADEMÁS DE SALÓN DE BELLEZA HA IMPLEMENTADO SU NEGOCIO CON UNA LIBRERÍA BAZAR EN EL CUAL TIENE A UNA PERSONA QUE LE APOYA EN LAS VENTAS.
CON ÉSTE TRABAJO HA CONSEGUIDO ADQUIRIR 03 CARROS USADOS PARA TRABAJARLOS HACIENDO SERVICIO DE TAXI, HA CONSTRUIDO SU CASA Y HA PODIDO PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES DE SUS HIJOS LOGRANDO QUE SEAN PROFESIONALES. 
SU PRÓXIMA META ES POSER ADQUIRIR UN LOCAL PARA QUE SU ESPOSO PONGA SU TALLER DE MECÁNICA.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN PRODUCTOS COSMÉTICOS PARA LA ATENCIÓN DE SUS CLIENTES EN SU SALON DE BELLEZA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucy Consuelo has been a member of the Honesty, Progress and Loyalty Group for the past 5 years. The group is made up of 10 members, all residents of the Collique Zone in the Comas District. Mrs. Lucy Consuelo is 49 years old, married with 2 children. Hers is a family where everybody supports one another. Her husband supports all her projects both economically and emotionally. Two years ago, she opened her beauty salon called “Estetica Unisex Lucy’s”. It is located in her home which has helped her enormously as by working out of her home, she has been able to be raise her children herself. Now, in addition to the beauty salon, she has begun a bookstore business. She has hired somebody to help with sales. With this work, she has acquired three used cars which she uses in a taxi service. She has built her house and has been able to pay for the higher studies of her children in the hopes that they will have professional careers. Her next goal is to be able to acquire a location for her husband to have his mechanic shop. The loan that she is soliciting will be used to buy cosmetics for the purchase by the customers in her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for the purchase by the customers in her beauty salon

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Manco Cápac del distrito de Paiján, una zona de movimiento comercial ascendente que pertenece a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. La zona se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero agrícola desde muy joven: el trabaja realizando labores de mantenimiento y cosecha de los cultivos de la zona. Paiján es un distrito que produce principalmente espárragos y diversas verduras. El trabaja de lunes a sabado desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su padre con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

Santiago desea realizar algunas mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda, ya que esta se encuentra construida de material rustico (adobe) y el tiempo con las continuas lluvias la han debilitado considerablemente. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
