Santiago es un hombre bastante trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su padre. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima y consideración.
texts.en:
Santiago is 28 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the Manco Cápac sector of the Paiján district. This area is a rising commercial area in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region. The zone is located more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has worked in agriculture from a young age, maintaining and growing the areas crops. Paiján is a district that produces mainly asparagus and various greens. He works Monday through Saturday from very early in the morning until late in the evening. With his earnings he is able to pay for his personal expenses and help his father with the family expenses. Santiago would like to improve the structure of his home. It is currently made of rustic material (adobe) and time and rain have considerably weakened it. In order to achieve his objective he has solicited a loan of 1000 Nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Santiago is a hardworking and responsible man. His greatest wish is to continue to work in order to help his father. His neighbors hold him in great esteem and respect.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repair and maintenance of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for labor expenses and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 23 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Leonardo de 25 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todos los días, desde muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja cultivando papa y alverja, el cuidado que les proporciona será muy importante para que las ganancias que obtenga sea buena, siendo comercializados en el mercado de Tarma, lugar donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, puesto que ve los resultados de su arduo trabajo que puso sobre sus campos. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantas de las plagas que afectan la producción. En adelante, sembrará en la totalidad de espacio que tiene en el campo para así incrementar sus ganancias. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 23 years old and a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her 25 year old husband Leonardo, and two young children who are the motive for all her efforts. Every day from early in the morning she works growing potatoes and beans. The earnings that she receives from her crops are good as she sells them in the Tarma market where they pay her well. What she likes most about her work is harvesting as she can see the results of her hard work in the fields. She has been doing this activity for the past 6 years and considers the most difficult part is guarding her plants from the diseases that affect production. In the future, she will plant the entire space that she has in the countryside in order to increase her earnings. This is the third loan she has had with MFP and this assistance has helped her greatly in the progress of her work. In her communal group she is well loved by the rest of her companions as she is very loyal to them. With the thousand Nuevos soles that she is soliciting, she will purchase fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 48 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado mucho por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mario de 57 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los hermosos campos del poblado natal de Luisa, han sido en su vida el lugar que la ha visto crecer y forma su familia. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la chacra y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Es así que tiene 28 años cultivando alverja, papa y olluco, pero el tener que transportarlo le resulta bien difícil hacía el mayorista de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta hacerlo. Dentro su grupo comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luisa, age 48, is a woman who has always fought hard to be successful in life. She lives in her own house with her 57 year old husband, Mario, and their two minor children. She wishes to give them a better quality of life. The beautiful fields of Luisa’s native village have been the place that she has formed her family and seen it grow. Since she was very little her parents taught her to work on the farm. She now has her own fields in which she works very carefully and with much sacrifice. She has been growing peas, potatoes, and “olluco” (a yellowish tuber) for 28 years. Having to transport them to the wholesale market in Tarma is difficult for her. In time, she wishes to buy more land to increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has the responsibility of making all of her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is always up to date on the agreements arrived at in her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 soles that she is requesting to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase palm nuts to make palm oil

loans.name: John

texts.es:
El señor John vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia. Vive en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor John trabaja en una constructora y a la vez tiene un auto del cual percibe una renta mensual y estos ingresos mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de su movilidad y no afecte en sus ingresos familiares.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
John lives with his wife and children in a home of his own. He lives in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. John works for a construction company and has a car from which he receives a monthly rent. This income allows him to maintain his home. The loan he is requesting will be used toward repairing his car so that it will not affect his family income. This is the second time that he has requested a loan and his socioeconomic status qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto Repair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and improve her land

loans.name: Yolanda Vivian

texts.es:
Yolanda, trabaja como profesora, y su esposo es electricista.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de herramientas para su esposo).
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde julio del 2005, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito
texts.en:
Yolanda is a teacher and her husband is an electrician. Her home is located in the Sopocachi zone of La Paz. The money from this loan will provide working capital (to buy tools for her husband). She has been a client of Impro since July of 2005 and her history qualifies her as a prime customer, meaning that she has had a good repayment record. This allows her to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria vive con su esposo y su dos hijos en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Ana Maria es Profesora en una Unidad Educativa de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención que estabilizara su vivienda construida en pendiente.
Esta es la novena  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria lives with her husband and their two children in her own house in the Llojeta area on the western side of the city of La Paz. Ana Maria is a teacher in a school in this school and her earnings supports the family. The loan that she is requesting is to build a retaining wall on a sloping lot that will allow her house to be stable. This is the ninth time that she is asking for a loan and her credit standing qualifies her favorably for one.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
El señor Mauricio es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres la zona Santa Barbara de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Mauricio trabaja como chofer y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de una habitación y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mauricio is single and lives with his parents in the Santa Barbara zone of La Paz. He works as a driver and maintains his home with his earnings. He will use the money from this loan for home repairs so that he can improve his quality of life. This is the second occasion of him requesting a loan and our analysis of his socioeconomic status qualifies him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La señora Fabiana vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia en la zona Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Fabiana trabaja en una institución enseñando idiomas y a la vez tiene una tienda de los cuales obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción del amurallado de su terreno comprado recientemente.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Fabiana lives with her husband and son in a home of their own, located in the Pasankeri zone, south of the city of La Paz. Fabiana works with a language institute and also runs a store from which she earns her household income. She is asking for this loan in order to build a wall around her recently purchased land. This is the third time she has requested a loan and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall around her property

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres en la zona norte de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Martha  trabaja como empleada en un domicilio particular, con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para el pago de una cuota inicial de la compra de un lote de terreno y hacer construir su vivienda propia.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is single and lives with her two children in her parents’ home, located in the northern zone of the city of La Paz. She works as a domestic employee in a private home, and uses the income she earns to maintain her household. She will use the money from this loan as a down payment toward a lot and to build a home of her own. This is her first loan request and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land and build a home

loans.name: Yafar

texts.es:
El señor Yafar, Abogado de profesión, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Yafar es administrador de un restaurante de los cuales obtiene sus ingresos.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción del techo del restaurante para mejorar  su calidad de trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
Esta es la segunda  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Yafar is a lawyer by profession. He is single and lives with his parent in the Alto Obrajes area of La Paz. Yafar manages a restaurant, which earns him income. The solicited loan is for the refurbishment of the restaurant's roof. It will improve the quality of his work and allow increased revenue. This is the second time Yafar is asking for a loan. He was graded favorably by a socioeconomic analysis done graded him favorably, which gives him access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof refurbishment

loans.name: Aline

texts.es:
La señora Aline es casada, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa propia en la zona Villa Pavón de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Aline trabaja en una óptica en la zona de Miraflores y su esposo es vendedor de una importadora de cerámica y ambos con su sueldo mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una losa flotante para la construcción de una habitación y esto mejorará las condiciones de la vivienda.
Esta es la tercera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ms. Aline is married and lives with her husband and son in a home of their own, located in the Villa Pavón zone of La Paz. Ms. Aline works in an optical shop in the Miraflores zone and her husband is a salesman for a ceramic importer. They use both of their earnings to maintain their home. They will use the money from this loan to build the foundation for the house they will build and this will improve their living conditions. This is the third occasion on which she has requested a loan, and our analysis of her socioeconomic status qualifies her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a home

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Ivan es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Plan Autopista de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Ivan trabaja en una imprenta que esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a mantener su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para construcción de una habitación y esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ivan is single and lives with his parents in Plan Autopista in La Paz. Ivan works at a printer's located in Miraflores. He uses his salary to help maintain his household. The requested loan is for the construction of a bedroom, which will improve Ivan's living conditions. This is the first time Ivan is asking for a loan. He was graded favorably by a socioeconomic analysis, which allows him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
El señor Efraín es casado vive con su esposa e hijo en casa de sus padres en la zona Llojeta Central de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Efraín trabaja en una empresa constructora en la zona central de esta ciudad y la esposa se dedica al comercio, ambos ingresos mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una nueva habitación mejorando así sus condiciones de vida..
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Efraín is married and lives in his parents’ home along with his wife and son. The home is located in the Llojeta Central zone of La Paz. Efraín works for a construction company in the central zone of this city. His wife is a businesswoman. They use both of their incomes to maintain their household. They will use the money from this loan to build a new home which will improve their living conditions. This is the first occasion on which he has requested a loan and our analysis of his socioeconomic conditions qualifies him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a home

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda es separada, vive con sus hijos en casa propia la zona Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Yolanda tiene un restaurante en la misma casa, a la vez hace trabajos de costura (es costurera); es así como obtiene sus ingresos que  mantienen su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de extractor de humo para la cocina de restaurante  como primera fase mejorando así las condiciones de este.
Esta es la séptima  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a single mother, who lives with her children in her house in Villa Copacabana in La Paz. Yolanda runs a restaurant from her home, and she also works as a seamstress. These jobs allow her to make the income necessary to maintain her household. The requested loan is for the construction of an exhaust fan in her kitchen restaurant. It is the first phase of her kitchen improvements. This is the seventh time Yolanda has asked for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis done graded Yolanda favorably, which allows her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of exhaust fan for kitchen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying ingredients for breadmaking

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es: Sonia Marisol P. D. R. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz, lugar en el cual vive desD. hace 14 años mismo tiempo el cual también tiene D. poseer su negocio en el mismo lugar. Sonia vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en su propio negocio D. venta D. chatarra, y D. esta misma forma en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a Sonia con el negocio D. ella, así mismo vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos D. 5 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, tanto alimenticios como D. primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales posee mayor demanda, así D. esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ventas. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y D. esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y D. esta misma forma brindarle un mejor futuro a sus pequeños hijos en el cual puedan contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Sonia Marisol Perez D. R. is 37 years old. She has lived in Zacatecoluca (department of La Paz) for 14 years, the same period she has had her business in the same place. Sonia lives with her husband, who has his own business selling scrap metal. In his spare time he helps Sonia with her business. She also lives with her two small children, 5 and 7 years old, who are in school. She has a store, located in her home, and she sells basic goods, such as food and household products. Sonia is requesting a loan in order to stock her store, buying more bread, milk, juices, and other products, whatever is most in demand. She expects to improve her sales this way. Sonia is a hard-working woman who wishes to improve her business and thus enjoy greater stability, offering a better future for her two small children, one where they have what they need to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Hilder

texts.es: Hilder T. M., tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El tiene 1 añito. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es  la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Hilder también trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Hilder T. M., 35, is married and has a 1 year-old son who is his main priority. Hilder wants a loan to buy livestock; the idea is to have livestock for the dual objective of producing meat and milk. He wants to provide appropriate care to the livestock so that he can have the highest possible earnings when he sells them. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very satisfied with the ease of payments they are providing him. Don Hilder has also worked with livestock for a number of years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy livestock to produce milk and meat

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, se conformó en fecha 16 de Setiembre del 2.008. Logró juntar a mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya dentro del  6º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos  que cada una tiene.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Carolina quien se dedica  a la fabricación y venta de bijouterie.
Ella en sus ratos libre se dedica la fabricación de bijouterie que elabora de acuerdo a los pedidos que ella recibe de sus clientas.
Se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo ya que le deja ganancia extra para su familia, y solicita el prestamo para comprar accesorios para fabricar sus productos:mostasilla, lentejuelas, pinzas, alambres de cobre, alicates, cables, perforador manual y otros.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women called “Renacer” (Rebirth) was founded on September 16, 2008. The group consists of women who enjoy working together with great effort and dedication. They are in their sixth loan cycle working jointly as a cohesive unit. All of the members participate in fundraising activities in order to help one another achieve each of their goals.

One of the members is Sra. Carolina, who produces and sells costume jewelry. During her free time, she manufactures her products according to the orders she receives from her customers. She is very happy with her work since it allows her to earn extra income for her family. Carolina is requesting a loan to buy accessories used in making her products such as beads, sequins, pliers, copper wire, tweezers, cables, a manual drill, and other supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for making costume jewelry

loans.name: Madelaine

texts.es: Madelaine, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Teodoro de 47 años y sus 3 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Junto a su esposo, cultivan papa y alverja, que con mucho esfuerzo han logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y cada cosecha que tienen es de muy buena calidad, por lo que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas que afectan su cosecha. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Madelaine is 42 years old and a modest cheerful mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Teodoro, age 47, and their three young children who are the reason behind all her efforts. Madelaine and her husband work together to grow potatoes and peas and have strived to make their land productive. With each harvest, they have achieved good quality crops that are in high demand at the wholesale market in the city. What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops and protecting them from pests that can impact her harvest. Madelaine has been farming for five years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the market in Tarma where they are sold. In the future, she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels these funds will be a great help in developing her business. Madelaine is one of the most responsible members of her Communal Bank, a distinction of which she is very proud. The loan of 1500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy more compost to improve the productivity of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es: Miguela, de 39 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edgar de 38 años y su hija menor Leonela de 10 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Miguela ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus campos agrícolas, donde tiene sembrado habas, papas, choclo, olluco y alverja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Disfruta mucho su trabajo y más cuando cultiva, así han pasado 7 años trabajando en esta actividad, sin embargo lo más difícil para él es tener que transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que sus costales son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Su mayor anhelo es tener que comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Miguela con MFP. En su grupo comunal es una compañera muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Miguela is 39 years old and a cheerful hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Edgar, age 38, and their ten year old daughter Leonela for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Miguela has worked hard to maintain her fields that produce the necessary foods to support her family. Before the first rays of sunlight can be seen, she leaves her house and walks for nearly an hour prior to arriving at her farmland where she grows beans, potatoes, corn, ulluco, and peas. These crops are later sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. She greatly enjoys her work, especially the cultivation phase. Miguela has been farming for seven years and considers the most difficult part of her job to be transporting her products to market since the sacks are extremely heavy and exhausting to carry. Her greatest wish is to buy more land so that she can increase production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. In her Communal Bank, Miguela is highly respected because she seeks to restore order in all of the meetings. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to make her land more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Miler

texts.es: Miler, de 42 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eva de 33 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que Miler se dedica, es el cultivo de alverja y papa, productos que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado cosechar y del que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de tarma. Para él esta actividad es su única fuente de ingreso, de ello depende la tranquilidad de su familia. Han pasado 15 años y aun continua disfrutando de la siembra, pero a veces los cambios bruscos del clima perjudican la producción. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal es un compañero muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Miler is 42 years old and a loving hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Eva, age 33, and their four beloved children who are the reason behind all of his efforts. Miler grows peas and potatoes, products that require a great deal of effort and work to harvest. These crops have high demand at the wholesale market in Tarma. Farming is his only source of income and provides stability for his family. He has been doing this for 15 years and still enjoys planting crops, but sometimes the abrupt changes in weather have hurt his production. Moving forward he wants to continue working hard to improve his crops.

This is his third loan with MFP. Miler knows that this funding will be beneficial in the development of his business. He is a responsible member of his Communal Bank, which explains why he is well respected. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Tesapeara Group

texts.es:
Tesapeara se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado para trabajar en forma conjunta y solidaria.
El grupo se encuentra trabajando dentro del 5° ciclo, cada una en una actividad diferente.
Una  de la integrantes es la señora Clara B. quienes una mujer trabajadora y activa, ella es esposa y ama de casa y al mismo tiempo también atiende su un negocio que posee en su casa.
El negocio es administrado por ella y se encuentra surtida con accesorios de mercería en general.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general como por ejemplo artículos decorativos, varios tipos de papeles, globos, telas de varios tipos, y otros.
texts.en:
“Tesepeara” is the name of a great group of women who have come together to work jointly as a single unit. They are currently in their fifth loan cycle. Each member is engaged in a different business activity.

One of the members is Sra. Clara B., who is a hardworking and active woman. She is a wife and homemaker but also manages a business out of her home. Her store is stocked with general sewing supplies. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy sewing supplies and merchandise such as decorative items, various types of paper, balloons, different fabrics, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies & merchandise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y una de sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace mas de 10 años se dedica a la costura, donde confecciona mandiles para amas de casa, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su maquina de coser, de esta manera trabaja en el taller de costura que tiene en su misma casa. Mientras que su hermana la ayuda en la comercialización de mandiles, llevándolos a distintos lugares y ciudades aledañas de su zona. Su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias, y esto gracias a las arduas horas de trabajo que realizó. en adelante desea implementar su negocio con nuevas maquinas de coser y otras herramientas que necesita para su taller de costura. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos por fardos y conos, de esta manera tendrá buen abastecimiento de su materia prima y mayores márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and one of her two children. For more than ten years she has worked as a seamstress, making aprons used by housewives. Her main piece of equipment that she uses for work is her sewing machine. She has a sewing workshop inside of her home. Even though her sister helps her with selling aprons, Antonia must travel to different places and neighboring cities. Her business generates good earnings, thanks to the long hours of work she has performed. Moving forward she wants to buy new sewing machines for her business and other equipment that she needs to keep her sewing workshop operating.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Antonia is very happy to know that she has financial backing, which is why she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. She enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of bales of fabric and cones of thread so that she can have a good stock of materials and obtain higher profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila tiene 54 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 35 años se ha dedicado al negocio, en un inicio frutas, actualmente gelatina, postre que ella misma prepara, siendo su principal herramienta D. trabajo, su refrigeradora. DesD. entonces y todas las mañanas venD. este postre D. manera ambulante, afirma que los días que más venD. es en temporada D. verano. Se siente muy motivada, porque luego D. varias horas D. caminata, regresa a su casa sin gelatina y con las ganancias en sus manos, pueD. cubrir sus gastos domésticos. Su deseo es mejorar su negocio con nuevos implementos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. insumos que necesita como gelatina D. diversos sabores, vasitos y cucharitas descartables.
texts.en:
Bertila is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their four children. She has been in business for more than 35 years. Bertila started selling fruits, but now she sells gelatins and desserts that she prepares herself. The main piece of equipment that she uses for work is her refrigerator. Every morning she sells these desserts as a street vendor. Bertila says the days when she sells the most are during the summer season. She feels very motivated after several hours of walking because she gets to return home without any gelatins and with all the money she has earned in her hands. These funds go toward covering her household expenses. Her wish is to improve her business with new implements.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Bertila is very happy to know that she has financial backing, which is why she has already proven herself to be responsible with her payments. In addition, she is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and cooperative people. She will invest her loan in the purchase of supplies that she needs such as gelatins of different flavors and disposable cups and spoons.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gelatins of different flavors and disposable cups and spoons

loans.name: Virgen Del Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
Comité Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro, así se denomina el grupo conformado a este grupo de mujeres que se encuentra trabajando dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y se encuentran en el 3º ciclo.
 Este grupo se formó gracias al deseo de las señoras para formar un grupo de mujeres que quieren trabajar en grupo y en forma solidaria.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Justina quien se dedica a la cría de cabras en su casa, con la cría de cabras ella vende leche de cabras y también carne de cabra.
Ella vende los productos que obtiene de los animales en varios negocios de la ciudad.
Esta actividad le deja buena ganancia y de esta manera le ofrece mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y en especial a sus hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de madera para la construcción de un corral más amplio para sus animales
texts.en:
The committee named “Virgen del Perpetuo Socorro” (Our Lady of Perpetual Aid) consists of a group of women who are participating in the Committee of Enterprising Women Program. They are in their third loan cycle. This group was formed because these ladies wanted to work together as a cohesive unit.

One of the members is Sra. Justina, who raises goats from home. She raises these animals for their milk and their meat. The products she obtains from her animals are sold to different businesses throughout the city. This business has resulted in good earnings and has enabled her to provide a better quality of life for her family, especially her children. Justina is requesting a loan to buy wood so that she can build a larger corral for keeping her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to build a larger corral for keeping goats

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo de dos años de edad en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona de regular movimiento comercial ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo desayunos en un puesto ambulante situado en una avenida bastante frecuentada de la ciudad en donde vive. Por la zona transitan bastantes personas, ya que en esa área se encuentran ubicados bastantes locales que pertenecen a empresas de transporte que unen a Chepén con sus diversos distritos y también con otras ciudades del país, además por el lugar donde trabaja se encuentra ubicado el hospital de la ciudad.

Sus clientes habituales son los transportistas y las personas que hacen uso de los medios de transporte. La continua demanda por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que ella piense en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos que le permitan preparar mas alimentos con los cuales pueda incrementar su stock y sus ventas. Para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer emprendedora y que siempre entrega lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su negocio y ayudar a su esposo, que también es comerciante, en el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares. Sus familiares y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Luz is a 22 year old mother who lives with her husband and two year old son in the farming district of Chepén. This area experiences regular business activity and is located in Chepén Province in the region of La Libertad, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Luz sells breakfasts from a mobile food stand situated on a busy avenue in the city where she lives. Plenty of people pass through this area since Chepén has several local transportation companies that provide service to various districts and to other cities throughout the country. In addition, the place where she works is located near the city hospital. Her regular customers are drivers and people who use public transportation. The continuous demand for the products she offers has made Luz think about expanding her business. She plans to buy more supplies which will allow her to prepare more meals, increase her inventory, and generate more sales. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. Luz is an enterprising woman who always tries her best to succeed in her business and help her husband, who is also a merchant, with providing for the family expenses. Her relatives and acquaintances consider her to be a peaceful and reliable woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her mobile food stand

loans.name: Angel Polivio

texts.es:
Ángel de 32 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución),  el tiene una tienda (su tienda esta con rejas en la foto para tener mas seguridad en su negocio debido a la delincuencia). 

Para tener mas ingresos para su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres y comenzarlos a vender a las afuera de su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo obtuvo su tienda y construyo una parte de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con su negocio el necesita comprar con el préstamo legumbres y arroz para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y adecuar su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel is 32 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (a periurban area with a deteriorating ecosystem). He manages a store. In the photograph, his business is behind security bars in order to protect it from crime in the area.

To have more income for his family, Ángel invested his savings in provisions and began selling these products outside of his home. After some time and with effort, he was able to open his store and build part of his house. He works from 7am until 8pm every day.

To continue his business, Ángel needs a loan to buy legumes and rice in order to cover the needs of his customers. In the future, he wants to expand his business and modify his house accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase legumes & rice

loans.name: El Ocotal Group

texts.es:
DOÑA CARMELA H. P., VIVE EN LA RIBERA LLANO GRANDE, MUNICIPIO DE COPAILLA CHIAPAS, MEXICO. ESTA CASADA CON EL SEÑOR MIGUEL R.  P.  Y CON QUIEN TIENE SEIS HIJOS: EDUARDO  DE 18 AÑOS, CONSUELO DE 15, Y VA EN TERCERO DE SECUNDARIA, MARIA DEL CARMEN EN SEXTO DE PRIMARIA, MIGUEL DE CUARTO, DIMAEL 8 AÑOS Y LA MAS PEQUEÑA MAREINE ELINETH DE 6 AÑOS.

ELLA SE DEDICA  A SU NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES HACE SIETE MESES, EN DONDE COMENTA QUE LE VA MUY BIEN DESDE QUE INICIO ESTA ACTIVIDAD, ASÍ APOYA A SU ESPOSO CON LOS INGRESOS DE SU HOGAR Y LOS GASTO DE SU FAMILA. TAMBIEN REALIZA UNA ACTIVIDAD DE ARTESANIA HACE YA DIEZ AÑOS, ELLA TEJE CANASTOS, ALFOMBRAS (PETATES)Y OTROS ARTICULOS ECHOS CON PALMA, ELLA NO HA PODIDO DESAROLLAR ÉSTE NEGOCIO POR FALTA DE UN LOCAL EN EL MERCADO Y SOLO LO REALIZA POR EN CARGOS POR SUS CLIENTES. ELLA QUISIERA TENER UN ESPACIO EN ALGUN LUGAR DONDE VENDER SU PRODUCTO.

LA SEÑORA CARMELA SE  INSPIRO EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD, PARA OCUPAR SU TIEMPO LIBRE EN ALGUN  TRABAJO Y SACAR PROVECHO DE ELLO.

PASO A FORMAR PARTE DEL GRUPO POR SUS COMPAÑERAS Y LOS COORDINADORES QUIEN LE PLATICARON COMO SE TRABAJABA, LE INTERESO MUCHO Y FORMO EL GRUPO DADO POR NOMBRE EL OCOTAL, LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES PORQUE EN ESE LUGAR SEDA MUCHO ESE TIPO DE ÁRBOLES.

LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN ESTE GRUPO SON:
ANTONIO P. D.: TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES.
ROMELIA R. HERNADEZ, SE DEDICA A SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES.
ANDREA D. P..  TRABAJA  NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES.
Y DOÑA CARMELA QUIEN ES REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO EN LA ARTESANIA Y ABARROTES.
texts.en:
Doña Carmela H. P. lives in La Ribera Llano Grande, a town in Copailla Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Sr. Miguel R. P. and they have six children: Eduardo (age 18), Consuelo (age 15 and in her third year of high school), Maria del Carmen (who is in sixth grade), Miguel (who is in fourth grade), Dimael (age 8), and the youngest Mareine Elineth (age 6).

Carmela has been managing a grocery store for seven months. She says she has done very well since starting her business. Carmela has the support of her husband, who helps with the household income and the family expenses. She also has been making handicrafts for the past ten years. Among the items she produces by hand are baskets, bedrolls, and other articles made of palm fibers. Carmela has not been able to develop this business because she lacks a vending stall at the local market, so what she sells is based on orders from her customers. She wants to have a space where she can sell these products. Sra. Carmela was inspired to make woven items so that she could occupy her free time and now she takes advantage of every opportunity.

Carmela decided to join this group after discussing with the other members and the coordinators about how they work. She was very interested and became part of this group that was given the name “El Ocotal”. The reason for this name is because of the species of trees that grow in this tranquil place.

The members of this group are as follows: • Antonio P. D. has a grocery store. • Romelia R. H. has a grocery store. • Andrea D. P. works in a grocery business. • Doña Carmela is the group representative. She is a craftsperson and sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, beans, oil, pasta, and other products

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Aníbal, de 30 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Juana  Zárate  con quien tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.
El Sr. Aníbal se dedica a la cerrajería, elaboración de copias de llave, cambio de cerraduras, etc., esta actividad lo realiza desde hace más de 5 años. 
Posee un local alquilado en uno de los salones del club  Sportivo Iteño, además cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes y es uno de los más conocidos de la zona.
Solicita el crédito para la apertura de un  nuevo local en los alrededores del mercado Municipal de Itá, donde hay muy pocas cerrajerías y donde tiene la posibilidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de clientes ya que es una zona muy transitada por personas que vienen desde todas las compañías y ciudades cercanas.
El Sr. Aníbal es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya ya que ha accedido en reiteradas ocasiones a los préstamos que la institución brinda cumpliendo sin ningún tipo de problemas con los pagos, es además una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Mr. Anibal, 30, is married to Ms. Juana Zárate. They have a 2 year-old son together. Mr. Anibal is a locksmith, makes copies of keys, changes locks, etc. He has been doing this type of work for over 5 years. He rents a workspace in one of the halls of the Sportivo Iteño club. He has a good number of customers and is one of the most well-known people in the area. He is requesting this loan in order to open a new location in the area surrounding the Itá municipal market, where there are very few locksmiths and where he will have the opportunity to increase his number of customers. It is a zone that is well-traveled by people who come from all of the nearby businesses and cities. Mr. Anibal is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. There has never been any type of problem with his repayments on the previous loans he has agreed to. He is also a very hard-working person.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: costs for the opening of a new locksmith shop

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 40 años se dedica a bordar, para ello cuenta con un taller artesanal, en donD. su hija la ayuda en esta labor. La experiencia que tiene le ha servido para realizar bellos bordados, es así que disfruta haciéndolo por la tranquilidad que le proporciona, además que requiere toda la concentración posible, para hacer cada falda, como colocar lentejillas e hilos  dorados, plateados y D. otros colores. Una vez que ha terminado D. producir, su clientela  compra  muy satisfecha las prendas, porque conocen la calidad del trabajo, D. esa manera la recompensa es buena, es por eso que Betty desea tener mayor producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos y materiales necesarios para sus bordados, que son: hilos D. diversos colores, así como aplicaciones en lentejuelas e hilos especiales (dorados y plateados) y telas.
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in her own home. She has been an embroiderer for more than 40 years and has her own workshop, in which she now works with her daughter. The experience has allowed her to make some beautiful embroidered patterns. It is a job that she enjoys for the calmness it gives her. She requires a great deal of concentration to complete every skirt, given the time it takes to add all the sequins and gold, silver and other coloured threads. Her customers buy her clothing with great satisfaction because they recognise the quality of her work. And it is for this reason that Betty would like to increase her output. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very pleased to have the financial support and has always proven to be a responsible borrower. She likes being a member of a communal group because everyone in the group is responsible and offers mutual support. With the loan that she has requested, Betty will buy the necessary materials for making her embroidered clothes, such as special thread in various colours (e.g. gold and silver), sequins, and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, sequins and special thread in different colours

loans.name: La Gula Group

texts.en: This communal bank is called “La Gula” and it is composed of 20 members from the city of Valparaíso. They dedicate themselves to many different kinds of businesses, like the sewing of pajamas and sweatshirts, dessert making, jewelry making, the sale and repair of eyeglasses, the sale of undergarments, the preparation and sale of breads and cakes, sculpting and auto repair. Mónica, the group’s treasurer, is seen in the photo on the right-hand side, wearing a burgundy-colored jacket. Mónica works with her father in the business he has run for 30 years. Mónica is in charge of purchasing the ingredients to prepare sopaipillas (fried pastries), empanadas (stuffed savory pastries) and cakes. With this loan, Mónica will purchase a fryer, because when they get a lot of orders for sopaipillas and empanadas, it takes a long time to fry them in a normal pan. She will also purchase aluminum plates, oil, and cheese in bulk, along with papaya jam and dough for the sopaipillas and empanadas. Her dream is to incorporate new products into the business; for example, an ice cream machine as they do not currently have one and it would be a good investment for the summer months to take advantage of the businesses location. In general, she would like to grow the business. Mónica’s motivation comes from her children. She has one son who is 20 and in his third year of university, studying electrical engineering, and she has a 15-year-old daughter who also wants to continue on to college after finishing high school. Her other daughter, who is 28, sells jewelry and is also part of the Fondo Esperanza communal bank. Mónica very much enjoys attending the weekly meetings of their bank because it gives her a moment to share with her friends and a distraction from day-to-day activities. Valparaíso is a city situated 120 kilometers to the northwest of Santiago, on the Chilean coast. It is the regional capital of "Region Five" and is the seat of the Chilean legislative government. Valparaíso is the nation's primary port, and in addition to a bustling economy, it offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like the home of Nobel Laureate, the poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: Purchase a fryer, plates, dough and jam

loans.name: Miguel Ruben

texts.es:
Miguel de 48 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada así por que en su originalidad tenia muchas orquídeas), después de la jubilación de las fuerzas armadas del Ecuador, con sus ahorros decidió comprar un carro para hacer expreso a escuelas. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo el carro a sido su ingreso principal para mantener a sus dos hijos de 14 y 17 años, recorre toda la ciudad haciendo fletes y expreso. Una de sus metas es tener un bazar para que su pasar mas tiempo con su esposa y trabajar junto. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y papelería para comenzar con el negocio que siempre a querido, ir de poco en poco para que en el futuro tener su propia papelería.
texts.en:
Miguel is 48 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area, which was once rich in orchids). After retiring from the Ecuadorian Armed Forces, he bought a car with his savings and started his own taxi service to nearby schools. Little by little, through his hard work, Miguel has managed to turn the business into his principal source of income, which he uses to look after his two children (aged 14 and 17). He drives all over the city. One of his dreams is to have a shop, where he can be with his wife and spend more time with her. With the loan he has requested, Miguel will buy exercise books, pens and paper to start the business that he has always wanted. He will build up the business one step at a time, with the hope of one day having his own stationary shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy exercise books, pens and paper

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Mr. O., a store owner, is 54 years old and married to Olga, who is 48 years old. He has a business that sells, charges, and repairs locally made and imported storage batteries. 
 
Higino started working more than 30 years ago and with his success, he has improve the living conditions of his family.  The most important thing for him is that because of his sacrifice, all 5 of his children (all of whom he had with Olga) can attend school. The oldest child Oscar, 29, is a professor, Osmar, 25, is a police official, Liz, 23, is studying architecture, Hernán, 21, is also a police official, and Olga, 9, is currently enrolled in the 4th grade at an elementary school. 
  
Higino has decided to ask Fundación Paraguay for a loan so he can buy the necessary materials to continue making batteries and perform the day to day work so he can have continued success for his family.

loans.use: Selling, charging, and repairing storage batteries

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana Pavón, 21 years old, is single and lives with her parents in Conavi, a popular economic housing complex in Paraguay.  She has been dedicated to being a seamstress for more than 2 years, making comforters, bed sheets, drapes, upholstery, and much more.  She performs this activity with her mother, Ms. Ignacia Díaz.

To date, she has a large quantity of customers in the zones of Itá, San Lorenzo, Asunción, Fernando de la Mora, Lambaré, and several cities. As of now, Johana has an Overlock machine, a button machine, and a straightening machine, all of which she uses in her daily production.

She is asking for credit so she can buy another straightening machine because the one she has is very old and doesn’t work as well as it should.  She has said that with a new machine, she can increase her production in a considerable way.  She already has many orders and with the old machine, she would not be able to meet the demand of her work.
 
Johana is a very good worker and desires to continually to improve her situation.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Josue

texts.en:
Mr. G., 29 years old, lives together with Ms. Laura Rivarola who is 23 years old.  They do not have any children and live in the downtown area of Itá with his parents.

Josue has dedicated more than 5 years to making and selling wooden plates, spatulas, serving platters, as well as thermos coverings for mate and tereré (traditional tea drinks of Paraguay). On request, he sells to supermarkets and wholesalers in the cities of Asunción, Misones, and Santaní but also possesses a formidable clientele that continually buys his products.  His whole family is dedicated to this activity, each contributing with their own customers.

The loan that Josue is requesting will go towards buying wood and thermoses for mate and tereré so he can handcraft them and sell them commercially.  He already has a very important order that he wishes to take advantage of and this loan will help him meet that order.

loans.use: Making wooden plates, spatulas, serving platters, and handcrafted covers for thermoses

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Josefa llego D. su tierra natal el Cuzco  hace 5 años cargada D. ilusiones y con deseos D. progresar, cuando llego a lima empezó a vender caldo D. gallina  en L. calle lo cual era muy riesgoso, juntando algo D. dinero y con L. ayuda D. su esposo que le facilito un capital pudo empezar el negocio D. venta D. abarrotes alquilo un puesto en un mercado compro mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos etc. empezó a vender estos y otros productos D. a pocos fue ganando clienteL. y le va muy bien en su negocio que lleva por nombre “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”.
Con sus ganancias y ahorros Josefa  ha podido comprar su propio terreno, considera que su mayor logro es poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación en un buen colegio para mas adelante quiere terminar L. construcción D. su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales  y con respecto a su negocio quiere tener un minimarket donD. pueda vender D. todo productos variados regalos,comestibles,bebidas etc. Este negocio lo quiere poner en su propia casa, elL. esta segura que podrá concretar sus sueños este préstamo le servirá para el pago D. mercadería D. abarrotes que tiene pendiente ,el grupo “L. HERMANDAD” del cual elL. forma parte esta integrado por 11 socias todas trabajadoras y con ganas D. triunfar .

* Josefa es L. Sra.que esta con casaca ploma
texts.en:
Josefa arrived from her birthplace, Cuzco, 5 years ago - filled with hopes and dreams of success. When she arrived in Lima, she started selling chicken broth on the street - a job that carried considerable risks. With some small savings and financial help from her husband, she was able to start a business selling groceries at a stall that she rented in a market. She would buy produce such as rice, sugar, and noodles and sell these and other products. Gradually, the number of customers she had grew and her business, which she has given the name “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”, is going well. With her earnings and profits, Josefa has managed to buy a piece of land, which she considers her greatest achievement because it has given her the potential to proviD. her children with a good education in a good school. Later on, she would like to finish building her house and hopes her children will secure professional jobs. In terms of her own business, Josefa wants to have a 'minimarket' (a small supermarket) where she can sell a whole range of different products, such as presents, food, and drinks. She wants to set up this business in her own home. She is sure she will be able to fulfil her dream. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for the groceries that she needs. The group to which she belongs, “L. HERMANDAD”, comprises 11 members, all of whom are hardworking and determined to succeed. * Josefa is the woman seated, holding a blue folder.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, D. 34 años, es una madre D. familia muy laboriosa, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores en su casa propia.Se dedica a la preparación y venta D. diferentes tipos D. comidas. Todos los días, desD. muy temprano,  prepara diversos platos típicos peruanos (chanfainita, arroz  con pollo, tallarines, ají D. gallina, seco a la huachana, entre otros). Y con su carreta transporta sus ollas, bien cubiertas a  7 cuadras D. su casa, hasta un ovalo que es muy concurrido por cantidad D. personas. Sus comensales son los chóferes D. los buses y motocarros, quienes gustan D. su sazón. Ella se inició con la venta D. uno a dos platos, y en la actualidad ofrece  variedad y cantidad D. D. comidas, que sus comensales le sugieren que prepare.  Además se siente muy complacida por su actividad, y ya lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad, también comenta que su mayor anhelo es construir su casa D. material noble, para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos.Este es el onceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para D. ese modo no perjudicar  a sus compañeras D. su grupo, quienes la apoyaron en sus inicios.Maribel tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. cantidad D.  mercadería en comestibles (al por mayor)  y también quiere  renovar su carreta D. trabajo, que le es indispensable para su negocio, pues quiere continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34, is the mother of a very hard-working family. She lives with her husband and their three young children in a house that they own. She prepares and sells different types of food. Every day, starting early in the morning, she prepares various typical Peruvian dishes (chanfainita, chicken with rice, tallarines [noodles], hen chili, and seco a la huachana [beef stew flavored with cilantro], among others). She covers her pots well and uses her cart to transport them seven blocks from her house, to a traffic circle that is crowded with many people. Her customers are the drivers of the buses and motorcars, who like the seasoning of her dishes. She started her business selling just one or two dishes, and now she sells many different foods, based on what her customers suggest that she prepare. She feels very pleased with her work, and now that she's been doing it for 11 years, she also commented that her greatest dream is to build her house from more sturdy materials, in order to improve the quality of life for her children. This is the eleventh loan that she has taken out through Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual with her repayments, and in this way, she will not negatively affect the other members of her communal bank, who have supported her in her efforts. Maribel has planned to invest the money she is requesting in the wholesale purchase of ingredients. She would also like to make repairs to her cart, which is indispensable for her business and therefore she wants to keep up on its maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients for her business

loans.name: Responsabilidad Group

texts.es:
Silvia  tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas  empezó hace 6 meses compro una pequeña vitrina y en la puerta de su casa empezó a vender lo que ella misma preparaba  dulces, mazamorras, kekes etc. a  esto le añadió algunas pocas golosinas que pudo comprar  al principio vendía poco pero durante todo este tiempo su clientela aumento y tiene muchos compradores, con sus prestamos ha logrado comprar una vitrina mas grande ahora tiene mas productos para vender, lo que ella quiere para mas adelante es mejorar su negocio acondicionando un lugar en su casa para poner una bodega grande donde pueda vender de todo, su préstamo le servirá para reparar una de sus vitrinas  que esta deteriorada.
Silvia es la tesorera del grupo “RESPONSABILIDAD” son 8 socias que viven en Ventanilla – Callao, todas son amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar.


*La Sra. Silvia esta en la foto con polo fuccia aparece sentada, ella aparece en las 2 fotos, ya que se trata de diferentes reuniones la foto pequeña del desembolso pasado y la grande del actual debido a que no pudieron reunirse juntos.
texts.en:
Silvia has a business selling sweets, which she started 6 months ago when she bought a small showcase and started selling in front of her house. At first she sold sweets that she made herself, such as mazamorras [a pudding made from purple corn], cakes, etc. She added the little bit of candy that she was able to buy. At first she didn't make many sales, but over time her client base has grown and now she has many customers. With her previous loans, she was able to buy a larger showcase, since now she has more products to sell. In the future, she would like to improve her business by setting up a store in her home where she could sell all types of products. This loan will be used to repair one of her showcases, which is damaged. Silvia is the treasurer of the communal bank "Responsabilidad" ("Responsibility"). The group is made up of 8 members who all live in Ventanilla – Callao. They are all friends and neighbors from the same area. *Ms. Silvia is seated and wearing the fuchsia shirt in the photo. She appears in both photos, as they are from different meetings. The small photo is from the disbursement of their last loan, and the larger photo is from the disbursement of this loan, as not everyone could meet at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair a damaged showcase

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 54 años, es viuda, y vive en compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 3 años se dedica en la venta D. productos en la tienda que posee, ubicado en el interior D. su domicilio. DesD. muy joven aprendió el comercio ambulante, llevando sus productos a otras ciudades. Actualmente su establecimiento esta provisto D. varios productos como los D. primera necesidad, en donD. sus hijos la ayudan en la atención al cliente. El calido trato le ha dado ventaja frente a la competencia, por tanto desea continuar esforzándose en su trabajo y abastecer D. más productos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. arroz D. distintas calidades, fideos y algunas menestras.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old, widowed, and lives with her five children in her own house. For more than three years she has sold goods in her store, located in her home. When she was very young she learned about traveling sales, taking her products to other cities. Currently her establishment carries basic goods, and her children help her attend to customers. The warm treatment has given her an advantage over the competition, so therefore she wishes to continue working hard and stock more goods. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She has always been responsible with her payments, and she is pleased to be part of her communal group, because all the members are responsible and supportive. With the loan she is seeking, she will invest in the purchase of bags of rice of various qualities, beans and mixed vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and mixed vegetables

loans.name: Paula De La Paz

texts.es:
Paula tiene 42 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es soltera vive con la madre, posee una tienda  de venta de producto de primera necesidad.
Inicio su negocio hace tres años con el apoyo de la madre, actualmente comercializa los productos con vecinos y personas que visitan el lugar, ella necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en compra de productos como son azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, bebidas carbonatadas y otros que  tienen gran demanda por sus clientes.
Con la compra de nuevos productos atraerá  clientes y obtendrá más ganancias,sus aspiraciones son solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia, mantener su negocio, darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paula is 42 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán. She is single and lives with her mother. She has a store where she sells basic goods. She began her business three years ago with her mother’s support. Currently, she sells her goods to her neighbors and visitors. She needs the loan to invest in the purchase of goods such as sugar, flour, oil, soap, soft drinks etc. that are in high demand by her customers. By buying new products, she will attract customers and increase her profits. She aspires to meet the basic needs of her family, maintain her business and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, soap, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Jacinto Arnulfo

texts.es:
Jancinto tiene 21 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, esta acompañado y vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 8 meses de edad, el trabaja actualmente en FOVIAL una empresa encargada de dar mantenimiento a las calles.
El tiene dos años de trabajar en el mantenimiento de carreteras, en un Horacio de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm, todos los días. Jancito necesita el préstamo para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, comprara cuartones de madera, láminas, clavos, pegamento y otros materiales necesarios para el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente el techo está en malas condiciones, esto contribuirá a dar un techo seguro para su familia.
Los sueños son mejorar la vivienda, crearles seguridad, y con su esfuerzo, trabajo apoyar a su pequeña familia y dar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jacinto is 21 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán, with his wife and 8-month old son. He currently works at FOVIAL, a company in charge of street maintenance. He has been working for two years maintaining the highways. He works from 7am to 4pm every day. Jancinto needs the loan to improve the roof of his house. He will buy wooden beams, metal sheets, nails, glue and other materials necessary for his roof, since it is currently in bad condition. This will contribute to having a safe roof for his family. His dreams are to improve his home, give them security, and to work to support his little family and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wooden beams, sheet metal, nails, glue

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores tiene 45 años de edad reside en Chilanga Departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera vive con su único hijo, tiene una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Tiene cinco años de manejar su tienda; sus clientes son vecinos y personas que transitan por la zona, atiende en un horario de 6: 00 am - 6:00  pm, ella necesita un préstamo para comprar productos al mayoreo donde le darán un precio más bajo y así poder obtener más ingresos, ella comprara azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, y otros productos que sus clientes demandan, con esto ella tendrá variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Los sueños son crecer el negocio y con los ingreso ahorrar para comprar una casa darle donde vivir a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 45 years old and lives in the Chilanga in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother and lives with her only son. Her business is a general store, selling basic everyday goods. She has been running her shop for five years. Her customers are her neighbours and people passing through the area. Her opening hours are from 6am until 6pm. She needs a loan in order to buy wholesale goods at a lower price, so that she can increase her income. She will buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, and other products requested by her customers. This will enable her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Her dream is to expand the business and, with the profits, save to buy a house where her little boy can live.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 61 años reside en municipio El  Divisadero departamento de Morazán, vive con su hijo Israel y su sobrina Carolina, tiene su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortilla de maíz. 
Ella aprendió el oficio muy joven y con su venta de tortillas le ayudado a su hijo a estudiar hasta 9° grado ya que después ellos tenían que dedicarse a trabajar por la condiciones económicas para ayudar a los gastos familiares, Gloria necesita un préstamo para compra de materiales los cuales obtendrá a un precio más bajo, ella compraria, Maíz, leña, cal, gas, esto contribuirá a continuar con la  venta y obtener ingresos para solventar las necesidad básicas.
Las aspiraciones de Gloria son ayudar a su sobrina para que termine sus estudios, para que tenga una mejor oportunidad en la vida, y ayudar a mejorar la calidad vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and lives in El Divisadero, a municipality in the department of Morazán, with her son Israel and niece Carolina. She runs a business making and selling corn tortillas. She learned the trade when she was very young. By selling tortillas she helped her son to study as far as the 9th grade, after which time he had to start working to contribute to the household costs, due to the economic conditions. Gloria needs a loan to buy materials at a lower price – she would buy corn, firewood, lime and gas. This will help her continue selling her tortillas and make an income to cover their basic needs. Gloria hopes to help her niece finish her studies, so that she can have better opportunities in life, and to help improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, wool, firewood, lime and gas.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María Estela tiene tiene 28 años de edad, reside en San Francisco gotera del Departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, vive sola con su hijo de 8 años de edad, tiene una sala de belleza, (cortes y cuidado del cabello)
Ellas estudio cosmetología y con sus esfuerzo logro establecer su negocio,  una sala de belleza la cual atiende a personas adultas como a niños, realizándoles cortes de cabello tratamientos y otros, actualmente María solicita un préstamo para compra de productos para el cuidado del cabello y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, solventar la demanda de estos productos, como son tintes, ampolletas para el cuidado del cabello, acondicionado  y champu entre otros y asi atraer más clientes y prestar un mejor servicio.
Los sueños de María son a poyar a su hijo para superar el problemas de lenguaje, colaborarle con los estudios para que  tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Estela is 28 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the department of Morazán. She is a single mother and lives with her 8-year old son. She has a beauty salon (offering haircuts and hair treatments). She studied cosmetology and then worked hard to set up her business, a beauty salon where she offers haircuts, hair treatments and other services for adults and children. María is currently requesting a loan to buy hair care products, in order to offer a better service to her customers, cover the demand for products such as hair dyes, hair care serums, conditioner and shampoo, and other products to attract more customers and offer a better service. María's dreams are to help her son to overcome his language problems, and to support him with his studies so that he has a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, hair care serums, conditioner and shampoo

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 47 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 20 años se dedica en la elaboración D. bordados artesanales, en prendas típicas D. vestir D. su zona. DesD. la comodidad D. su casa, trabaja repartiendo su tiempo entre los labores domesticas y esta actividad artesanal. En temporadas festivas, entre el mes D. junio y julio, es donD. aumentan sus rentas así como la demanda D. estos bordados. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, para ella es una distracción, combinándola con la habilidad utilizar bien los colores en sus  bordados. Por tanto no dejará D. trabajar con el fin D. progresar casa vez más. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. materiales, como: hilos y telas para seguir bordando.
texts.en:
Yudy is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For more than twenty years, she has been producing artisan embroideries and items of clothing typical to the area. From the comfort of her own home, she splits her time between carrying out the domestic tasks and spending time on this artisan craft. During the festive seasons, between June and July, the demand for these embroideries increases, along with her income. She enjoys her work very much; for her it is a hobby and allows her to demonstrate her ability to make good use of colours in her embroideries. She therefore does not intend to stop working and wants to progress further and further with her business. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a means of financial support as she has always proved to be responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal group because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of materials such as threads and fabrics to continue her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La Señoras. María P. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también ha a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 72 años de edad, es viuda hace 35 años,  logro construir  en su juventud su casa la misma que es pequeña, vive solo con una hija quien es madre soltera y le ayuda para los gastos de la casa.
