La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura y sus productos son para el consumo de su hogar.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de más pollos, chanchos y en su alimento.

Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Ms. María P. is a member of the communal bank Nueva Amistad. She lives in the parish of Cumbe, which is characterized by it's landscapes. The people there work in agriculture and cattle. Much of its population has immigrated to the city and to different places in the world seeking a better quality of life for their families. Our member is 72 years old and has been a widow for 35 years. In her youth she was able to build a small house. She lives alone with a daughter who is a single mother and who helps with household expenses. María raisies chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in the community. She also works in agriculture and her products are for home consumption. She has been a member for 3 years and the loans have benefitted her business. Her new loan will be used to buy more chickens, pigs and their feed. Her dream is to continue to stay healthy to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su madre e hijo, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a las manualidades en corrospum (material micro poroso parecido al  plástico). Es experta en trazar y cortar siluetas didácticas, cada una muy distinta de las otras creaciones, y todos sus modelos los realiza sin ningún apoyo visual, solo deja volar su imaginación. Tiene convenios con algunas profesoras de escuelas y madres de familia, a quienes les vende sus trabajos. Recuerda como años atrás trabajaba sola, y  actualmente sus familiares la apoyan para lograr acabar con los pedidos pendientes, durante las fechas celebres. Se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, pues lo realiza en la tranquilidad de su casa, sin descuidar sus labores, aunque dice que lo más difícil fue abrirse mercado inicialmente. Para el futuro tiene pensado crecer empresarialmente y ampliar su negocio, para hacerse conocida en su zona y captar mayor cantidad de clientes.Este es su onceavo préstamo  con MFP, y sabe que le será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Mary tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de corrospum, al por mayor,  de diversos colores, además de plumones acrílicos y pegamentos, que necesita para los acabados de sus materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her mother and son in her own home. For 10 years, she has been working in handicrafts made of corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic). She is an expert in tracing and cutting didactic shapes, each one different from other creations. She makes all of her models without any visual aid; she just lets her imagination go. She has contracts with some school teachers and mothers, to whom she sells her work. She remembers how years ago she worked alone and now her relatives help her to be able to finish her orders around holidays. She feels satisfied with her work because she does it in the calm of her own home without neglecting her housework- although she says it was more difficult to get a client base at first. For the future she plans to grow commercially and expand her business so that she becomes known in the area and can attract more customers. This is the eleventh loan with MFP and she knows it will be very useful to increase her business' capital. She is committed to making all of her payments on time. Mary plans on investing the money she has asked for in buying corrospum wholesale in different colors, in addition to acrylic feathers and glue, which she needs to finish her didactic material.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to continue her business.

loans.name: Ivis

texts.es: Ivis tiene 44 años, vive en compañía D. sus 3 hijos y su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 20 años se dedica a vender D. manera ambulante gelatina, desD. entonces recorre la calles D. su ciudad, las más comerciales para vender este postre. Su hija mayor la ayuda en la preparación una noche anterior, ya que al termino del día Ivis muy cansada llega a su casa. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, porque al final ve las ganancias resultándole rentable. Por el momento desea preparar más gelatinas con el fin D. aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. ingredientes, vasos y utensilios para la preparación D. más gelatina.
texts.en:
Ivis is 44 years old, and she lives with her three children and husband. They own their own home. For more than 20 years, she has sold gelatin desserts on foot in the streets of her city, mostly in the commercial districts. Her eldest daughter helps to prepare the gelatin the night before, as ivis returns to her home quite tired at the end of the day. She enjoys what she does, because in the end, it is profitable. Now, she would like to make more gelatin desserts, with the aim of increasing her income. This is her ninth loan with MFP [the lending partner], and she has always been responsible in making payments. She is very grateful to be a part of this community group, as all members are very supportive and responsible. She will use this loan to purchase ingredients, cups, and utensils used for the preparation of more gelatin.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and utensils for the preparation of gelatin desserts.

loans.name: Carmen Fabiola

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen Pesantez es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la cría de ganado, cuyes, pollos los que vende en su propia parroquia, también trabaja en la agricultura labrando sus tierras.

La Señora Carmen tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 18, 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad y su última hija se encuentra en una escuela, su esposo es chofer de un taxi, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero de manera independiente.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y fue invitada por una gran amiga del bankito, el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de unas vaquitas, su meta es llegar a tener  un asadero de pollos como negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen Pesantez is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) Communal Bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its landscapes. The people devote themselves to farming and livestock. Much of the population has migrated to the city and to various places in the world looking for a better quality of life for their families. Our member raises cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens. She sells them in her own parish. She also works in agriculture; she works her land. Carmen is 37, married, and has four children. The children are 18, 17, 14, and 11 years old. Her first three children go to a high school in the area, and her last daughter is in elementary school. Her husband is a taxi drive. She does not have her own house. She lives in her parents’ house, but in an independent manner. Three years ago our member was invited to become part of the communal bank by a great friend from the communal bank. She will use the new loan to buy some calves. Her goal is to come to have a chicken roasting business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos de 7 años de edad y tres meses de nacido en casa de su suegra, ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace dos años vendiendo comida en un puesto de venta situado dentro de uno de los mercados del distrito, todos los dias ella prepara diversos platos, los cuales ofrece en venta a los comerciantes del centro de abastos donde trabaja y a las personas que frecuentan el lugar. Debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus comidas su negocio cuenta con una acogida especial y sus clientes están contentos con el servicio recibido.

Debido al incremento de la demanda por los productos que ofrece, Matilde ha pensando en comenzar a preparar mas platos de comida con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que contribuyan con el  logro de su meta.

Matilde es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, todo el esfuerzo y dedicación que le otorga a su labor tienen una sola motivación: brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde, age 31, lives with her husband and their two children, a seven year old and a three month old baby. They live in her mother-in-law’s house, which is located in the farming district of Chepén. This area has plenty of commercial movement, and it belongs to the province of the same name. It is located in the La Libertad region. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For two years she has been selling food from a stand, which is in one of the markets in the district. She prepares her diverse dishes everyday. She sells them to the merchants from the supply center where she works and to the people who frequent the place. Due to the good seasoning with which she prepares her food, her business is especially well received. Her customers are happy with the service they receive. Due to the increase in the demand for the products she sells, Matilde has planned to start selling more dishes. She plans on satisfying her customer demand and increasing her sales. That is why she has asked, for the first time, Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 500 soles, which will contribute to reaching her goal. Matilde is a hard-working mother who is very devoted to her family. All of the effort and dedication that she puts into her work in driven by one motivating factor, to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make and sell food

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La Señora Luz León es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también  a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

La Señora Luz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha para criar animales como pollo, chanchos, borregos y vacas, sus animales los vende en su propia parroquia, también se dedica a cultivar sus tierras.

Nuestra socia tiene 59 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad que trabajan y le ayudan en la economía de su hogar, su esposo trabaja en una sastrería y con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Es nuestra socia fundadora hace 13 años y con el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de mas cuyes y así crecer en su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es poder recuperar su salud.
texts.en:
Luz León is a member of the Nueva Amistad (New Friendship) Communal Bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its landscapes. The people devote themselves to farming and livestock. Much of the population has migrated to the city and to various places in the world looking for a better quality of life for their families. Luz devotes herself to the household chores, and she takes advantage of the opportunity to raise animals. She raises animals like chickens, pigs, sheep, and cows. She sells the animals in her own parish. She also cultivates her land. Our member is 59 years old, married, and has two grown children. They work and help with the household finances. Her husband works as a tailor. Thanks to their mutual efforts, they were able to build their own home. Thirteen years ago she was a founding member. She will use the new loan to buy more guinea pigs. This way she will enlarge her business. Her greatest dream is to be able to regain her health.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Leslie Karen

texts.es:
Leslie tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Manco Capac del distrito de Paiján, una zona que se encuentra experimientando un movimiento comercial ascendente, pertenece a la provincia de Ascope y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar vendiendo comida en un pequeño puesto ubicado frente a la posta médica del distrito, a un costado de la carretera Panamericana ( la via asfaltada mas grande del país), ella comparte el negocio con su madre: mientras que por las mañanas ofrece en venta platos como cebiche, papas rellenas (platos típicos del país) y otros platos que ella misma prepara, por las tardes su madre vende cachangas (especie de pan hecho en base a harina de trigo) y champús (bebida caliente hecha en base a maíz).

Leslie siempre atiende a los transportistas y a las personas que transitan cerca a la zona, su buen trato y la excelente sazón con la que prepara sus comidan han hecho que sea conocida en el rubro y que cada vez tenga mas clientes que atender, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de mas insumos para preparar mas platos de comida e incrementar su nivel de ventas.

Leslie es una joven trabajadora y empeñosa, con las ganancias que percibe de su trabajo ella se paga sus estudios en un instituto de la zona. Sus vecinos y amigos la consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Leslie is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Manco Capac sector in the district of Paiján, an area that is experiencing an increase in business movement. This community is part of Ascope Province and is located in the region of La Libertad, which is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Leslie sells food from a small stand in front of the district medical clinic situated along the Pan American Highway, which is the longest paved road in the country. She shares this business with her mother. In the mornings, she sells dishes such as ceviche, stuffed potatoes (a traditional Peruvian dish), and other delicacies that she prepares herself. In the afternoons, her mother sells “cachangas” (a type of bread made from wheat flour) and “champús” (a hot beverage made from corn).

Leslie always serves the drivers and anyone else who travels near the area. Her good service and the delicious flavor of the food that she prepares have brought her local recognition. Each day she has more customers to serve. Leslie is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 PEN so that she can buy more supplies to prepare her dishes and increase her sales.

Leslie is an enterprising and earnest young woman. Using the income she earns from her work, she is able to pay for her studies at the local institute. Her neighbors and friends consider her to be a peaceful and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business

loans.name: Griselda Milagros

texts.es:
Griselda es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a sus hijas en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona de bastante mivimiento comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta y distribución de prendas de vestir en base a pedidos, ella adquiere su mercadería al por mayor en la ciudad de Trujillo y luego la ofrece en venta a sus clientes y vecinos, mayoritariamente ella trabaja en base a pedidos. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad Griselda es muy conocida en el rubro y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

Griselda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas de vestir, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Griselda ya es una clienta recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, durante todo este tiempo ella se ha venido ayudando de Nuestra Empresa para salir adelante, demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Griselda is a 31 year old mother who lives with her daughters in the farming district of Chepén, an area that experiences considerable business movement and belongs to the province of the same name. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For the past five years, Griselda has been selling and distributing articles of clothing according to her orders. She acquires her merchandise in bulk in the city of Trujillo and then offers her products for sale to her customers and neighbors. Most of her work is based on orders. Since she has been in this business for some time, Griselda is well-known and has acquired a group of loyal customers.

Griselda wants to expand her business by purchasing more articles of clothing, which will help her increase her sales and attract more business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can accomplish this goal.

Griselda is a recurring client of Edpyme Alternativa. During the time she has received assistance from the Institution, she has succeeded in being prompt and responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Phalla Eng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla E. is 30 years old and is a village bank president, selected by sixteen people who make up a village bank loan located in Koun Chreae village, Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for various ways that can improve their businesses in the current year. 

Mrs. Phalla E. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice, which she sells to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chun Phorl, is a pig middleman who is able to earn a little money to support his family. 

It is planting time on the farm and she needs to improve production, so she is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, and to hire a plow machine to plow her field. 

This couple has three children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school, while the others are too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, and hire a plow machine to plow her field

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia es una madre de familia de 25 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el caserio Cerro Falla del distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por ser el distrito con la mayor extensión geográfica de la región, se caracteriza por estar conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho entre si. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a casi dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a actividades relacionadas con la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría aves de corral en un area de terreno cercana a su domicilio y las comercaliza, ya sacrificadas, entre sus vecinos. Adicionalmente comercializa carne de pollos de granja, con lo que se genera ingresos estables que le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con la economia familiar.

Cecilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral para comercializarlas entre sus vecinos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión ella espera aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias.

Cecilia ya es una cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 25 year old mom that lives with her husband and small children in the village of Cerro Falla, district of Olmos, characterized for being the district with the largest geographical extension in the region and is comprised by different villages that are faraway from each other. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located almost two hours from the city of Chiclayo. Four years ago she started working in activities related to raising and selling small animals, she raises farm chickens in a place close to her home and then sells them, once slaughtered, to her neighbors. She also sells chicken meat, which helps generate stable income to help her husband with the family economy. Cecilia wishes to expand her business to buy more farm chickens and sell them to her neighbors, she has requested Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1,500 PEN. With this investment she can have more sales and make more profit. Cecilia is a returning client for Edpyme Alternativa and has shown punctuality and responsibility at the time of making her payments. Her neighbors and acquaintances really like her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to sell meat

loans.name: Mr. Mon Meas Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who are villagers in KO. Chreae village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Mon M., who was born in 1974, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

He is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Aside from farming he is also a fisherman, while his wife, Mrs. SaR. Sum, is a seamstress in a garment factory and she is also a pig breeder. 

Now this couple has some problems because their field is far away from aN. irrigation system. Also, their fishing boat is broken. So to solve these problems, Mr. Mon M. is applying for a loan to buy a pump machine, and rest of the loan will be used to buy food for the pigs and resin to mend his fishing boat. 

Mr. Mon M. is the father of three children who all are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, pig food and resin for his boat

loans.name: Mrs. Nary Yann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. is made up of twelve people who live in Koun Chreae village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nary Y. is 41 years old and is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loA. for different purposes. 

Mrs. Nary Y. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thon Chhen, is a fishermA. and a fish-seller. She has a problem because her husband does not have a fishing boat. So to improve his fishing, Mrs. Nary Y. is seeking a loA. to buy a fishing boat to use. 

She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a construction worker, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Mrs. Lem Minh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Koun Chreae village, Kandal province, there are eight people who make up a village bank loan. All of them selected Mrs. Lem M., who was born in 1974, as their village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for various ways that can improve their businesses in the current year.

Mrs. Lem M. is a farmer who owns one point five-hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family, while her husband, Mr. V. Ney, is a fish seller in the local market. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mrs. Lem M. is applying for a loan to buy more fish to resell. 

She is the mother of five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, three are studying in the local public school, and the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector La Campana del distrito de Pitipo, una zona rural cuyos pobladores se dedican netamente a la agricultura. Pertenece a la provincia de Ferreñafe y se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores relacionadas a la agricultura, inició sus labores trabajando como obrero agrícola en los C. de cultivo de la zona y luego pudo adquirir un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar granos y con esta actividad solventa los gastos familiares.

Actualmente el ha instalado un cultivo de maíz y está trabajando arduamente para que este cultivo pueda desarrollarse de buena manera, el ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir abonos para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

José es un hombre entregado a su familia y que gusta mucho de su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Jose is a 32 year old dad that lives with his wife and two children in La Campana, district of Pitipo in a rural area where the inhabitants work in agriculture. Pitipo belongs to the province of Ferreñafe and is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He started working on agricultural activities since he was very young, first as a worker in the fields and then for himself after being able to acquire land, he grows grains and is able to cover the family expenses with this activity. He currently has a corn field and is working hard so that the field can develop well, he has requested Edpyme Alternative for a 2000 PEN loan to allow him to buy fertilizer to maintain the crop. Jose is a man dedicated to his family and a man that enjoys his work, his dream is to be able to keep working to get his family ahead. in the area where they live his neighbors and acquaintances really like him.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for corn field.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia C. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Lower Natimao-an, Carmen Cebu City. She earns a living by running a tailoring business. Nemesia’s husband, Sotero, is 54 years old and a carpenter. They have six children aged between 19 and 36 years old. All of their children have their own families.
Nemesia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, Nemesia has been able to increase her family income. She now earns an average monthly profit of 2,500 PHP from her business activities.
Nemesia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 11,000 PHP was used to purchase a motorcycle, which she and her husband use for the business, and it has made life a little bit easier for them. Now she is borrowing her fifth loan for the amount of 14,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business. Nemesia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sip

texts.en: Mrs. Sip T. has been in the cultivating business for years. She plants rice and vegetable crops to earn a living. Her husband operates his own small business, fishing in and around the river. This couple has been married for many years and has six children. Four of the children are married and three are teenagers going either to school or work. Fishing is the significant source of income for this family and it has provided them with a steady profit. This season is good for fishing. However, Sip T.’s husband doesn’t have enough equipment for his fishing activities. So, Sip T. is requesting a loan to use towards purchasing fishing equipment.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fishing equipment

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
To sustain her businesses of rice farming and hog raising, Merlyn R. would like to request her second and larger loan from KIVA. She has been able to repay on scheduled, the entire amount loaned to her previously and with the profits that her business has made, she has been able to sustain the education of her children. Merlyn hopes to continuously grow her business until it becomes stable and profitable thus enabling her to support the needs of her children. Her dream is to provide them a comfortable life. She is now raising several hogs to be sold in the coming months. Someday when she has the capacity to repay a larger loan, she hopes to raise a larger number of hogs. She also hopes to purchase their own farm equipment to avoid renting from other people.

Merlyn has proven to herself, her family, and ASHI that her business can be well managed and improved She has gained confidence and determination to achieve her dreams and explore a lot more of her productive potential.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm material such as rice seedlings, fertilizers and payment for the rental of farming equipments. Some portion will be used to purchase additional piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie S. is a 22-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling ice candy and other frozen food products. She lives in Brgy Lower Natimao-an, Carmen Cebu City, with her husband and their three-year-old child.
Louie has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2007. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and her own efforts. By working hard in her ice candy and frozen food business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP.
Louie is now borrowing 11,500 PHP as additional working capital for her business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Louie aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Mrs. Vanndy Ael Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 11 villagers from Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The group members will use their portions of the loan in various ways to earn money to support their families.
Mrs. Vanndy A. is 29 years old and has been selected as the village bank president by the other members. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school while the other is two years old. Vanndy is a fruit seller at her local marK. where she is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Naren Theng, is a famer who owns a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. The couple has a problem because their field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Vanndy A. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm in order to increase yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Drocela

texts.en:
Drocela T. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures – a general store and a mobile phone e-loading business. She lives in Prk. Antolanga, Brgy. Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and e-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. 
 
Drocela is now borrowing 17,000 PHP so that she could expand her general store. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Drocela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way. 

 About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia D. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Kalamtukan, Bawayan City, Negros Oriental. She earns a living by operating three business ventures: a general store, buying and selling root crops, and a pig-fattening business. Her husband, Samson D., is 55 years old and works as a farmer. They have three children aged from 27 to 32 years old.
Nelia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her previous four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelia has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to stock up on grocery items for her general store so that she could continue to save up to expand her business in the future. Nelia D. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward achieving her dreams.
About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To stock up on items for her general store

loans.name: My

texts.en:
Mrs. My Y. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life with her own small business in order to earn money to feed her children. She has been producing several types of traditional cakes to sell. She owns a medium size store inside a primary school where she sells her cakes to the students, earning $5 a day. She also received help from her husband with selling these items. 

This older couple are the good parent of seven children. Two of their children are now married and live away from home, while the remaining five are single, going to school or work. My Y. is concerned that her current income is not adequate as her business suffers from insufficient financial capital. My Y. request additional funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a $500 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her business capital.

loans.name: Mrs. Koeun Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen people located in Chong Kaoh-I village, Kandal province. They have selected Mrs. Koeun C. as the village bank president. The members will use their portion of the loan in varied ways.

Mrs. Koeun C., who is 45 years old,  is a congee (a type of rice porridge) seller in the local village while her husband, Mr. Him S., is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he grows crops to sell to support his family.

But now, Mrs. Koeun C. has some problems because her husband’s field is infertile and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Mrs. Koeun C. is the mother of two children, one of whom is helping his father to farm, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her husband's farm

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: The serious-looking person shown in the picture is Mrs. Seng D., 25 years old, who owns a house located near a factory, where she lives with her family. Seng D. was married three years ago to Seng Phally but they have no kids yet. Her husband is a requirement worker (casual laborer) who is also hired by people to build their stone houses. To help meet her family’s daily expenses with more stability, Seng D. works sewing clothes in the garment industry. She gets a specific salary. Seng D. says that she often hires a taxi for traveling to work because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. She will be using part of this loan to purchase a motorcycle that she will drive to work without paying for a taxi. The rest of the loan will be used to repair her old house that is broken.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo S. works hard to achieve stability and profitability in her coconut candy-making and hog-raising businesses. Tirelessly making and selling her candy directly to people in the market to earn money for herself and her two children, Amparo also accepts as many orders for her product as she can accommodate. She sometimes has to turn down orders due to insufficient capital, the same problem that affects her hog-raising business. Her desired growth for a hog after four months or so is often not achieved because she can’t afford to buy the necessary food. This in turn reduces the profits she is trying to earn to make her life as well as her children’s comfortable.

Although Amparo’s two children are already 29 and 37 years old, she still feels responsible for making their lives worth living for. Her 29-year-old daughter, a high school graduate, is a contract-based sales lady in one of the stores in the province. Her other child is a special child who needs her financial and emotional support. With these considerations, Amparo would like to request a loan to finance her plan to grow her businesses. Once they are stable, she will have a valuable inheritance for her children to enrich and maintain in the future. Despite the fact that she is an elderly widow, her love and concern for her two children provide her with the strength to live and continue dreaming.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making coconut candy as well as additional piglets for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun N., 50, has been selling dried fish in the market for years. She is married with a teenage child who attends school. Her husband operates a trailer-motor taxi around the market in the middle of city. Bun N. always buys fresh fish in bulk and turns them into dried fish for sale, enabling her to generate $4 per day to help solve the financial crisis of her family. 

In addition to her fish business, Bun N. also buys plastic items to resell for extra profit. This is the third loan she has requested. Bun N. will use this loan to order to buy a larger quantity of fresh fish to turn into dried fish for sale. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will resupply the inventory of plastics to sell. Bun N. was not available when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: buy a larger quantity of fresh fish to process for resale

loans.name: Babara's Group

texts.en:
Babara lives in a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and Punjabi foods, with her family. Her husband is a tailor; he stitches men’s clothes while Babara stitches women's clothes. She has a son who is getting an education. Babara wants to make him a doctor, that’s why she works very hard to afford his education expenses. 

Babara is very much worried about her family’s financial future. That’s why she wants to expand her business by purchasing an extra stitching machine and hiring a worker. This will increase her income and her family’s living standard will become better.

loans.use: Purchase another sewing machine to expand sewing business

loans.name: Mrs. Yann Na Teom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has eighteen members who live in Thma Kor village, Kandal province. Mrs. Yann Na T. is the village bank president who was  selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yann Na T. was born in 1964. She and her husband, Mr. Mun Lay, are fruit sellers at their local market where they are able to earn soM. money to raise their childR..

Since their business is going well they want to expand it but they do not have enough money to do this. So, to improve their business, Mrs. Yann Na T. is seeking a loan to buy more fruit to sell.

Mrs. Yann Na T. is the mother of three childR. whom all are studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthy Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In Thma Kor village, Kandal province, these twenty members make up a village bank loan. Mrs. BunT. S., who was born in 1959, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. BunT. S. and her husband, Mr. Sam Ol Neou, are teachers who earn a low salary. On the side, they are farmers who own a small piece of land they use to grow crops to sell to support their family. This couple does not have a child.

In their field their crop has a problem because it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, Mrs. BunT. S. is applying for a loan to buy pesticide.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao M., 31 years old, owns a small shop located along the big road where she sells soft drinks and food. She typically makes around $8.33 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for many years to Pin Phoeun, 30, a local farmer, and they have not any children yet. 

Mao M. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has recently come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital. Mao M. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam is a citizen of a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and Punjabi foods.  She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. She has given birth to five children. Two of them are working and the others don’t do anything. She wants to give her children better educational facilities but due to their scanty financial resources, she hasn't been able to achieve her wish.  

Maryam is a very caring lady. She takes care of her house and family and cooks healthy food for them. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade but he hasn’t got his own rickshaw, and that’s why he can't earn as much as the family requires. 

Therefore Maryam has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy a rickshaw and increase his household income.

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva T. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Melva is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Melva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Melva has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melva is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: 08.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Tien L. T. (7) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Tien is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.2 Nam Ngan).


Tien is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Tien owns & operates a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tien has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Tien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase a new sewing machine.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. T. Hao (8) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Cuc (9) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  M. T. Yen (10) is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support service-based business.


4.  L. T. Ha (11) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tien L. T. (7) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Tien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.2 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Tien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy may mới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Hao (8) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Cuc (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  M. T. Yen (10) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  L. T. Ha (11) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn P. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old. Rubelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rubelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products  and also selling different kinds of vegetables especially spices in the local community. Rubelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities. This time  she chose to have the loan of 5000 as her 3rd cycle .

In 2009, Rubelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rubelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rubelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin K. is a middle-aged woman whose husband is shown in the photo. Sin K. is a good homemaker who stays at home to do a daily routine as well as take care of the children. The family is supported by Sin K.’s husband, who is a professional chef. Also, he is hired by people to cook for their wedding parties. 

Sin K. also relies on the income from her children’s jobs: one son is a fisherman and two daughters work sewing clothes in the garment factory. The river is full of fish, which means the situation is good for fishing; however, Sin K.’s son lacks some implements to use on his fishing activities. So, Sin K. has decided to take out a Kiva loan to buy nets, traps, and a boat for her son to use to fish.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps, and a boat.

loans.name: 10-15-02-Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Lam L. T. (42) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Lam is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 02-Dong Son (10-15-02-Dong Son).


Lam is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, Lam owns & operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes  from selling metal & metal-related products in the local community.  Lam has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Lam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  This will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Dien (44) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


2.  N. T. Thanh (37) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.


3.  N. T. Loc (38) is a 31-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


4.  Do T. Ha (36) is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her  tailoring business.


5.  N. T. Nhung (6) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business selling household products.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lam L. T. (42) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoa.  Lam là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02-Dong Son (10-15-02-Dong Son).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm kim loại & có liên quan đến kim loại trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lam thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lam kiếm được khoảng 3500000 VND.  Vào 2008, Lam đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lam đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 20th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Dien (44) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  N. T. Thanh (37) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  N. T. Loc (38) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  Do T. Ha (36) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


5.  N. T. Nhung (6) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Mrs. P. is a 28-year-old married woman living in a medium-sized home with family members in the capital of Phnom Penh. She owns a piece of farmland in her village where she grows different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. 

To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow the rest of her farmland so she can plant other crops. P. has a life partner in her husband who works as an employee in a garment factory, and they have a young school-aged child.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a laborer to plow

loans.name: Chuc's Group

texts.en:
Chuc T. N. is 50 years old. She lives in Phan Xa village. She has three children. Her first son has married. Two children are going to school. Mrs. Chuc has a small store (selling beer and fresh water) in the market. She has had this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her store. She is the leader of 6-member group loan of SEDA.

 About other borrowers in her group:

 Quyen T. L. is 35 years old. She sells building materials. She would like to borrow 4,578,000 VND to invest in her store.
 Hop T. T. is 32 years old. She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.
 Phuong M. N. is 25 years old. She sells clothes in the market. She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.
 Mong T. N. is 42 years old. She sells beer and fresh water. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to invest in her store.
 Theu T. N. is 30 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Mrs. Phan Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan S. is a 52-year-old who is the village bank president, selected by the nine members of the group located in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. Each member will use their portion of their loan for a different purpose to improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Phan S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare (1.25 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she has some problems because her field has infertile soil. S., to improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of her loan to hire farm laborers to help her farm.

Mrs. Phan S. is a widow who lives in a three-member household.

The man who sits on the motorbike in the photo is not a member of this village bank.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida lives in the historical city called Lahore in Pakistan. She is a housewife as well as a working woman. She operates a domestic sewing business to support her family financially.  She takes orders from the families of her community and stitches their clothes at reasonable charges.  

Her husband is also a very hard-working person. He operates a sanitary supplies sales business. He has a shop in the market and has a good customer base.   

Rashida has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest the loan amount in her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy the sanitary supplies such as taps, water pipes etc. in bulk and increases his household income and fulfill the larger orders on time.

loans.use: Purchase plumbing parts for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Chann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people make up this village bank loan and they live in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sopheap C., who is 59 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is a land broker who is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. H. H., operates a trailer and is also able to earn some money to support his family.

Although they both try to work hard they are able to earn only a little money. So, to improve their family living, Mrs. Sopheap C. is applying for a loan to buy rice to sell to start a new business to increase her income this year.

Mrs. Sopheap C. is the mother of a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Mrs. Hang S., age 56, is married and has three children: one is married and two are single; they are no longer in school. All three of her children are employed in the same garment factory. Hang S. is a domestic rice trader who owns a cultivating machine. She provides a plowing service to other farmers for a fee. Her husband works with her in the business. 

Hang S.’s children always go to work by taking a taxi or walking because they don’t have their own vehicle. To resolve the problem, Hang S. has requested a loan from Kiva in the amount of $1,100 to be used to purchase a new motorbike to give to her children for commuting to their workplace.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleanora S. was born in Gavrilovka village (Chui oblast), where she still lives. Eleanora is 36 years old. She grew up in a low-income family, which is why she was unable to continue her studies after graduating from high school and began to help her parents with housework. When she was 27, Eleanora married and gave birth to a son one year later. Now her son is already 8 and studies in a rural school. Eleanora works as a freelance associate editor at the local rural newspaper “Narodnaya Tribuna” (The Peoples’ Tribune). Eleanora’s husband works as a security guard. Their income is hardly enough for their small family.

Like many other people in the village, Eleanora and her husband decided to do animal husbandry. With initial capital of only 15,000 Kyrgyz Soms, the family bought a cow in 2001. With the first earnings from the sale of milk, the family finally reached a stable income. Now Eleanora wakes up without worrying where to get money to feed her family, provide her son with clothes and prepare him for school. 

Eleanora's parents helped her buy a house in the same village. After getting her own home Eleanora pondered over the expansion of her business. Her son is getting older and to allow him to study at a good university, she needs to start saving money today. Eleanora wants to use her loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy another cow to increase milk production, as well as 4 bull-calves and 5 sheep for fattening and resale. 

This hard-working and optimistic woman would like to have another child and sign up her son to a sports section and give him a good education. Because all of this is very costly, Eleanora plans to significantly expand her business in order to always wake up in the morning with confidence and "a penny in her pocket”.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on the interest rate if they pay back without delay.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, bulls and sheep

loans.name: Bich's Group

texts.en:
Bich T. H. P. is 33 years old. She is married with two children. She lives in Xom Ngoai village. She has a store that sells bicycle parts and does repair of bicycles and motors. She has had this job many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to expand her store.

About other borrower in her group:

 Dung T. N. is 49 years old. She would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Lok

texts.en: Lok S. was born in 1976; she is now married with five kids who are going to school or work. She is a good housewife who does daily housework or takes care of the children. She depends on the income from her husband, who works as requirement laborer in the construction field. Lok S. is taking out her loan to mend her old house that is breaking down frequently.

loans.use: To mend her old house that is breaking down frequently.

loans.name: Mr. Vong Ven Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has twenty-one people located in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. They will each use their loan to improve their business in this current year. Mr. V. V., who was born in 1955, has been selected as the village bank president.

Mr. V. V. and his wife, Mrs. Ken Lors, are farmers who own a one-hectare (2.5-acre) plot of land they use to cultivate rice, not to sell, but to raise their family. But now they have a problem because it’s time to grow a crop but they don’t have enough money to support it. So, to improve production, Mr. V. V. is asking for a loan with which to farm this year.

This couple raises seV. children, five of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are helping their parents to farm.

loans.use: To support growing a crop this year

loans.name: Deun's Group

texts.en:
Six people in Krapeu Troum village, Kandal province have formed a loan group and selected 67-year-old Mrs. Deun N. as the leader. Each member will use their loan in varied ways to support their family. 

Mrs. Deun N. is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Deun N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noun N., age 40, who lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming. Noun N. is a married woman who is devoted to her six teenage children who go to school and work as well. Noun N. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows a variety of crops on it. She also built a pigpen behind her home where she raises a few pigs for extra income. 

Recently, she sold all her mature pigs to slaughter and she hope to acquire another sow to continue breeding but she doesn’t have enough money to make that possible. Therefore, Noun N. is applying for a Kiva loan to be used to purchase piglets for her stall. She estimates that she will sell her pigs within the next four months when they are mature. Her husband helps her with the  business activities (he appears on the photo above).

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Phin Sreng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
In the Preaek Be village of Kandal province are nineteen people who make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Phin S. is the village bank president, selected by the other members, each of whom will use a portion of the loan in a different way to improve their family's living conditions. She and her husband, Mr. Tech Neng, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. 

They have some problems because their field has infertile soil, and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Phin S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are helping her to do faming, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Being young and full of energy, 29-year-old Janet C. is enjoying her career as a mother and a single parent to her three year old child, as much as being a business woman. While her one and only child is still very young, she wants to request a loan which will be invested into her business. That way, her dreams of turning her “sari-sari” store into a mini- grocery store would be accomplished. The difference between the two types of stores is that the “sari-sari” store is a smaller store either a cottage separated from the owner’s house or attached to the house. The inventory is composed of a smaller variety of grocery items, foodstuff, and beverages whereas a mini- grocery store covers a wider variety of products and sells a larger volume of grocery items, foodstuff, and beverages. Unlike “sari-sari” store which can only accommodate to resale, mini- grocery store have the capacity to wholesale. 

With the profits of her business, Janet would set up a savings fund to finance her dream of building a concrete house where she and  her child would be secure and comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of foodstuff, grocery items, and beverages to resale.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.en:
Gilma T. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Gilma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gilma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector buying & selling of dried foods. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the buying and selling of dried squid and fish in the local community. Gilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Gilma is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & increased working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Yong Muth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has thirteen people who live in Preaek Be village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yong M., who is 49 years old, was selected by the other members as the group leader. Each group member will use their portion of their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yong M. is a fruit seller in the local market where she is only able to earn a little bit of money because she has a small amount of capital. So to improve this business, Mrs. Yong M. is applying for a loan to buy more sapotas (fruit of the Sapodilla tree) to resell. Her husband, Mr. Vy Seth, is a vegetable seller at the market where he is able to earn some money to support his family. Through this activity, they support five children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are attending a local public school. All the children are also helping with their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy more sapotas to resell

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea D. is from the village of Bug-ong, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Irenea is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Irenea owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Irenea has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Irenea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Irenea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
