loans.use: To buy more biscuits, peanuts, bread, candy, milk, juice to sell.

loans.name: Trustful Friends Group

texts.en:
Reatta Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Trustful Friends." She is 27 years old, married and has three children between one and 7 years old. She also cares for two siblings She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to financial constraints.  For two years, she has been selling red palm oil in Gbarnga, Bong County, central Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 20,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of red palm oil. She describes herself as jovial. Her goal is to improve her business, build a storeroom and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amelia is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red palm oil.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 37 and married with one child. He is a butcher, a business he has been in for four years. He joined the Rafiki group under Faulu Kenya so as to access loans. He has requested a loan of 20, 000 KES to buy an electrc weighing machine, a cooker and a warmer. He hopes to expand his business, purchase a plot of land, and build commercial houses where his butcher's store will be housed.

loans.use: To buy an electric weighing machine, cooker and warmer.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 34 years old and married to a driver.  She started selling poultry three months ago, and previously she sold charcoal for a living. She wants to stabilize her business hence she has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more chickens for selling. Catherine is blessed with twins, Dennis and Kelvin, and she works hard to educate them.  She hopes to buy a piece of land and build a home in the future.

loans.use: To buy chickens for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more new movies for her mini-cinema

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more eggs, bread, tea, and butter for selling.

loans.name: Eric

texts.es:
El señor Eric es soltero vive con sus padres en casa  propia, vive en la zona de Pasankeri Sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Eric trabaja como diseñador gráfico  de cuyo trabajo percibe un ingreso que le ayuda.
El crédito solicitado es para comprar una computadora mas moderna y así mejorar sus diseños y también sus ingresos.
Esta es la cuarta  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eric is single and lives with his parents in their own house. He lives in the area of Pasankeri Sur in the city of La Paz. Mr. Eric works as a graphic designer from which he receives an income that helps him. The loan he is asking for is to purchase a more modern computer and therefore improve his designs and his income. This is the fourth time that he has asked for a loan and the socio-economic analysis conducted qualifies him favorably so he can receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a more modern computer in order to have newer graphic design programs for his work

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio es casado tiene tres hijos vive en la casa de su padre en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Silvio trabaja como maestro albañil siendo esto su único ingreso ya que la esposa se dedica a cuidar a los hijos.
El crédito solicitado es para la operación de su padre ya que tuvo un accidente.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio is married, has three children, and lives in his parent’s house in the area of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. Mr. Silvio works as a bricklaying teacher. This is his family’s only income because his wife works by taking care of the children. The requested loan is for a medical operation for his father because he had an accident. This is the first time that he has asked for a loan, and the socio-economic analysis qualifies him favorably for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for a medical operation for his father, who suffered an accident

loans.name: Hermelinda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Hermelinda de 40 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada así porque es su originalidad habían muchas flores Orquídeas), desde hace muchos años ella tiene una tienda de vivieres. 

Antes de tener la tienda ella no tenia donde comprar comida porque quedaba muy lejos el mercado, al ver ella la necesidad comenzó a comprar mas comida de la que necesitaba en la semana y venderla a sus amigas, poco a poco se convirtieron las ventas en una pequeña tienda, hasta ahora que trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quieren comprar azúcar, arroz, enlatados para su pequeña tienda, en el futuro quiere que sus dos hijos terminen sus estudios con existo y surtir mas su tienda.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 40 years old and lives in the Orquídeas of Guayquil (urban area, named because there were originally many orchid flowers). For several years she has had a general store. Before having this store she did not have anywhere to buy food because she lived very far from the market. Upon seeing this need, she began to buy more food than she needed for the week and she sold it to her friends. Little by little this converted into a small store. Now she works from 6:30 am until 10 pm every day. With the loan they want to buy sugar, rice, and canned goods for her small store. In the future she hopes that her two children finish their studies with success and she hopes to further supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sugar, rice, canned goods

loans.name: Nahybe

texts.es:
La señora Nahybe es soltera, vive con su hermano y su abuela en casa propia de sus padres, quienes se fueron a la Argentina. Nahybe vive en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Nahybe administra un negocio de comida que sus padres le dejaron, sus tías son las que le ayudan a atender y con lo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para ampliar su negocio y comprar un horno más grande para tener mejores ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Miss Nahybe is single and lives with her brother and her grandmother in her parents’ house, who went to Argentina. Nahybe lives in the area of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. Miss Nahybe runs a catering business that her parents left her. Her aunts help her tend to the business and she maintains the house with what she earns. The requested loan is to increase her business and buy a bigger oven to have a better income. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualified her favorably so she can receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bigger oven for her catering business

loans.name: Bugolo Zibulaatudde Kikondo Group 2-Lugazi

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old N. Zowerah describes herself as astute, diligent, trustworthy and down to earth. She, like many other young women on the sunny side of 35, has chosen to empower herself financially with the support of her fishing business, which she has plied for the last 10 years in Kidodo-Mpigi.  

She has combined earnings from this business and her other reliable side business (rentals), to provide for her family. She has been married for the last 15 years and has six children. Her business has grown by leaps and bounds though its threshold was a little modest given the minimal capital she had then. She was hard-pressed in terms of availability of cash. That meant she could not purchase enough fish to resell on a large scale. As her narrow circumstances subsided over the years, she starting making strides and it has been like that since. Measures to expand her business into a large-scale one have not seen the light of day primarily due to problems of finance. 

In a month, she operates on generated profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings. She is upbeat about the prospect of these profits rising with the rejuvenation she is planning after she gets this loan. She is planning on buying fishing nets and a boat after she gets this loan.

loans.use: Buying fishing nets and a boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: AM/FM radios, boxes of electric knives, electric irons, hammers, extension cords, belts, and security locks

loans.name: Bugolo Zibulaatudde Kikondo Group 1-Lugazi

texts.en:
Twenty-three years down the road operating a fishing business is quite remarkable. Longevity in this cutthroat business normally points to individual hallmarks of hard work, constant planning, resilience, determination and a creative vision. If you take the example of 44-year-old N. Tausi, then you have got a clear testimony to the above. 

This happy-go-lucky and affable married mother of six has brought profit grist to her business mill, selling fish all these years. Her business status at present reads like a rags-to-riches success story. With savings from her first farming business, which she still operates at a small scale, Tausi was able to set forth on this business. Casting her mind back, she says her farming business was not as lucrative as this one. She says she had to grapple with a lot of financial difficulty at that time. 

As of now, she is planning on building a better family house if her prospects improve with this loan. In a month, her profits total up to 240,000 shillings (about $106). With this loan, she says she wants to buy a boat.

loans.use: Purchasing a boat

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Martha Lorena B. tiene 52 años, es madre soltera tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos conviven con ella los otros tres ya son adultos y tiene su propio hogar. Esta mi coempresaria tiene mas de 10 años de administrar una pulpería en donde vende productos en general principalmente granos básicos y carne de res y pollo. Además ejerce la profesión de maestra de primaria, sin embargo el salario es muy poco por lo que a través de su pulpería obtiene sus otros ingresos para poder sustentar su hogar.

Esta microempresaria ha sido beneficiada en dos ocasiones por préstamos de kiva los cuales fueron utilizados para crear seguridad al local y para comprar vitrinas, a la vez se siente muy agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva al igual con los funcionarios de kiva en darles estas oportunidades de poder acceder a estos pequeños prestamos.

En esta ocasión necesita prestar para comprar productos para su pulpería y poder obtener mejores y mas ingresos y poder mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. 

1 Bidón de aceite el cual compra a US 36, 1 quintal de azúcar el quintal le cuesta US 33,25 sacos de  carbón a US 1.40 cada saco, 1 quintal de  arroz nacional a US 32 el quintal,  80 libras de carne de res compra la libra a US 1.50 y 80 libras de  pollo entero a US 1.80 cada libra.
texts.en:
The small businesswoman, Martha, is 52 years old and a single mother with five children. Two children live with her and the other three are adults and have their own homes. She has been running a small grocery store for the past ten years. She sells general products such as grains, beef and chicken. She is also a primary school teacher. Her salary is small so she has the small grocery store in order to earn enough income to maintain her home. This small businesswoman has had the benefit of two loans from Kiva. She used them to create local security and to buy supplies. She is very thankful for these loans from Kiva and to the workers at Kiva that give her the opportunity to obtain these small loans. On this occasion she needs the loan to buy products for her store in order to improve her earnings, which will improve the standard of living for herself and her family. She will buy oil for $36, sugar for $33.25, sacks of coal for $1.40 per sack, rice for $32 a quintal, 80lbs. of beef at $1.50 per pound and 80lbs of chicken at $1.80 per pound

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Oil, sugar, coal, local rice, beef and whole chicken

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
Remberto  vive en la zona “Villa Victoria” de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus suegros.
 
Trabaja como chofer propietario de taxi en uno de los sindicatos los cuales cubren las rutas  en el centro de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de repuestos y la reparación de su movilidad, ya que por el constante uso se vio con algunos contratiempos en el desarrollo de sus actividades
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Remberto lives in the "Villa Victoria" neighborhood of the city of La Paz. He lives in his in-law's house with his wife and three school-age children. He owns and drives a taxi for one of the unions that cover routes in the center of the city. The loan would go towards the purchase of spare parts and the repair of his vehicle, which has some setbacks because of its constant use. This is his first loan from Impro, and he passed the evaluation to qualify to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spart parts and maintenance for a taxi

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a manicure and pedicure business. She lives in Barangay Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City.

Jocelyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her manicure and pedicure business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000.

Jocelyn is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that her can have additional working capital for her business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Jocelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. In the accompanying photo Jocelyn (in red) poses with one of her customers. 


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena, de 47 años, es una mujer  muy trabajadora, que vive en una  casa alquilada, junto a su hijo adolescente.El arreglo y confección de prendas de vestir, han sido en la vida de Azucena una actividad necesaria para vivir. Desde que tenía 16 años, su madre le enseñó este trabajo que le generaba buenas ganancias, y por eso decidió continuar desempeñando estas labores. Ahora tiene su propia máquina de coser, con la que trabaja sin la ayuda de nadie. La mayoría de sus clientes son las madres de familia del colegio de su hijo, que saben de  la calidad de su trabajo, y por esta razón, la visitan en su puesto que tiene  en el mercado de la zona por donde vive. Le gusta su trabajo, porque es tranquilo y le genera buenas ganancias. Para mas adelante tiene pensado  comprarse otra máquina, para realizar acabados más  impecables en las prendas.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo dice que esta muy orgullosa de su grupo de trabajo, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios en el pago de sus cuotas.Azucena tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  repuestos para su máquina de coser, que es su principal  herramienta de trabajo, además adquirirá  telas, cierres y conos de hilos al por mayor, pues quiere cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Azucena, 47 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in a rented house with her adolescent son. Designing and making dresses has been a necessary activity for her to live. When she was 16, her mother taught her this skill -- one that could generate good earnings for her. For that reason, she decided to continue this line of work. Now, she has her own sewing machine, enabling her to work without anyone else's help. The majority of her customers are mothers with children who attend her son's school and know the quality of her work. For that reason, they visit her post in the market of the zone where she lives. She likes her work, because it is pleasant and provides good earnings. Someday, she hopes to buy another machine, to be able to accomplish more impeccable finishes for her creations. This is Azucena's 12th loan with MFP and she is sure that the money will be beneficial in developing her activity. Also, she says that she is very proud of her working group, since all the members are very responsible and show solidarity in making their payments. Azucena plans to invest the requested funds in buying parts for her sewing machine – her principal working tool – and, in addition, acquiring cloth, zippers, and cones of thread at wholesale, so that she can to fill the orders she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PARTS FOR HER SEWING MACHINE AND SUPPLIES FOR HER SEWING

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en:
Charisse D. C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Looc, Argao, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling cellphone accessories and selling ready-to-wear clothes. Her 24-year-old husband, James D. C., works as a technician to earn a living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have one child who is seven years old. 

Charisse joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her eight previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charisse has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a profit of 32,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, to improve her business and pay for her daughter's education. Charisse D. C. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward achieving her dreams. 

 About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additonal working capital

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia E. is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City. She earns her living by running a food-vending business.
Letecia’s 53-year-old husband, Domingo, is a poultry employee and they have six children aged between 7 and 22 years old. Two of their children currently go to school and also help their parents in the business, while one of the children is already married and the other three are working.
Letecia joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2005 in the hope of helping her husband to improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase her family income from her food-vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 8,000 PHP from her business activities.
Letecia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her food-vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking her tenth loan, for 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use in her food-vending business. Letecia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth C., 49 years old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business. She lives in Hacienda Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their five children who are between 21 and 29 years old. Lilibeth has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 7,200. Lilibeth is now borrowing Php 19,500 to add to her working capital. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lilibeth aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Jeremae

texts.en: Jeremae V. is a 33-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Hacienda Purisima, Manapla, Negros Occidental. Jeremae has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000. Jeremae is now borrowing Php 25,000 to add to her working capital. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jeremae aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia C. is a married woman who lives in Barangay 4, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a refrigerator repair shop and a used-clothing/RTW (Ready-To-Wear) business. Her husband, Danilo C., who is 57 years old, works as a refrigerator repairman to earn his living. Their children are from 25 to 34 years old.

Herminia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 10th loan, Herminia is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her refrigerator repair shop so that she can continue to save for the future and for house improvements.

Herminia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her refrigerator repair shop

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is a widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Sitio Pangpang, Barangay Tiglawig, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental, with her seven children who are from 24 to 41 years old. Celsa has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,500. Celsa is now borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can continue her general store business. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Celsa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda G. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Upper Cogon Bago, Compostela, Cebu Province. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a bairan (tool-sharpening) business and a general store. Her husband Ritchie G., who is 30 years old, helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are from 4 to 12 years old.

Yolanda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon five years ago because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past seventeen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 18th loan, Yolanda is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to buy more tools and equipment for her tool-sharpening business so that she can continue to save to attain her dream to have a shop in the local market.

Yolanda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more tools and equipment for her tool-sharpening business

loans.name: Masias

texts.es: Masias, 46 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la selva tropical, donde tienen su propia casa. Hace más de 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo y comercialización de cacao y café, siendo la mayoría de las veces sus ventas muy exitosas. Con el tiempo ha logrado tener su propia molinera de arroz, en donde produce y vende a sus clientes a un precio competitivo, y eso le da mucha satisfacción económica. Generalmente trabaja con su esposa e hijos desde las 5 de la mañana hasta 8 de la noche, siendo su punto de venta al frente del mercado de su misma localidad. Por otro lado sus campos cultivados son cuidados y protegidos por sus operarios de confianza, pero en lo posible supervisa sus plantaciones cacao y café. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando con sus cuotas establecidas durante las fechas establecidas, además esta satisfecho con la institución, ya que lo brinda muchas facilidades de crédito. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su molinera de arroz, además derivará en la compra de insumos para su molinera.
texts.en:
Masias is 46 years old, married and has six children. They all live in the town of San Francisco, located in the tropical jungle where they have their own house. For the last twenty years he has been working in the agricultural field, specifically the growing and selling of cocoa beans and coffee. He has been successful with this business most of the time. With time he has bought a rice mill. He sells rice flour at a competitive price to his customers. This helps him economically. Generally he works with his wife and children from five in the morning until eight at night. He sells his product in the market in his town Trustworthy workers care for and protect his fields and crops. If he is able, he also looks after his cocoa and coffee plantations. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He is committed to paying back his loan payments on the due dates. He is very happy with this institution that allows him to get a loan. With the loan that he is requesting he will invest in the maintenance of his rice mill and also buy raw materials for the mill.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain his rice mill.

loans.name: Rolando Concepción

texts.es:
El señor Rolando Concepción  R. O., tiene 39 años de edad vive en el Barrio La Borgoña es soltero y se dedica a la agricultura del aguacate desde hace 21 años, el problema principal ha sido la falta de financiamiento de los bancos y algunas financieras para este rubro.

Él se inicio en esta actividad gracias a su esfuerzo propio e iniciativa, puesto que analizó una fuente de ingresos y con sus ahorros se dispuso a dedicarse a esta actividad, tras todos estos años de siembra desea realizarle un mantenimiento mas optimo a sus tierras es por esta razón que solita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes y pesticidas que permitan este beneficio a las futuras cosechas, esto favorecerá al  productor con capital necesario para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Rolando Concepción R. O. is 39 years old. He lives in the neighborhood La Borgoña, is single and has worked in the cultivation of avocados for 21 years. The main problem has been the lack of financing in this area from banks and financial organizations.

He began thanks to his own efforts and initiative, after he analyzed a source of income and used his savings to get himself into this work. During all these years sowing, he wants to optimize his management of the lands. This is why he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural materials such as fertilizers and pesticides that will benefit future harvests. This will favor the producer with the necessary capital for future investments.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Antolanga, Brgy. Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures - a general store and a business raising livestock, which consists of a backyard piggery and keeping carabaos (water buffalo). 

Her husband Jose C., is 60 years old and a retired employee. They have four children who are 21 to 32 years old.  Anita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP,  which is raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan cycle, she is borrowing 17,500 PHP which she intends to use for additional working capital for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future. Anita C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”

La Sra. Miluska pertenece a la alcancía comunal “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”, que tiene trabajando  doce años con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, conformada por diez socias que se dedican a su familia y trabajo D. forma constante y dedicada.

El nombre D. la alcancía “ESTRELLA D. BELEN”, surgió con la idea D. una antigua socia, que a fallecido hace poco, la antigua socia siempre hablaba D. la estrella D. Belén y que todas las participantes deberían tener un punto fijo en donD. mirar para así alcanzar sus objetivos, bajo esta premisa se fijo el titulo “ESTRELLA D. BELÉN”; La Sra. Miluska tiene ocho años con el cargo D. secretaria y ha demostrado un excelente compromiso con su grupo.

Miluska es comerciante, venD. CD’S educativos, juegos didácticos, portarretratos e identifica y aprovecha el material o productos para vender según la fecha festiva. Ella también es profesora D. un colegio D. nivel inicial, solo trabaja en la mañana y por la tarD. con mucho esfuerzo sale a la calle a vender sus productos educativos.
Trabaja como comerciante desD. que ingresó a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD y gracias a su esfuerzo y a esta organización, ha logrado muchos ingresos con su negocio como comerciante, con los que ha conseguido construir su casa y darles estudios a sus hijos, su esposo se encarga D. pagar los gastos como alimentación y los servicios básicos D. agua, luz, teléfono, etc.

Sus planes para futuro es seguir ahorrando y lograr mudarse, debido a que la zona en donD. vive es peligrosa y no muy agradable. El préstamo que ha recibido lo usara para capital D. trabajo y seguir mejorando su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Star of Bethleham” Community Bank Mrs. Miluska belongs to the “Star of Bethlehem” Community Bank. She has been working for twelve years with “Edaprospo-Prosperidad” along with the ten members. All the members are always dedicated to family and work. An older member that died recently suggested the name of the bank, “Star of Bethlehem”. The older member always spoke of the Star of Bethlehem and that all of the members should have a fixed point to look towards to achieve their goals. This is why they choose the name “Star of Bethlehem”. Mrs. Miluska has been a member for eight years. She is the group secretary and has maD. an excellent contribution to the group. Miluska is a saleswoman. She sells educational CD’s and games and picture frames. She looks for and buys materials and products to sell according to the time of the year. She is also a teacher of level one at the secondary school. She only works in the morning. In the afternoon, with a lot of effort, she goes out to the streets to sell her educational products. She has worked as a saleswoman ever since she started with “Edaprospo-Prosperidad”. Thanks to her efforts and the efforts of the organization she has earned a good salary in her business as a saleswoman. With her earnings she has built a house and provided an education for her children. Her husband is in charge of paying for expenses like food and basic services like water, light, telephone, etc. Her plan for the future is to continue saving and move. The area where she lives is dangerous and not very pleasant. The loan that she receives will be used for working capital and to improve the quality of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy educational materials to fill previous orders. To celebrate the Peruvian Independence Day she will buy flags, rosettes, posters related to Independence Day and previously ordered items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sheet metal, wood, nails

loans.name: Vitalia

texts.es: Vitalia,  de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos.Trabaja como enfermera durante 3 veces a la semana, y el resto de días se dedica a la venta de quesos y manjares. Como es oriunda de la sierra peruana, sus padres le proveen de estos comestibles y también de  alverjas y papas, de acuerdo a la temporada,  ella los comercializa  a sus vecinos y conocidos. Sus compradores frecuentes son las enfermeras y doctores del policlínico donde trabaja, y también algunas pacientes, quienes cada vez le hacen más pedidos,  jamás imaginó proveerse de su mercadería  cada 15 días, como lo realiza en la actualidad. Se siente muy feliz por el trabajo que desempeña; donde ya lleva 5 años. Para mas adelante tiene planeado cumplir con  su mayor anhelo, que es instalar una librería en su casa y también quiere construir su casa de material noble.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy útil para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además porque  no quiere perjudicar a sus compañeras de grupo, que la ayudaron en sus inicios.Vitalia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en el incremento de quesos, manjares y rosquitas al por mayor, para abastecerse bien y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Vitalia is a very hard-working 35 year old mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She works as a nurse 3 days a week, and works selling cheese and sweets the other days. As she is originally from the mountain range of Peru, her parents provide her with those food items, as well as peas and potatoes when they are in season. She sells them to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her customers are often the nurses and doctors at the clinic where she works, as well as some patients. Every time they request more products from her. She never imagined she would be able to provide for herself every 2 weeks selling these products as she does. She feels very happy with the work that she does, and she has been working there for 5 years. In the future she plans to fulfill her greatest desire--installing a bookstore in her house, and she also wants to build a house of sturdier material. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she knows that the loan will be very helpful in increasing her capital. She is committed to repaying the loan on time, especially because she does not want to cause harm to her group members who have helped her from the beginning. Vitalia plans to invest the loan money in buying cheese, sweets, and bread in bulk in order to stock her supplies and fill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for sale

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo de 39 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). El es guardia de seguridad en una empresa de televisión en Guayaquil, se traslada de Duran a Guayaquil, de lunes a sábado.  

Hace un año atrás su esposa lo abandono y el se tuvo que hacer cargo de sus dos hijos, con esfuerzo y dedicación hasta ahora ha podido trabaja y cuidar a sus hijos. Con la ayuda de su hermana el sale de lunes a sábados a trabajar. Pero para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos el quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y piedra para su casa. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder tener su negocio propio para pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 39 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, a semi-urban area with ecological problems. He is a security guard for a television company in Guayacuil and travels from Duran to Guayaquil from Monday to Saturday. A year ago his wife left him and he has had to continue raising their two children on his own. With a lot of effort and dedication he has been able to work and care for his children. With his sister's help, he leaves from Monday to Saturday to work. In order to provide a better life for his cihldren he wants a loan to buy cement, bricks, and stone for his house. In the future he wants to finish building his house and have his own business so that he can spend more time with his children.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, bricks, stone

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
El señor Salome A. B., tiene 53 años de edad vive en San Ignacio es casado y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos domésticos, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, que actualmente están estudiando, el se dedica a la agricultura de la piña.

Uno de los problemas que ha tenido el señor Salome en sus terrenos, es la Infección de Plagas y enfermedades, es por esta razón que nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que permitan un mejor mantenimiento a las cosechas para una mejor producción, esta será su octavo ciclo y dice sentirse agradecido por el apoyo brindado ya que su cosecha se ha multiplicado y a podido agrandaar sus terrenos que ha abonado en gran medida a una mejor economía que beneficia diariamente a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Salome A. B. is 53 years old and lives in San Ignacio. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He has three adult children who are in school, and he works as a pineapple farmer. Infection by pests and diseases are among the problems that Mr. Salome has faced with his land. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan again. He will buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies, which will allow him to better maintain his crops and to improve his output. This will be his eighth loan cycle and he says that he feels very grateful for the support offered to him. His harvest has increased and he has been able to expand his lands, which he attributes largely to the benefits of his household's improved economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies, which will help him to better maintain his crops

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CRISTO EL SALVADOR”

La alcancía comunal “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” es llamada así porque sus miembros son personas muy católicas y han encontrado un soporte en su religión.
Lucia es socia de esta alcancía, muchos años atrás afrontó la muerte de su esposo y quedó viuda entonces tenia que hacerse cargo de sus 7 hijos, entonces fue ahí donde se apoyo de su fe en Dios para continuar y darse fuerzas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y lo consiguió, pudo criar a sus hijos hasta verlos adultos, gracias a su esfuerzo y positivismo, y al apoyo moral que sintió al tener fe en Cristo.
Pero pasaron los años y nuevamente su fe en Dios fue puesta a prueba con la muerte de 2 de sus hijos, dejándola a cargo de 3 nietos.
Lucia tenía que trabajar para criar a sus nietos, pero el trabajo de lavar ropa ya no es recomendable para su salud, ya que contaba con 65 años, y entonces gracias a una donación, hecha por vecinas del lugar donde vive, Lucia recibió una carreta ambulante para la venta de dulces, gaseosas, galletas, etc.
Lucia piensa usar el préstamo de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, para continuar con la venta de dulces, galletas y gaseosas que lo realiza en una esquina de su casa, al lado de una canchita de futbol, donde siempre faltan las refrescantes gaseosas cada vez que los vecinos juegan algún partido.
texts.en:
“CRISTO EL SALVADOR (Christ the Savior)” COMMUNAL BANK The communal bank “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” is called as it is because its members are devout Catholics and have found support from their religion. Lucia is a member of this bank, many years ago she faced the death of her husband and she remains a widow. She had to take care of her 7 children, and it was at that time that she was supported by her faith in God to keep going and it gave her strength to keep moving forward for her children, and she succeeded, she was able raise her children to adulthood, thanks to her strength and positivity, and moral support that she felt having faith in Christ. But the years have passed and again her faith in God was put to the test with the death of 2 of her children, leaving her to look after 3 grandchildren. Lucia had to work to raise her grandchildren, but working washing clothes was not recommended for her health, as she is 65 years old, and then thanks to a donation, made by the neighbors where she lives, Lucia received a street cart for selling sweets, soft drinks, cookies, etc. Lucia is thinking of using the loan from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, to keep selling sweets, cookies and soft drinks which she does at a corner by her house, next to a football field, where refreshing soft drinks are always needed each time that the neighbors play any match.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, cookies, soft drinks, etc for her kiosk, also hot chocolate because the weather is cold.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en la  casa de su madre  junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la  preparación y venta  de salchipapas (platillo compuesto de papas y pedazos de pollo fritos), atiende todos los días, en la puerta de su casa. Tiene varios clientes fijos que gustan de su sazón, y también suelen comprarle seguido porque sus platillos tienen un precio accesible. Lo que más le gusta es que su trabajo es tranquilo porque no descuida las labores del hogar, y su mayor preocupación, es atender con higiene y cordialidad su negocio, por lo que le genera muy buenas utilidades. Los primeros días de la semana no termina de vender lo preparado, pero durante los fines de semana, sus ventas se revierten y obtiene mejores ganancias. Para mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio, y para lograrlo seguirá administrando su negocio como siempre.Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso  para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar todas  sus cuotas a tiempo.Luz  tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de una vitrina y varios vidrios para las mesas, pues desea  ofrecer una buena atención a sus comensales, y  de esta manera desea continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, is a hard-working mother who lives with her husband and three children in her mother's house. For the past 4 years she has been making and selling “salchipapas” (a typical dish made of potatoes and pieces of fried chicken) every day in the doorway of her house. She has some regular customers who like the taste of her food, and also buy from her often since her prices are reasonable. What she likes most about her job is the peace of mind it gives her because she can keep up with her housework. Her biggest worry about her business is maintaining good hygiene, and the good will of her customers because it generates a better income. In the first few days of the week she doesn't finish selling all that she has prepared, but on the weekends her sales turn around and she has higher earnings. In the future she would like to expand her business, and to succeed, she will continue running it herself as she always has. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that the loan will be very helpful to increase her working capital. For this reason she promises to make all her repayments on time. Luz will use the money to buy a showcase and some glass for the tables so that she can offer more to her customers, and thus her business can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase and restock her business

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendiendo Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Víctor es un joven de 21 años  a su corta edad  es muy empeñoso y trabajador, el es estudiante universitario estudia la carrera de Ingeniería hambiental de recursos naturales, lamentablemente dejo sus estudios para dedicarse a trabajar, junto a su pareja  vendieron un terreno y con el dinero obtenido han podido dar la inicial para comprarse un  carro este se ha convertido en su herramienta de trabajo, ahora esta haciendo servicio de taxi trabaja aproximadamente 10 horas diarias con este trabajo  ha encontrado estabilidad y tranquilidad ya que el mismo administra sus horarios, con sus ganancias puede pagar las cuotas del carro también puede  ahorrar algo mas.
Lo que mas desea víctor es terminar de pagar su carro y seguir estudiando hasta terminar su  carrera  universitaria, este préstamo desembolsado le servirá para pagar la inscripción de su carro para pertenecer a una empresa de transportes  lima – Huaral- lima,  una ciudad que esta a 2 horas de lima – Perú esto le generara ganancias mas estables, el grupo que el conforma se llama “JOVENES EMPRENDIENDO HACIA EL FUTURO “el es presidente del grupo integrado por 10 jóvenes. 

* Victor es el 5to de la derecha esta con polo negro,blanco y rojo.
texts.en:
Víctor is a young man of 21 years. At his young age he is very industrious and hard-working. He is a university student studying environmental engineering of natural resources. Unfortunately he left his studies to work. He and his partner sold a plot of land and with the money they were able to purchase a car, which they converted to a work tool. He is now providing a taxi service and works approximately 10 hours per day. This work has provided him with stability and tranquility since he controls his own schedule. With his earnings he can make payments on the car and also save something more. Victor most wants to pay down his car and continue his studies to finish his university career. This disbursed loan will pay for the registration of his car to belong to a Huaral, Lima transport company. Huaral is a city located 2 hours from Lima, Peru. This will generate a more stable income for him. His group is called "Jovenes Emprendiendo Hacia el Futuro" ("Youths Borrowing for the Future"). He is the president of the group made up of 10 members. *Victor is the 5th to the right with the black, white and red shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay the registration of his car to belong to a company

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make beignets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her farm and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Reina Marisel

texts.es:
Reina Marisel, tiene 34 años de edad, Reside en el Municipio de San Francisco Gotera del Departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, vive con su único hijo de 16 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y bebidas refrescantes.
Reina se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, y también a mercadería enchape en oro, desde hace 15 años ella se ha dedicado a estas actividades, con que ayuda a su hijo con los estudios, y los gastos para las necesidades básicas de la familia, ella comercializa el pan en la orilla de la calle, donde es punto estratégico para la circulación de clientes que viajan para zonas cercanas a Gotera.
Reina  solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería en enchape y pan dulce, y bebidas carbonatadas, esto contribuirá a mantener el negocio de reina, para que o fresca  nuevos productos a sus cliente.
Las aspiraciones de reina son fortalecer su negocio y ahorrar para tener su propia casa, ya que actualmente alquila su vivienda.
texts.en:
Reina Marisel, 34 years of age, resides in the municipality of San Franciso Gotera in the Morazón Department. She is a single mother and lives with her only child who is 16 years of age. She earns a living selling pan dulce [traditional Mexican pastries] and refreshing drinks. Reina has earned a living selling pan dulce, and also gold-plated merchandise, for fifteen years by which she helps pay for her son’s schooling and the basic needs of the family. She sells her pastries along the roadway at a strategic point for the traffic of customers who are traveling through to areas that neighbor Gotera. Reina is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of gold-plated merchandise and pan dulce, and carbonated drinks, which will help keep her business going, in order to offer new products to her customers. Reina aspires to build up her business and save up to buy her own house since currently she rents her housing.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pan dulce, carbonated drinks, and gold-plated merchandise.

loans.name: Benitos

texts.es:
Benitos tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa, sus suegros y a dos hijos que aun tiene a su cargo, el lugar donde reside se llama Tranca Sasape, la localidad es una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina), el brinda su servicio cubriendo rutas que unen a su caserío con las zonas aledañas y gracias a esta actividad obtiene una fuente importante de ingresos con los cuales puede sostener a su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su vehículo y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de reparación urgente para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, para repararlos, Benitos se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, adicionalmente, con este dinero piensa tapizar el asiento de su vehículo para que sus pasajeros viajen cómodamente.

Benitos es una persona trabajadora y responsable, en la zona sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Benitos is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife, his mother-and-father-in law, and his two children. The children are still in his care. He lives in a place called Tranca Sasape. It is a rural area, which belongs to the Mórrope district in the Lambayeque province. It is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years he has devoted himself to providing cargo and passenger transportation service in a “mototaxi” (a vehicle formed by a motorcycle that has a cabin attached to it). He provides service by covering routes that unite his settlement with the areas nearby. Thanks to this activity he gets an important source of income with which he is able to support his family. The continual use of his vehicle and the rugged state of the area’s roads have made his mototaxi start to have some problems. They require urgent repair in order to guarantee that they function correctly. Benitos is requesting, for the first time, a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to make the repairs. He will also use the money to upholster the seat in his vehicle so that his passengers travel comfortably. Benitos is a hard-working and responsible person. His neighbors and acquaintances in the area hold him in high esteem, and they consider him to be a peaceful and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenace expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire laborers for her farm and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Santa María”, está ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano llamado del mismo nombre en el distrito D. Ate, es una alcancía que trabaja con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años, está conformado por 10 socios, asume el cargo D. presidenta la señora Jacinta Juana D. 47 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. 2 hijos en edad académica, se dedica a su bodega desD. hace 7 años en el cual venD. productos alimenticios D. primera necesidad como pan, huevos, leche, azúcar, arroz, gaseosas entre otros. Jacinta incursiono en este negocio porque su esposo la abandono con todos los gastos y no tenia apoyo D. nadie, y sus dos hijos estaban pequeños, además los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos y panchitos en las afueras D. su casa, grupo D. socios se dedican a las actividades D. servicio como ayudante cocinero, otro presta servicio D. albañil y chofer D. transporte público y otro grupo se dedica a la venta D.  comidas y refrescos en los mercados.
Nuestros socios decidieron el nombre D. Santa María ya que en el lugar donD. viven tiene dicho nombre y se sienten más identificados con él, con su reciente préstamo todos los socios lo invertirán para ampliar su pequeño negocio y con ello tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
Los socios están muy contentos y valoran el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a la devolución  del préstamo en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The Santa María Communal Bank is located in the “Asentamiento Humano” (legalized squatter settlement) with the same name in the Ate district. It is a communal bank that has worked with EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad for four years. It is comprised of ten members. Jacinta Juana is the president. She is 47, a single mother, and has two school age children. She has had a grocery store for seven years. She sells basic need foods like bread, eggs, milk, sugar, rice, and soft drinks among other things. Jacinta got into this business because her husband left her with all of the expenses, she did not have help from anyone, and her two children were young. Also, on the week-ends she sells “anticuchos” (a dish maD. with lamb's heart) and “panchitos” (hot dogs) in the areas surrounding her house. The members of this group devote themselves to activities like being a cook’s assistant, providing bricklaying services, and being a public transportation driver. Others in the group sell food and refreshments in the markets. The members decided on the name Santa María because the place where they live has that name, and they felt more recognizable with that name. All of the members will use the new loan to invest in expanding their small businesses. This way they will have a better quality of life. The members are very happy with and value the support provided. They pledge to return the loan punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their small businesses in order to have a better quality of life

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es: Alberta, es una mujer muy carismática, atenta y constate, tiene 70 años, casada con Constantino D. 66 años, ambos tiene 4 hijos que trabajan D. manera independiente en diferentes ciudades, ellos viven en su casa propia, con una D. sus hijas, Susy D. 31 años. Lleva 50 años en la agricultura, en donD. sus propias tierras siempre le han proporcionado productos D. calidad. DesD. entonces siembra maíz, papa, habas, arveja, así como diversidad D. verduras como: lechuga, espinaca, culantro y orégano, que junto a su esposo y su hija, logran cuidar D. sus plantaciones,  asimismo esta familia cría, 5 carneros, varias gallinas y cuy. Lo que más le gusta es pastar y cuidar sus ovejas, sin embargo el tener que regar sus cultivos, le es difícil ya que tiene que hacerlo D. noche y sus pies no soportan el intenso frío D. la sierra. Aun así continuara en su intenso trabajo agrícola, además espera arrendar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Esta es su sexto crédito con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada D. continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, junto a sus integrantes. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos D. abono orgánico, así como semilla D. maíz D. la variedad “Cuzco”.
texts.en:
Alberta is a very charismatic, considerate, and perseverant woman. She is 70 years old, and she is married to 66 year old Constantino. They have four children who work independently in different cities. They live in their own house with one of their daughters, 31 year old Susy. She has been working in farming her own fields for 50 years. Her land has always provided quality products. She plants corn, potatoes, beans and peas. There is a diversity of greens like lettuce, spinach, coriander, and oregano. Together with her husband and daughter she takes care of the crops. At the same time, this family is raising five sheep, various hens, and guinea pigs. What she likes the most is taking care of the sheep and taking them to pasture. Nevertheless, having to water the crops is difficult for her because she has to do it at night. Her feet cannot bear the intense cold of the mountain range. Even so, she will continue with her arduous farm work. Also, she hopes to rent more land to increase her production. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic about continuing to work with the members in her communal bank. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer and the “Cuzco” variety of corn seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various sacks of organic fertilizer and a variety of corn seeds.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 42 años, es un buen padre de familia, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su pareja Julia (33)  y sus 4 hijos que son su motivación diaria.Desde hace 20 años, se dedica al cultivo de papa, alverjas, maíz, y diversas verduras. Realiza su labor  junto a su cónyuge, y con la ayuda de sus hijos, ya que siempre mantiene limpios sus terrenos. Lo  que más le gusta es sembrar justo en la temporada, no antes ni después, de otro modo le resulta difícil retirar la mala hierba de las chacras, porque al regarlas  crecen junto a sus cultivos. El trabajo  de la agricultura para José, es bastante rentable, porque le ha permitido adquirir varios  bienes, como  su casa, sus terrenos agrícolas y demás enseres, por eso no piensa dejar de lado el labrado de la tierra, además pretende instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa, aprovechando que no hay un negocio así  por la zona donde vive.Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además dice sentirse satisfecho con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes trabajan para pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.José tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues tiene como  ventaja que sus terrenos son de  acceso a riego, y de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and a good father, living in his own house with his partner Julia (aged 33) and four children, who motivate him every day. For 20 years, he has been growing potatoes, peas, corn and various vegetables. His partner works with him on the land and his children also lend a hand, as he always keeps his plots well-tended. He prefers to sow in just the right season, not too early or too late, otherwise it is difficult to remove the weeds from the plots, because when he irrigates them they grow alongside his crops. Farming work is quite profitable for José, because it has allowed him to acquire various personal assets such as his house, farming land and other possessions. This is why he doesn’t intend to stop working the land, but also intends to set up a grocery store business in his house, since there is no other similar business in the area he lives in. This is the first time he has requested an MFP loan, and he is very grateful to everyone who has made the money available for him to continue working. He says he is also impressed by the achievements of the members of his communal group, who work to pay their quotas on time. José plans to invest the money requested in the purchase of several sacks of fertiliser to spread on his crops, since he has the advantage of irrigating his plots, and in this way he hopes to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser to improve the quality of this crops

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
La señora Shirley Gladis socia emprendedora y entusiasta, tiene 62 años de edad, divorciada, con  3 hijos mayores de edad, su domicilio está ubicado  en la zona de Vitarte,  departamento de  Lima, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace 20 años, se inicio invitada por una amiga, queriendo ser independiente, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ceviche por las necesidades que tenía que cubrir en su hogar. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo- Prosperidad desde hace 2 años, asume el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Dios es amor y mi guía” la cual está  conformada por 8 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta de ropa, venta de comida, bodega y otros.
Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar mercadería para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Hasta el momento ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales los gastos de su casa y la titulación de su hija.
texts.en:
Sra. Shirley Gladis, an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial associate, is 62 years old. She's divorced and has 3 grown children. She lives in the Vitarte area of the Peruvian "departamento" of Lima. She has earned a living selling beauty products for 20 years, a business she started with advice from a friend who knew that she wanted an independent income. Before that, she operated a business selling ceviche because she had to cover the household expenses. She started working with Edaprospo-Prosperdad two years ago and she is now president of the Dios es amor y mi guia (God is love and my guide) community bank, a group of 8 members who operate a range of businesses such as: recycling, clothing sales, food sales, a general store and more. With this loan, Sra. Shirley plans to buy merchandise for her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers. Up to now, she has successfully helped her children start professional careers, paid her own expenses and helped her daughter through university.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 31 años, es una mujer muy entusiasta y laboriosa que vive en su casa propia con su pareja Edwin, de 32 años y sus dos hijos, que son su motivación diaria, para emprender nuevos retos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace14 años, siendo su principal fuente de ingreso económico, en tanto su esposo, quien trabaja dando el servicio de transporte público en su vehículo, también la apoya en este trabajo agrícola.  Los productos que cultiva son: café, plátano y piña en terrenos que ya cuenta, y una vez cosechado, los comercializa a los centros acopiadores de la ciudad de Lima. La calidad de productos que vende es de calidad, es parte de su ventaja por el cual recibe buenas rentas, pero le cuesta tener que cargar las cajas pesadas. Con el tiempo Liz aprendió a administrar su capital, su trabajo le ha sido muy rentable, por eso, más adelante, quiere comprar 3 carros, con ello emprender una empresa de transportes que cubra la ruta Pichanaki – Yurinaki que se encuentra en la selva central del Perú. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está segura que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus diversas plantaciones.
texts.en:
Liz, 31, is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She lives in a house she owns with her partner, Edwin, 32, and their two children. The children are her reason for getting up every day and meeting the challenges she faces. Liz has worked on farms since she was 14 years old and farming is her main source of income. Her husband, who works as taxi driver, also works on the farm. They grow coffee, bananas and pineapple on land that the own and, after they harvest the crop, sell it to a warehouse in the city of Lima. The quality of their crop is very high, an advantage because they receive a good return on it, but the crop is difficult to carry to market. Over time, Liz has learned to manage her business and her hard work has made it very profitable. In the future, she would like to buy 3 vehicles so that she can start a business transporting goods along the Pichanaki-Yurinaki route through the central jungle of Peru. This is Liz's second MFP loan and she is sure that she can repay it on time like she did the first loan. She also likes working with her community group. She will use this loan to buy bags of organic manure that she will spread around her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Yencala Leon, un area rural que pertenece al distrito de Lambayeque se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves. El cría los animales para luego sacrificarlos y vender su carne entre los vecinos de la zona. Este negocio es de mucha importancia para su comunidad ya que provee de carne a sus vecinos que no pueden ir hasta el mercado para adquirirla porque la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del centro de la ciudad.

Andrés ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, su primer préstamo fue utilizado en la compra de más animales con los cuales pudo ampliar sus ventas, actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Andrés sigue trabajando para brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, en la zona. sus vecinos y conocidos le siguen teniendo mucha estima y le consideran alguien confiable
texts.en:
Andres, 30, is single and lives with his parents in Yencala Leon, a rural area that is part of the Lambayeque district some 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has operated a business raising and selling pigs and poultry for six years. He raises the animals, slaughters them and sells the meat to local people. The business is important to the community because it supplies meat to locals who would otherwise have to go to a market in the town which lies well away from the community. Andres has worked with Kiva before. He used his first loan to buy more animals so that he could increase his sales. He now wants to expand the business further by buying a balanced feed that will ensure his animals develop in the best way. He is applying for a 2,000-soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the business. Andres continues to work to provide his parents with a better quality of life. His neighbors and acquaintances hold him in high regard and consider him to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for pig and poultry business.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
La  alcancía comunal denominado “Camino al éxito” está ubicado en la zona D. Ansieta Alta, en el distrito D. El Agustino, se encuentra  representado por la señora  Rubí, y está conformada por 11 socios que radican en dicha zona. Rubí tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales uno está en la universidad y otro se encuentra en edad académica, el negocio al cual se dedica es la confección D. chalecos, buzos, faldas, blusas entre otros, desD. hace tres años, decidió incursionar en este negocio porque tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar costura en una capilla cerca a su domicilio.
Trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, nuestros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. comida rápida en los mercados, otros socios a la venta D. jugos, golosinas y otros socios a la venta D. ropa; con el reciente préstamo otorgado, la señora Rubí comprara materiales para confeccionar (tela polar, hilos agujas, etc.), todos los demás socios incrementaran su capital para así obtener una mayor productividad, mejor posesión en el mercado y captar mayores clientes. Los socios tienen grandes sueños y metas y se encuentran, muy agradecidos con la institución por todo el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos, seguir trabajando y no defraudarlos. (niños en la foto hijos D. las socias).
texts.en:
The Camino al exito (Road to success) community outreach project is located in Ansieta Alta, an area in the district of El Agustino. The group has 11 members, all from the area, and is represented here by Rubi. Rubi is 48 years old and married with 4 children, one at university and one still school aged. She has operated a business for three years, making and selling hats, sweaters, skirts and blouses among other things. She decided to pursue this line of work after she had the opportunity to learn tailoring at a local church. They have worked with EDAPROSPO for 3 years. The members operate a range of businesses: sales of prepared food, juices, sweets, and clothes. Rubi is buying, with a recent loan, materials (fabric, thread, needles, etc.) to make the products she sells. The other members will increase their capital so that they become more productive or gain a better position in the market or capture more customers. The members have big dreams and goals and they are very grateful to the institution for the help it provides them. All are committed to repaying their loans, continuing their businesses and acting in good faith. (The children in the photo are children of the members.)

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 38 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra, lomas y montañas con una ecología en disolución). Ella hace 5 años atrás vende joyería bañada en oro, para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Poco a poco a podido surtir mas su joyería, algo que siempre le compran sus clientes son las cadena de bisutería que tiene para mujeres, trabaja todos los días, no tiene horario fijo porque tiene que vender hasta cuando sus hijos llegan de las escuela. Con el préstamo quiere comprar bisutería como cadenas, pulseras, anillos. 

En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener un local para su negocio y asi pasa mas tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 38, lives at Fortin de Guayaquil (a semi-urban area of dirt roads, hills and mountains in Ecuador that is being environmentally degraded). She started selling costume jewelry 5 years ago so that she could help with household expenses. Little by little, Rosa has managed to increase her stock of jewelry. Women's jewelry chains have always been popular with her customers. She works every day. There's no fixed schedule but she works until her children come home from school. With this loan, she wants to buy chains, bracelets, and rings. In the future, Rosa wants to improve her house, have a space for a shop and spend more time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy costume jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana, de 40 años, es una madre de familia, que vive con su esposo Venancio (50), ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con el menor de ellos, en su casa que es propia.Cada mañana, luego de atender a sus vacas, sale a cultivar papa, habas, alverjas, maíz, y verduras, ya lleva en esta actividad 25 años, junto a su esposo, quien muchas veces prefiere que ella se quede en casa preparando los alimentos. Los terrenos propios y arrendados que siembran le dejan ingresos económicos considerables que utiliza para cubrir los gastos domésticos, la educación de sus hijos y sobre todo para ahorrar dinero. De las vacas que cría esmeradamente, extrae la leche que le sirve para elaborar quesos, y luego  ofrece sus quesos en las tiendas de su localidad, y en las ferias semanales.
