Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad, también piensa reinstalar la tienda de venta de comestibles que tenía en su casa.Es  la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  se siente satisfecha de trabajar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque todos son personas solidarias y responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Rosana tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios  sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus sembríos de papa, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Rosana, 40, is a mother of 3 who lives with her husband, Venancio, 60, in their own house. Only the youngest still lives with them. Each morning after taking care of the cows, she goes to the fields to farm potatoes, beans, legumes, corn and vegetables. She has been farming for 25 years together with her husband although he frequently prefers that she stay home preparing the food. The fields that they work are their own and rented ones and these yield considerable income that they use for household expenses, their children's education, and especially to save money. From the cows that she carefully cares for, she is able to extract milk that she uses to make cheese, and then sell the cheese in local stores and at weekly markets. In the future she is thinking about planting more, and also to again set up the food store that she had in her home. This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan with MFP, and she feels satisfied that she works with the members of the communal bank, because the people are all supportive and responsible with their payments. Rosana is planning on using the loan to buy sacks of fertilizer that she will spread over her potato crops, and thus she will continue prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary Luz, de 22 años es una joven entusiasta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante, convive con su pareja Powel, de 24 años y su pequeño hijo, en casa sus suegros. Tanto el café y plátano que produce Mary Luz, son los mejores de esta zona de la selva central, y esto se debe a los cuidados adecuados y a la dedicación que emplean ella y su pareja. Todos los días, luego de preparar los alimentos, se dirigen a sus terrenos para limpiarlos y mantenerlos libres de maleza, y evitar que las plagas ataquen sus plantaciones o frutos. Lleva 3 años dedicados a la agricultura, disfruta mucho esta actividad, asegura además que le es muy rentable, ya que le permite contar siempre con algo de dinero para seguir invirtiendo en ello, con tal de tener una mejor productividad, por eso no descansará hasta lograr ser una de las mejores y más reconocidas productoras de su localidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy animada de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, donde trabajará de manera activa y respetando la decisión que adopte la mayoría para bien del grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus diversas plantaciones, para que se desarrollen con rapidez.
texts.en:
Mary Luz, 22, is an enthusiastic youth who has a strong desire to succeed. She lives with her partner, Powel, who is 24, and their small son in the home of her in-laws. Both the coffee and the bananas that Mary Luz produces are the best in this area of the central rainforest, and this is due to the appropriate care that she gives her crops, and the dedication of Mary Luz and her partner. Each day after preparing the food, they go to their land to clear it and maintain it free of brush, so that they can avoid the pests that attack their crops and fruit. She has worked in agriculture for 3 years, and she enjoys this activity very much. In addition, she has found that it is very profitable, since it allows her to always have some extra money that she can keep investing in it, thus increasing her productivity. That's why she will not rest until she has become one of the best and most well-known producers in her area. This is the first time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about belonging to a communal group where she will work in an active manner, respecting the decisions that are made by the majority for the good of the group. With the loan she requests, she will buy a number of bags of organic fertilizer that she will scatter amongst her various crops, so that they will grow more rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Maria de Jesus B. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Juan Bosco de la ciudad de Choluteca, Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, tiene poco tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, nos comento que por los momentos le va bien con su negocio ya que en los fardos de ropa americana la variedad es muy buena y sobre todo la calidad y la marca de la ropa. esto hace que las prendas se vendan rapido y a un buen precio.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar un fardo de ropa ya que no tiene mucho inventario.
las ganancias las utilizara para cubrir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus B., 29, lives in the San Juan Bosco neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. Maria sells used clothing. She has been doing this work for only a short time. She tells us that at the moment her business is going well, since in the bales of American clothing the variety is very good and so are the quality and the brands of the clothing. Because of this her garments sell quickly and at a good price. She will use this loan to buy a bale of clothing, since she does not have much inventory. She will use the profits to cover the expenses of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Solange Elizabeth

texts.es:
la joven solange Elizabeth C. P. tiene 21 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Luis de la ciudad de Choluteca, Solange es una mujer muy trabajadora se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Solange es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo, cuando sale a vender su ropa quien le cuida su hijo es su abuela.
todos los dias se levanta temprano para hacer los trabajos diarios de la casa y luego salir a vender su producto. los tiempos libres se los dedica a su hijo.
el prestamo lo utilzara para comprar mas ropa y zapatos para tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
The youthful Solange Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in Barrio San Luis in the city of Choluteca. Solange is a very hard-working woman who dedicates herself to selling used American clothing. She's been doing this for 3 years. Solange is a single mother who has one son. When she is out selling clothes, her grandmother cares for her son. Every day she rises early to do the household chores, then leaves to sell her goods. Her free time is dedicated to her son. The loan will be utilized to buy more clothes and shoes and improve sales and earnings, which Solange needs to cover her son's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BAGS OF AMERICAN USED CLOTHING AND SHOES TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Grisell Del Rocío

texts.es:
Grisell tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y vive en el distrito de Paiján, una zona de regular movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en aoyar a su familia en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Grisell desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Grisell es una mujer alegre y empeñosa, sus clientes están contentos con su atención, ya que ella siempre trata de asesorarlos al momento de adquirir su producto, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y ayudar a los suyos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Grisell is single, 31 years old, and lives in the district of Paiján. Paiján is a commercially vibrant area located in the province of Ascope in the La Libertád region. It is two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells beauty products and cosmetics by catalog. She already has built up a group of customers who buy her products regularly; the more orders she fills, the more points she gets from the company that provides the products and the more she earns. For this reason, she is always trying to get more and more clients. She uses the income she earns from this work to pay her personal expenses and to help provide for her family. Grisell would like to have a stable source of money so she can buy more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics. This will allow her clients to get the products they need quickly without having to wait until the end of the month, when orders are placed. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for 100 soles ($375) so she can achieve this goal. Grisell is a hardworking and contented woman. Her clients are happy with her service, since she always gives them advice about what they buy. She hopes to keep growing as a businesswoman and to help her family to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to build her catalog sales business

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "EL ARBOLITO"

La señora María pertenece a la alcancia comunal "EL ARBOLITO" la cual ya tiene 2 años trabajando con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, tiempo en que las socias han aprendido a ahorrar y buscar un mejor futuro para ellas mismas.

La señora María comenzó años atrás vendiendo comida, pero no le fue muy bien, asi que pensó en tener un negocio más tranquilo, pasó el tiempo y su padre se enfermó al punto de llevarlo a una clínica para su tratamiento, entonces María pensó en apresurar las cosas y puso una tienda en su casa, comenzó vendiendo caramelos y dulces, pero le daba el tiempo suficiente para cuidar a su papá.
Luego poco a poco empezó a colocar mas productos en su tienda, como arroz, azucar, leche, etc, productos de primera necesidad, hasta que su amiga, otra señora que vendía vegetales, le propuso que pelara aji, como trabajo, fue así que mientras María atendía su bodega, el tiempo libre que tenía lo aprovechaba para pelar aji, trayendo otro ingreso a su familia.
María planea crecer como persona y hacer crecer su negocio, comprando más artículos y de mayor varidad para atender la demanda de sus clientes.
Sueña con la idea de que su negocio cresca más como un árbol, hasta verlo como un supermercado.
texts.en:
Sra. María is part of the Communal Bank “El Arbolito” (The Little Tree), which already has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for two years. During this time the members have learned how to save and find a better future for themselves.

Sra. María started selling food several years ago, but she did not do very well. She thought about opening another business that was less hectic. As time passed, her father became ill to the point that he had to seek treatment at a clinic. María felt pressured to start a business, so she established a store in her home and began selling candy and sweets, which would provide her sufficient time to care for her father.

Slowly she began adding more products to her store such as rice, sugar, milk, and other basic necessities. A friend of hers who sold vegetables offered her a job peeling chili peppers that she could perform without neglecting her store. María takes advantage of any free time she has to peel chili peppers so that she can earn additional income for her family.

María plans to continue developing as a person and making her business grow. She wants to buy more products in greater variety so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. Her dream is to see her business continue to grow, like a tree, and see it converted into a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase oil, sugar, beans, detergent, and other basic necessities

loans.name: Zapote 2 Group

texts.es:
el grupo Zapote 2 esta ubicado en la aldea el Zapote en la ciudad de Choluteca, lo integran 4 mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante. a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:
doña Maricela G. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia y ropa, la cual la distribuye en varias aldeas cercanas a su residencia y tambien vende en su casa de habitacion. el credito le sera de mucho beneficio para poder 
trabajar y obtener mucha ultilidades. el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia.
doña Ana V. se dedica a la  venta de gallinas, las vende en lugares como el Triunfo, Guasaule y Choluteca esta actividad la realiza de hace varios años, con el credito podra hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mas ganancias y de esta manera tener una mejor calida de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar gallinas.
doña Felipa L. tambien se dedica a la venta de gallinas, las vende en localidades y comunidades cercanas a su casa de habitacion, con el credito comprara mas gallinas. 
doña Gloria O. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas abarroterria y de esta manera poder tener buenos
ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The Zapote 2 Group consists of four hardworking women who have great desire to succeed. They live in the neighborhood of Zapote in the city of Choluteca. A detailed description of their business activities is provided below:

Doña Maricela G. sells merchandise and clothing and distributes her products to different neighborhoods near where she lives. She also sells her goods out of her home. Her loan will be very useful to her because it will allow her to continue working and obtain many benefits. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise.

Doña Ana V. sells chickens in different places such as Triunfo, Guasaule, and Choluteca. She has been in this business for several years. Her loan will enable her to increase her business and generate more income since it will be used to buy more chickens.

Doña Felipa L. also sells chickens in towns and communities near her home. She will use her loan to buy more chickens.

Doña Gloria O. sells popular consumer products. She has a small store in her home. Her loan will be used to buy more groceries so that she can generate a good income to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Irma Deisy

texts.es:
La sra. Irma Deisy M. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene su pulperia en su casa de habitacion, este negocio es visitado por muchas personas ya que tiene variedad y buenos precios en los productos que vende.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercaderia como ser arroz, frijoles, quesos, confites, refrescos, churros, aceite, margarina, manteca etc.
tendra mas venta y asi tendra ingresos para satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma Deisy M. is an enterprising woman who sells popular consumer products from a store inside of her home. Her business is frequented by many people since it offers a variety of products and good prices.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, cheese, candy, soft drinks, donuts, oil, margarine, lard, and other items. Irma would like to generate more sales so that she can have income to meet her needs and those of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Madres Trabajadoras De San Juan Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "LAS MADRES TRABAJADORAS DE SAN JUAN"

La alcancía comunal "LAS MADRES TRABAJADORAS DE SAN JUAN" esta formada por mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar y familia.
Mujeres como Vilma, que es madre de 4 hijos en su mayoría independientes, ella desde hace 4 años atrás trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD tiempo en que su negocio ha mejorado.
Vilma comenzó vendiendo cosméticos, tomando su casa como punto de ventas, sin embargo salía a promocionar sus productos a sus amigas o vecinos.
Luego por causa de un familiar enfermo, que en el hospital lo desahuciaron, ella pudo entablar conversación con una enfermera que le comento de unos productos naturales que podrían ayudar a su familiar, fue así que ella se inscribió para adquirir esos productos a un costo menor entonces trató a su familiar con los mismos, y dieron resultados positivos, ya que demostraron que los médicos del hospital se equivocaron, paso un par de años hasta que su familiar falleció pero antes vivió mucho tiempo mas de lo previsto por los médicos.
También Vilma esta inscrita como vendedora de productos de acero quirúrgico, como ollas, cuchillos, sartenes etc. los cuales vende a sus clientes.
Con las ganancias de sus ventas ella ha conseguido comprar una refrigeradora, una congeladora, una cocina industrial, un mostrador, objetos que no son comprados por darse lujo, sino que Vilma planea poner un restaurante en un local que ella posee, y así estar mas tiempo en casa dedicándose exclusivamente a su restaurante.
Sueña en administrar el negocio del restaurante y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Madres Trabajadoras de San Juan” (The Working Mothers of San Juan) consists of enterprising women who work day after day to meet the household needs of their families. One of these women is Vilma, who is the mother of four adult children who are independent. She has been working four years with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad and was able to improve her business during this time. Vilma began selling cosmetics, using her home as a base for generating sales. She still had to leave her home to promote her products to her friends and neighbors.

After a relative became ill and required hospitalization, Vilma struck up a conversation with a nurse who told her about some natural products that could help her family. She signed up to acquire these products at low cost and tried them on the family member who was ill. Good results were achieved, which proved that the doctors at the hospital were wrong. The relative eventually passed away, but lived two years longer than what the doctors had expected.

Vilma also signed up to become a vendor of surgical products made of steel such as pans, scalpels, trays, and other items to sell to her customers. The earnings from her sales have enabled her to buy a refrigerator, a freezer, an industrial oven, a counter, and other necessities. She plans to open a restaurant using a space she already has. This will allow her to spend more time at home and dedicate herself exclusively to her restaurant.

She dreams of managing her restaurant business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase health products to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 33 años, vive con su esposo  Rodolfo (42), y sus  tres hijos, juntos  habitan  su casa propia, que esta ubicada en una zona muy tranquila de la selva peruana.Desde hace 7 años, se dedica al cultivo de café, junto a su esposo, quien con mucha paciencia le enseño todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias. A ella le gusta tener sus plantaciones limpias y protegidas contra  los cambios climáticos o la proliferación de las plagas, sin embargo, le disgusta que los acopiadores, muchas veces le regateen el precio de sus productos. Esta convencida que sus productos son de calidad por lo que siempre busca  ser bien remunerada, y para más adelante, piensa incrementar su producción de café, además quiere surtir mejor su tienda para dinamizar sus ventas, ya que pretende atender durante todo el día. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles.Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y  como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo, asegura que le gusta pertenecer a su grupo comunal, donde ahorra mensualmente y aprende de las experiencias del resto de sus compañeros.Angélica tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  plantas de café y también contratara operarios, para que trabajen su chacra, y de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Angélica is 33 years old and lives with her husband Rodolfo, age 42, and their three children. They reside in their own home located in a peaceful area of the Peruvian jungle. For the past seven years she has been growing coffee with her husband, who had the patience to teach her all the necessary farming techniques. She likes having fields that are clean and protected from weather changes and infestation of pests. On the other hand, she does not like dealing with the collectors who haggle over the price of her products. Angélica is convinced that her products are of good quality so she should always be well compensated. To get ahead, she wants to increase her coffee production as well as increase the inventory in her store to boost daily sales. In addition to farming, she also manages a store where she sells food and basic necessities.

This is her second loan with MFP. Angélica is already familiar with the work methodology of her Communal Bank, so she enjoys being part of the group. She saves on a monthly basis and has learned from the experiences of the other members. Angélica plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of coffee plants. She will also hire laborers to work in her fields in hopes of making continued progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & hire laborers

loans.name: Geovanny Javier

texts.es:
Geovanny de 34 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra, lomas y montañas con una ecología en disolución). El tiene una papelería (llamada en Ecuador bazar). 

Empezó hace 12 años vendiendo lentes para una óptica, poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a venderlos a almacenes. Pero como quería mas ingresos invirtió sus ahorros en papelería y compro vitrinas para tener su propio negocio. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Para agrandar mas el negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, y confites. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Geovanny is 34 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a mountainous periuban area with dirt roads, hills, and a deteriorating ecosystem). He manages a stationery shop called “Ecuador Bazaar”.

Twelve years ago, Geovanny began selling eyeglasses for an optician. Over time and with some effort, he was able to distribute these items to stores. However, he wanted to generate more income, so he invested his savings in a stationery shop and bought display cabinets to start his own business. He works every day from 6am until 9pm.

To expand his business Geovanny will use his loan to buy notebooks and candy. In the future, he wants to finish the construction of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks & candy

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Las Palmeras.
Irma es separada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Irma tiene un taller de confección en su casa en donde confecciona ropas típicas como centros ayacuchanos entre otras prendas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija y en algunas oportunidades con otras personas dependiendo de la demanda, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también vende en las ferias.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas.
Los sueños de Irma son educar a sus hijos y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Palmeras” (The Palms). She is separated from her spouse and has four children in school. Irma has a sewing workshop in her home where she makes traditional clothing such as Ayacuchano flannel dresses and other types of garments. She operates her business with the help of her daughter and occasionally other people depending on the level of demand. Her sales are conducted at the markets in the city of Ayacucho and also at the fairs.

Irma needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of fabrics. Her dreams include providing an education for her children and increasing her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Isabel P. es una mujer muy responsable que se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en estos momentos no tiene muy surtido su negocio.
este negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico ya que la afluencia de personas es bastante grande.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas productos y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
nos comento que las ventas han aumentado pero que no tiene capital suficiente para poder comprar mas productos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is a responsible woman who is dedicated to selling groceries. She has a small store in her house. Currently, her business is not well stocked. This business is located in a strategic place since the influx of people is quite large. She will use the loan to buy more products and better stock her business. She has told us that her sales have grown but she doesn't have enough capital to be able to buy more products. She needs her earnings to cover her house and family bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize flour, tortillas, beans, refreshments, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margerine, soap, pastas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tuvo 8 hijos, de los cuales 7 ya son independientes y uno esta estudiando en un instituto, y su mayor sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y obtenga su titulo. Adriana viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales que lego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Adriana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas y gasolinas.
Adriana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y solicita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y bebidas. 
Adriana tiene como meta ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Adriana had eight children, of whom seven are already independent and one is studying at an institue. Her greatest dream is that her son finishes his education and obtains his degree. Adriana travels to markets where she buys cereals that she then sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Adriana has a shop in her house where she sells drinks and gasoline. Adriana belongs to the Las Palmeras Community Bank and she is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of wheat, barley and drinks. Adriana's goal is to expand her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wheat, barley and drinks.

loans.name: Teodomira

texts.es:
Teodomira es viuda y tuvo 4 hijos, ahora tiene 6 nietos que están a su responsabilidad porque su hija falleció, sus nietos están estudiando, Teodomira es el único sustento de su familia. Su mayor sueño es que sus nietos sean profesionales.
Teodomira tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende carne, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 11 de la mañana y en las madrugadas vende en el mercado Nery, los animales los adquiere en las ferias y también de la ciudad de Lima. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de carnero y cerdo. Teodomira tiene proyectado comprar una congeladora para guardar la carne.
Teodomira es socia del  Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Teodomira is widowed and has four children. She now has six grandchildren whom she must care for because her daughter passed away. Her grandchildren attend school. Teodomira is her family’s only means of support. Her greatest dream is that her grandchildren become professionals. She has a small stall in the city’s central market, where she sells meat. She does this daily from 11:00 AM and in the early morning she sells in the Nery market. She buys her animals in the local fairs and in Lima. She will use the money from this loan to buy sheep and hogs and plans to buy a freezer to store the meat. Teodomira is an associate of the Las Palmeras communal bank. What she likes the most is the training.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sheep and hogs

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina Isabel, tiene 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. San Carlos, departamento D. Morazán, es casada tiene cuatro hijos Antonio, Flor, Catalino, Eli D. las edades D. 13,10, 8 y 2 años respectiva, ella tiene una venta D. pupusas y bebidas.
Ella se dedica a varias actividades, durante el día venD. tamales, y trabaja con la venta D. pupusas y bebidas por las noches en el lugar donD. resiD., cuando hay fiestas D. su pueblo sale  a vender. Reina es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por solventar las necesidades básicas D. sus hijos; actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra D. materiales para su venta D. pupusas, ella invertirá en Maíz, aceite, queso, carne, bebidas carbonatadas, para su clientes que demandan estos productos.
Los sueños D. reina son que sus hijos se superen con los estudios, ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad D. superarse.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel is 43 years old. She resides in the municipality of San Carlos in Morazan. She is married and has four children: Antonio, Flor, Catalino and Eli who are 13, 10, 8 and 2 years old, respectively. She sells pupusas (El Salvadoran bread pockets) and drinks. She is dedicated to various activities. During the day, she sells tamales and, at night, she works selling pupusas and drinks from her house. When her town has festivities, she goes out and sells. Reina is a hard-working person who fights to proviD. basic necessities to her children. Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase materials for her pupusa business. She will invest in maize, oil, cheese, meat, carbonated drinks since her customers demand those products. Reina's dreams are that her children succeed with their education since they don't have the opportunity to succeed otherwise.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase maize, oil, cheese, meat and carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su pareja  Wilmer (28) y su pequeño hijo, por quien se esfuerza cada día.Le gusta sentir la tranquilidad que le transmite el campo, por eso lleva 6 años cultivando café y piña, en sus terrenos propios. Para realizar su labor contrata operarios  quienes le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas, pues su esposo trabaja de jornalero en una mina, donde a diario le pagan 25 soles, y en sus días libres también atiende sus cultivos. Ella  considera que su oficio es bastante rentable, si se sabe administrar e invertir bien las ganancias obtenidas, además refiere -“si cuidas adecuadamente tus plantaciones, es seguro que obtendrás una buena cosecha que te retribuirá todo el esfuerzo que desempeñaste”. Para mas adelante tiene pensado incrementar la cantidad de sus plantaciones, principalmente de café  - producto natural muy solicitado y bien remunerado.Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmada de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, además sabe que son personas responsables y solidarias.Elva tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues quiere obtener mayores ganancias que le permitirán seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Elva is 27 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband Wilber (28) and her young son for whom she exerts herself every day. She enjoys the tranquility of the countryside. This is why she has spent the past six years raising coffee and pineapples on her own farmland. She hires farmhands who help her with her agricultural work. Her husband works as a miner where he is paid 25 PEN (about $9) per day. Oh his days off he also tends to the crops. She considers her occupation to be very profitable if one knows how to administer and invest the earnings. She says, “If you care well for your plantings, you will certainly have a good harvest that will repay you for all the hard work you put in.” She plans to increase the amount of plantings in the future, mainly coffee – a natural product that is in good demand and is well paid for. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is excited about continuing to work with her fellow communal bank members. She knows that they are all solid and responsible people. Elva plans to use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer that she will spread on her crops. She wants to increase her income which will allow her to continue to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela es conviviente y esta esperando su primer hijo, vive en la casa de sus suegros y su mayor sueño es construir su casa.
Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones.
Marianela tiene un puesto en el mercado de plantas Aprovisa, en donde vende plantas ornamentales, flores, entre otros, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y también las cultiva, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su pareja. Además Marianela tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Américas en donde vende ganchos, aretes, actividad que dejo de realizar por el momento por lo cuidadoso de su estado. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de macetas y plantas.
texts.en:
Marianela lives with her partner and is expecting her first child. She lives in the home of her in-laws and her greatest dream is to build her house. She is a member of the Las Palmeras Community Bank and she is most grateful for the training sessions. Marianela has a stall in the Aprovisa plant market, where she sells ornamental plants, and flowers, among others. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and also grows them, an activity that she does with the help of her partner. Marianela also has a stall in the Las Americas market where she sells charms and earrings, an activity that she has stopped for the moment to take care of her pregnancy. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of flowerpots and plants.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of flowerpots and plants

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, que vive con su pareja Giovanni, de 37 años y sus cuatro hijos, en su casa propia, el cuál construyó para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Lleva 15 años dedicada al cultivo de café y plátanos, en donde su esposo la acompaña en este trabajo que le resulta gratificante, ya que depende de ello para mantener a su familia. Por tanto procura cuidar estas plantaciones e incrementar su producción. Por otro lado, administra una tienda, instalada en el interior de su casa, en donde aprovecha la afluencia de personas que trabajan en una mina cerca de su domicilio. De esta manera vende productos como: golosinas, bebidas gasificadas y hojas de C. que son muy solicitados por los trabajadores de dicha mina. Por tal razón desea surtir productos de primera necesidad hasta convertirla en un mini Market. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente, como lo hizo en el primer crédito, además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de plantas de café y varios sacos de abono orgánico, que plantará en los terrenos libres que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 32, is a hard-working woman who lives with her partner, Giovanni, age 37, and their four children, in their own home which she built to offer their children a better quality of life. For 15 years she has grown coffee and plantains, with her husband. It is a gratifying job, and she depends on it to maintain their family. Thus, she wants to take care of these crops and increase her production. She also runs a store, located in their home, where she takes advantage of the flow of people who work in a mine close to her home. She sells products such as: candy, soft drinks and C. leaves which are highly requested by the mine workers. For this reason she wants to stock basic products and convert her store into a mini market. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is sure that she will complete each payment on time, as she did on the first loan. Furthermore, she likes working with her community group. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of coffee plants and some bags of organic fertilizer, which she will plant on her empty land.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: th purchase coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones semanales que L. distraen mucho, además que comparte experiencias con sus compañeras.
Haydee es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo D. 3 años, vive en L. casa D. su abueL., Haydee compro su terreno con sus ahorros y sueña con construir su casa.
Haydee venD. carne en el mercado Nery D. manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza 3 dias a L. semana por las mañanas, los animales los compra su mama D. las ferias. Ademas Haydee trabaja en un albergue. Su prestamos era invertido en L. compra D. carne.
texts.en:
Haydee belongs to the Las Palmeras Community Bank and she is most grateful for the weekly meetings which are very interesting, and for the sharing of experiences with her peers. Haydee lives with her partner and has one 3-year-old child. She lives in her grandmother's home. Haydee bought her land with the her savings and dreams of building her house. Haydee sells meat in the Nery market, on the street. She does this 3 days a week in the mornings. Her mother buys the animals at fairs. Haydee also works in a hostel. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of meat.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of meat

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es casada, tiene 6 hijos, D. los cuales solo una y su nieto viven con ella. Teofila junto a su hija tienen un puesto en el mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venden ropa variada, además del alquiler D. disfraces, Teofila tiene un taller D. confecciones en su casa, sus productos los reparte y también atienD. pedidos. Su prestamos era invertido en la compra D. telas y vestidos hechos.
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Las Palmeras y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones.
Los sueños D. Teofila son ampliar sus negocios para coberturar sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Teofila is married and has 6 children, of whom only one daughter, and a grandson, live with her. Teofila and her daughter have a stall in the city's central Ayacucho market, where they sell assorted clothing. On top of costume rentals, Teofila has a sewing shop in her home. She sells her products and also takes orders. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and completed garments. Teofila is a member of the Las Palmeras Community Bank and she most likes the training sessions. Her dream is to expand her business in order to cover her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of fabrics and completed garments.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo C. M., habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe ; junto a su esposa la cual  labora como comerciante , ellos tienen dos hijas  actualmente estudiantes de primaria , don Juan desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento y la alza de productos varios en verduras y legumbres .E l préstamo lo quieren para la mejora de vivienda ya que la ganancia de las frutas no le permite  comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción, y la tormenta Alex que actualmente acecha Managua, dejado problemas en el techo y socavado el muro del frente de su casa, por tal razón solicita este préstamo para poder remodelar las áreas deñadas y que sus hijos moren en un habitad mas seguro.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo C. M. lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. With his wife, who works as a merchant, he has two daughters in elementary school. For four years Juan has sold fruits and vegetables. His greatest difficulty is the lack of financing and the rising prices of vegetables and legumes. He wants this loan to improve his home, since his earnings from fruit do not permit him to purchase construction materials; and the storm "Alex", which is currently threatening Managua, has left him with problems in his roof and has undermined the integrity of the home's front wall. For this reason he is requesting this loan to remodel damaged areas so that his children will live in a safer home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home remodeling
